name: Matthew Ajibade
summary: Ajibade was arrested for alleged battery and taken to the county jail. His girlfriend said she warned officers about Ajibade's mental health issues and gave them his medicine. According to the police account, Ajibade assaulted three officers and was placed in a restraint chair. Footage from a Taser camera shows him being shocked in the groin while in the chair. He was later found dead in his cell. A coroner ruled that Ajibade died from blunt-force injuries. Nine deputies were fired and two indicted with manslaughter. Both were acquitted of manslaughter but found guilty of lesser charges.

name: Lewis Lembke
summary: Three deputies responded to Lembke's home after he allegedly assaulted his wife. Lembke emerged from a doorway holding a gun and refused to put it down, according to police. He was shot twice after pointing the weapon at officers and died at the scene.

name: Michael Kocher Jr
summary: Kocher was hit by a vehicle while he was walking, and the driver stopped and called police. Kocher was alive and responsive, according to eyewitnesses, but the attending officer struck Kocher a second time with his vehicle as he arrived at the accident. He was pronounced dead at the scene.

name: John Quintero
summary: Quintero was reportedly involved in a violent dispute outside his house. When deputies arrived, Quintero allegedly did not comply with orders to get out of his vehicle and place his hands on the car. An officer deployed a Taser, which police said was not effective. Quintero then allegedly reached for his waistband and was shot twice. His uncle, who made one of the 911 calls and witnessed the shooting, said police did not do enough to de-escalate the situation.

name: Tim Elliott
summary: A family member called 911 and said Elliott had shot himself but was still alive. He was said to have threatened suicide. Officers arrived with medical gear but realised Elliott had suffered only minor injuries and was holding a revolver, according to investigators. Officers said Elliott threatened to shoot and did not drop his weapon when commanded. Elliot was shot dead.

name: Matthew Hoffman
summary: Hoffman parked his car in a restricted police parking lot and when asked to leave he brandished a weapon, according to police. Two officers fired 10 shots. A suicide note was reportedly found in his car telling officers: 'Please, don't blame yourself. I used you. I took advantage of you.' His weapon was found to be a replica gun.

name: Kenneth Buck
streetaddress: E Knox Rd and N Exeter St
summary: Buck was identified as a burglary suspect driving a stolen vehicle. Authorities said he opened the door of his truck and fired at police after officers identified his vehicle had false license plates. Three officers were involved in the shooting.

name: Michael Rodriguez
summary: Rodriguez was allegedly threatening his girlfriend and bar customers with a gun. Police say when they arrived Rodriguez pointed 'what appeared to be a handgun' at them and refused to obey commands. He was shot dead. The weapon turned out to be a nail gun.

name: Patrick Wetter
summary: Wetter forced entry into a Stockton home and stabbed a police dog when officers arrived, according to police. Wetter allegedly held the knife over his head and refused to obey orders before police opened fire.

name: Brian Pickett
summary: Pickett was tasered and placed in handcuffs after allegedly charging at officers responding to a 911 call from his mother, who said he was under the influence of amphetamines. He stopped breathing after paramedics arrived and was pronounced dead at hospital. Medical examiners ruled his death 'undetermined' and said he probably suffered excited delirium.
link1text: Guardian: How US police departments have struggled to regulate Tasers, despite dozens of deaths after their use this year

name: Autumn Steele
summary: Steele was fatally shot by an officer who said he was aiming for her dog. The german shepherd could be seen on bodycam footage attacking the officer as he responded to a domestic altercation between Steele and her husband.

name: Brock Nichols
summary: Nichols had reportedly threatened his son. When officers arrived, they saw him drinking alcohol and noted he was therefore in violation of a court order. Nichols reportedly told officers he needed to go to the bathroom and was escorted. He walked into a dark room and allegedly pointed a handgun at both deputies, who opened fire after turning the light on.

name: Leslie Sapp III
lawenforcementagency: US Marshals Service, Pennsylvania State Police, Allegheny County Sheriff's Office
summary: Sapp was wanted for the sexual assault of a teenage girl. Officers found him and opened fire after he held a pellet gun 'in a manner consistent with what one would use when trained to use a handgun against officers,' according to police. He was shot at least four times. A deputy involved in his shooting tested positive for cocaine and lost his job.

name: Nicholas Brickman
summary: Brickman reportedly robbed a credit union and pointed a gun at the bank teller. He fled and was pursued by officers. After abandoning a stolen car, Brickman continued to flee on foot, according to police, and was shot in the torso after pointing his gun at an officer. His mother said he was dealing with 'personal demons'.

name: Joseph Caffarello
summary: Rick Drehobl, an off-duty Rosemont police officer, intervened in a domestic incident involving his brother-in-law, Joseph Caffarello, and his brother-in-law's wife. The argument escalated into a car chase where Joseph Caffarello allegedly rammed his car into his brother-in-law's. Officer Drehobl opened fire, killing Caffarello.

name: Ronald Sneed
summary: Sneed was found lying on top of his girlfriend when police responded to a domestic disturbance, according to authorities. He was told to raise his hands, but instead pointed a handgun at her, police said. The officer then opened fire.

name: Omarr Jackson
summary: Jackson fled from officers who were investigating a suspicious vehicle, according to police. He reportedly fired at one officer as he was chased and was then shot twice. A firearm and illegal drugs were recovered at the scene, according to police. One officer was wearing a body camera which captured the incident on video.

name: Andre Murphy Sr
summary: Murphy struggled with officers at a motel following a disturbance call, according to police. An officer attempted to use his Taser but it is not clear if it was deployed. Both Murphy and an officer were taken to hospital, where Murphy died and the officer was treated for a 'series of injuries'. A grand jury ruled there was no wrongdoing, with toxicology reports finding Murphy had consumed high amounts of methamphetamine and attributed the death to 'excited delirium'. This resulted in an 'accidental death' in hospital, according to the county prosecutor.

name: Loren Simpson
summary: Simpson stole a car and deputies attempted to intercept him on the road, according police. Simpson allegedly drove towards them and both deputies opened fire, one with a shotgun and one with a rifle. The deputies continued a second round of fire after the initial burst. The two deputies involved later resigned from the force. The family have vowed to sue even though both officers were cleared of wrongdoing by a review board.

name: Artago Howard
summary: Howard was shot during a struggle with a deputy who was responding to a burglary alarm at a pharmacy. Police said Howard was trying to reach for the officer's gun, and was shot. Howard fled but was caught outside and later died while police waited for an ambulance, according to authorities.

name: James Barker
summary: Police responded to call about a suspicious person. The incident began calmly but Barker then attacked Officer Matthew Taylor with a snow shovel, according to police. Taylor suffered a broken arm and had his Taser knocked out of his hand, he said. The officer fired three shots after Barker reached for Taylor's holster. The shooting was ruled justified.

name: Thomas Hamby
lawenforcementagency: Syracuse Police Department, Davis County Sheriff's Office
summary: Officers were called to a domestic disturbance after Hamby's wife called 911 and said he had pulled a handgun. Hamby stepped outside the house and allegedly pointed the gun at officers and fired. He was then shot. He died in hospital four days later.

name: Andy Martinez
summary: Martinez, who was wanted in Arizona over a probation violation, was the passenger in car that was pulled over for a traffic violation. He got out and allegedly refused to comply with commands to drop his weapon. An officer fired a single shot and Martinez was killed. The incident was sent to the county attorney to present to a grand jury.

name: Jimmy Foreman
summary: Foreman shot his stepson dead. When an officer arrived at the scene, Foreman did not comply with orders to drop his weapon and allegedly pointed it at the officer. Another England police officer reported hearing Foreman say 'just shoot me'. The county attorney ruled the shooting was justified.

name: Brian Barbosa
summary: Barbosa was a carjacking suspect. He ran from police, attempted to carjack another vehicle and ran into a residential neighborhood, according to police. Police said he was then spotted with a gun and confronted officers. Barbosa was then shot.

name: Salvador Figueroa
summary: Figueroa ran from police in a parking lot and allegedly pulled a handgun after an officer used a Taser on him. He was shot multiple times. Police were initially called to investigate a situation between Figueroa and a woman. Police provided no more details on the initial incident.

name: Tommy Smith
lawenforcementagency: Arcola Police Department, Tuscola Police Department
summary: Smith allegedly threatened a family member with a gun. After initial contact with police, Smith put the handgun away but then re-emerged holding an AR-15 assault rifle and his pistol, according to police. He was shot dead in a volley of bullets. 'Tom was intoxicated. He was drunker than a skunk, and he did have a firearm,' his stepmother told local media.

name: John O'Keefe
streetaddress: Constitution Ave and San Mateo Blvd
summary: O'Keefe was allegedly behaving suspiciously by the roadside and fled when officers arrived. He turned and fired towards pursuing officers, according to eyewitnesses. He was then shot at by two officers and killed. Stolen body armor and a stolen handgun were recovered at the scene, according to police. Only one officer's body camera was recording during the incident.

name: Richard McClendon
summary: McClendon was shot during a confontation with police at home, according to police, who said he was armed with a knife and a piece of pipe. His mother called 911 to report he was having a 'violent episode' and possibly had a gun. When officers arrived McClendon barricaded himself inside the bathroom.

name: Marcus Golden
summary: Officers responded to a 911 call about a man sending threatening text messages and were told the suspect was 'known to carry a gun'. Golden was located in a parking lot and allegedly drove his SUV at one of the attending officers, who then opened fire.

name: Michael Goebel
lawenforcementagency: St Louis County Police Department, Jefferson County Sheriff's Office, Franklin County Sheriff's Office
summary: Goebel, an alleged car thief, drove a truck out of a garage that was surrounded by investigators who had tracked him down. Police said he was shot dead as he drove the truck at officers.

name: Jeffrey Nielson
summary: Nielson fled from officers as they attempted to change his handcuffs after a narcotics stop. He ran to his car and pulled out a knife, according to police. One officer deployed a Taser, but this was unsuccessful. Nielson was then shot. The district attorney ruled the shooting was justified after reviewing body camera footage. This was Officer Jason Vincent's second fatal shooting.

name: Robert Edwards
summary: Edwards was allegedly firing shots in his bedroom. He pointed a handgun at four officers who forced entry into the room, according to police. Three opened fire and Edwards was pronounced dead at the scene. Police conceded it was dark inside the room. Neighbors described Edwards as a caring man and expressed shock that he was killed. The shooting was ruled justified.

name: Talbot Schroeder
summary: Schroeder allegedly stabbed a family member and was instructed to drop the knife by an officer, according to police. He then allegedly confronted the officer, who fired a single shot. Schroeder died at the scene.

name: Louis Becker
streetaddress: New York State Rte 23 and Cairo Junction Rd
summary: Becker was killed in a traffic accident when his vehicle collided with a New York state trooper's SUV on State Route 23. Becker's pickup truck 'entered the roadway into the path of Trooper Walsh', according to police.

name: Quincy Reindl
streetaddress: Nesbitt Ave S and 99th St W
summary: Reindel was reportedly acting suicidal and four officers responded. He was killed by multiple gunshots. It was not confirmed how many gunshots were fired by police or by Reindel himself.

name: Donte Sowell
summary: Sowell had an open warrant for marijuana and was stopped by police. He ran from officers and opened fire, hitting one officer in the foot, according to police. Police opened fire as did a security guard who was in the area, according to witnesses. Sowell's family disputes the police's account and has filed a federal wrongful death lawsuit against the city.

name: Nathan Massey
summary: Massey took his girlfriend hostage in a trailer but she escaped after police said they heard gunshots. Massey was then shot by a trooper through the trailer window.

name: Mario Jordan
summary: Jordan was found by police in the middle of the road, after responding to a call reporting an attempted suicide. Jordan allegedly fired at an officer with his rifle and the officer fired back. Jordan was taken to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead.

name: Jose Ceja
summary: Ceja was reportedly intoxicated and suicidal, and was destroying items in his home, according to police. An officer entered and Ceja allegedly charged with a knife. Police would not say how many rounds the officer fired. Ceja was pronounced dead at the scene.

name: Dewayne Carr
summary: Carr was suspected of credit card fraud along with three other people. According to a police account he was the driver of a car that was boxed in by police during an arrest operation. Police claim the car reversed and hit a detective's vehicle. Two officers opened fire. Carr died in hospital days later. The three other suspects were arrested.

name: Rodney Walker
summary: Walker was arguing with his girlfriend and was reportedly on top of her when an off-duty officer from the department of veterans affairs pulled over. The officer, who was with his family and heading to a music concert, attempted to diffuse the situation, according to the police account. The officer claimed Walker reached for a firearm, and so shot him. But Walker's girlfriend said the argument was over at this point and Walker was walking away. Walker's family have argued the off-duty officer should not have intervened.

name: Kavonda Payton
summary: Payton is alleged to have taken part in an armed robbery. Police responded as he fled in a car. He was asked to drop his firearm and didn't, according to police. He was shot and taken to a nearby hospital where he died.

name: Zaki Shinwary
streetaddress: Lake Arrowhead Ave and Great Salt Lake Dr
summary: Shinwary was reportedly threatening two contract workers with a knife. Officers ordered him to drop the knife and when he failed to do so was shot and tasered, according to police. He died at the scene.

name: Sinthanouxay Khottavongsa
summary: Police said Khottavongsa was seen holding a crowbar in a 'threatening manner'. Police used a Taser and he fell to the ground, hitting his head. He died days later in hospital, with the medical examiner attributing the death to a blunt trauma. His family says he was not a threat and was helping a friend with repair work at the time.

name: Howard Robbins
summary: Robbins was hit by a police cruiser while walking to a friend's house at night. The officer attempted to perform CPR but Robbins was pronounced dead at the scene. Stanford's mayor fired the officer, Travis Richardson, following a hearing.

name: Phillip Garcia
summary: Garcia was confronted by an off-duty police officer following an altercation outside a restaurant. According to police, Garcia refused to drop a firearm. Garcia died from multiple gunshot wounds, according to the medical examiner's office.

name: Scott Hall
summary: Hall was fatally shot and two other suspects were arrested after allegedly opening fire on officers following a car chase. Two firearms were recovered at the scene. Authorities gave no information on why Hall and the others were being pursued.

name: Terence Walker
summary: Walker was allegedly sending his ex-girlfriend death threats and had come to a church wedding she was attending carrying a handgun. The pastor called police and an officer arrived. Walker fled during a patdown and during the chase allegedly dropped his gun, picked it up and turned to the officer, who opened fire. Bodycam footage appears to show Walker had his back turned at the time he was shot. The shooting was later ruled justified by the district attorney, who said Walker pointed the weapon at the officer.

name: Pablo Meza
summary: Meza was found topless and firing shots into the air. Police ordered him to put his gun down, but he refused and was shot dead, according to officials. Witnesses said they feared for their lives and heard Meza shouting 'closed casket'.

name: Daniel Brumley
summary: Brumley was pulled over for a traffic violation. The officer realized an arrest warrant was out on his name and attempted to arrest him. Police said Brumley pulled a knife and stabbed the officer multiple times before the officer opened fire. Brumley's family argued he acted in self-defense. An autopsy showed Brumley was shot at multiple times from behind and had lesions on his hands.

name: Johnathon Guillory
streetaddress: Greenland Park Dr and Cobblestones Farms Dr
summary: Guillory was seen carrying an unidentified weapon in a park. He was shot dead after officers said they feared for their safety. Police provided no further details. Guillory was an Iraq and Afghanistan war veteran and had PTSD, according to neighbors.

name: Carter Castle
summary: Castle, a Vietnam war veteran, was shot during a confrontation with state troopers who were trying to serve him with an arrest warrant, according to authorities. Officials said Castle warned troopers he was armed and pointed a gun at them. Both troopers attempted to shock Castle with a Taser.

name: Paul Campbell
summary: Campbell stabbed his mother to death and was found by officers outside their house holding a knife, police said. Both officers opened fire and killed him.

name: Isaac Holmes
summary: Holmes was the passenger in stolen vehicle. After a short chase he got out of the car, allegedly holding a handgun. Police said he refused to drop it and they opened fire. He was taken to a local hospital and pronounced dead. Holmes's family have questioned the police narrative.

name: Todd Allen Hodge
summary: Hodge, a wanted felon, was found hiding underneath a house. An officer sent in a police dog, which Hodge shot and killed. After a standoff, a Swat team threw teargas. Hodge emerged, allegedly holding a handgun, and was shot dead. The dog, Sultan, was given a public funeral.

name: Miguel Anguel de Santos-Rodriguez
summary: De Santos-Rodriguez, an undocumented migrant, was shot dead after exchanging fire with a Border Patrol agent, according to police. It is alleged De Santos-Rodriguez was involved in drug smuggling and was at large following a Border Patrol raid where narcotics were recovered. The agent was placed on administrative leave, but has since returned to work.

name: John Gorman
summary: Gorman, who had been promoted to the commission's director of investigations the day before he was killed, was shot during a training exercise. An agent he was pretending to attack drew his gun and fired a live round accidentally.

name: Andrew Toto
streetaddress: Scobie Pond Rd and Julian Rd
summary: Toto's wife called 911 to report that her husband, who was suffering from depression, had driven away from their home with a shotgun and appeared suicidal. Police said an officer encountered Toto's truck and was shot at. He returned fire and struck Toto in the chest.

name: Kristiana Coignard
summary: Coignard called 911 from the lobby of the Longview police department asking for help. A tussle with police officers then occurred and she was shot four times after lunging at officers with what police described as a butcher's knife. Coignard's family have said the officers did not do enough to defuse the situation before firing. CCTV footage of the incident has raised further questions about the officers' use of force.
link1text: Guardian: Was Kristiana Coignard unlawfully killed?
link2text: Guardian: Three cops, a 17-year-old and 'a cry for help'

name: Tiano Meton
summary: Meton allegedly drove through a west Texas checkpoint and didn't stop. He was chased for more than 30 miles before he stopped. His vehicle was approached by four Border Patrol agents. One shouted 'gun' and two opened fire. A pellet gun was found inside Meton's car.

name: Demaris Turner
summary: Turner allegedly used a stolen vehicle as a weapon by ramming an officer's car. He was shot multiple times, and a police dog inside the patrol car was injured.

name: Jose Antonio Espinoza Ruiz
summary: Ruiz was involved in a domestic disturbance with his wife, who called 911. Ruiz emerged from the house, allegedly carrying a knife, and was shot by attending officers, according to the police account. Both officers returned to work the following month.

name: Robert Mesch
summary: Mesch's wife called police to say he was suicidal. He assaulted her and fled in a car, according to police. The car was stopped by officers and Mesch was shot when he allegedly pointed a gun at them.

name: Darin Hutchins
summary: Hutchins was allegedly threatening people with a knife at a party. When officers arrived Hutchins allegedly did not drop the knife as instructed and was shot. Witnesses said Hutchins was given no time to respond to officers' commands.

name: Daryl Myler
summary: Myler was involved in the robbery of a Walgreens. Police were called and Myler allegedly fired at officers before he was shot. He was taken to hospital and later died.

name: Orlando Lopez
summary: Lopez was on parole for robbery and had removed his ankle bracelet the day before he was shot. Lopez and another man were seen attempting to break into a residence and fled by vehicle when officers arrived. Police said they chased the suspects until they crashed and fled on foot. Lopez exchanged gunfire with officers before he was shot, according to police.

name: William Campbell
summary: Police were responding to a domestic violence call. According to authorities, Campbell approached the police officers' vehicle and raised a handgun in their direction.

name: Jesse Hernandez
summary: Hernandez was driving a stolen car with four other teenage passengers inside. Police allege Hernandez disobeyed commands to stop, and struck an officer before they opened fire. Several of the other passengers dispute this version of events. Hernandez's death was ruled a homicide and the incident drew widespread protest. An autopsy found no evidence Hernandez had been shot from close range.

name: David Garcia
summary: Deputies said they were responding to suicide threats made by Garcia. When they arrived, they forced entry into Garcia's home. He allegedly charged at them brandishing a knife. One deputy fired. Garcia's family have filed a wrongful death lawsuit.

name: Alvin Haynes
summary: Haynes, who had been convicted of burglary, died after a jailhouse confrontation with several San Francisco sheriff's deputies at San Francisco County Jail No 5. Officials said the incident began when Haynes refused to hand over an envelope.

name: Raymond Kmetz
summary: After opening fire on two rookie police officers at a New Hope city council meeting, Kmetz was shot to death.

name: Nicolas Tewa
summary: Tewa was a suspect in at least six armed robberies. Undercover police officers said they shot him as he attempted to ram his way past a police cruiser in a stolen car.

name: Chris Ingram
lawenforcementagency: Clifton Police Department and Greenlee County Sheriff's Office
summary: Ingram fled after officers responded to a domestic violence call, according to police. Gunfire was exchanged after Ingram was stopped. Two officers were shot and survived.

name: Jermonte Fletcher
lawenforcementagency: Columbus Division of Police, Ohio State Highway Patrol
summary: Fletcher was killed in a gunfight with police after allegedly saying he would not be taken alive. He was a fugitive with an extensive criminal record who was facing 44 charges relating to drug dealing.

name: Cody Karasek
summary: Karasek opened fire through a window after scaling the side of his ex-girlfriend's apartment building, killing her and wounding her partner. Officers caught up to him after he fled, and Karasek was killed in a shootout.

name: Larry Kobuk
summary: Kobuk was taken into custody as a suspect in a car theft. Corrections officers said they restrained him because he was being combative during booking. As they put him in in a cell, they noticed he was unresponsive.

name: Matautu Nuu
summary: Nuu was allegedly vandalizing a home with a hammer. Police said when they confronted him, he responded: 'Just shoot me.' Nuu allegedly struck police dog with the hammer and was tasered to no effect before officers opened fire. Nuu's family has filed a federal lawsuit against the police chief, the officers involved and the city.

name: Alan Alverson
lawenforcementagency: Wise County Sheriff's Department and Texas DPS
summary: Police were attempting to take Alverson into custody on two felony warrants. Alverson fled by car and then on foot before engaging officers in a shootout. A police dog was shot and killed in the exchange.

name: Wendell King
summary: King's mother called police to request a welfare check on him. When officers arrived, King fired a handgun, striking a police sergeant. Other officers then returned fire. The incident was captured on body camera.

name: Ralph Willis
summary: Willis was a person of interest in a murder and arson in Stillwell. Police confronted him after a short foot chase and fired when he made an 'aggressive gesture'. No weapon was reported.

name: Tiffany Terry
summary: Police responded to reports that Terry had assaulted her nine-year-old son and 18-year-old daughter. She emerged from the house with knives in both hands, and threw one at an officer before she was shot.

name: John Marshall
summary: Marshall was wanted by federal authorities for burglary. Officers were waiting for him outside the Billings hospital when Marshall came out started running. While reaching for something in his waistband he tripped, fell and reached for his gun on the ground.

name: Victor Reyes
summary: Reyes was a suspect in two Houston murders on the night he was shot. A sheriff's deputy pursued Reyes' car to a dead end. Reyes emerged with a weapon and refused the officer's command to drop it. The officer fired one shot, and Reyes was pronounced dead at the scene.

name: Edward Bright Sr
summary: Bright was allegedly wielding a knife and threatening customers in a 7-Eleven. When he walked outside he refused officer's commands to drop his weapon, according to police. Police said they used a Taser but Bright did not drop the weapon, forcing officers to fire. A witness said Bright was not shocked with a Taser.

name: Hung Trieu
summary: Tony Yet, an investigator with the county attorney's office, broke up a fight in a restaurant while off-duty. Trieu, who had been one of the participants in the fight, returned with a gun and opened fire. Yet drew his service weapon and killed him.

name: Francis Rose III
summary: Deputies arrived at the home of Rose, a former California Highway Patrol officer, when neighbors complained a man was shooting a gun. Rose allegedly opened fire on their patrol cars and the deputies returned, killing him.

name: David Kassick
summary: Kassick got into an altercation with a police officer after fleeing a traffic stop. He was lying down when he was shot twice in the back.

name: Kenneth Brown
summary: State Trooper Caleb Swickey pulled Brown over and discovered a handgun during a patdown. Swickey said Brown reached for the gun, which was loaded, during a struggle. The incident was captured on dashcam video.

name: Ledarius Williams
summary: Officers spotted Williams, who police said was known to them, and said he was 'acting funny' just before he took off running. There was a struggle when officers caught up to him and one fired his gun. Williams was found to have been armed.

name: Dewayne Ward Jr
summary: Deputies were attempting to serve Ward with a restraining order when he allegedly charged at an officer with a knife.

name: Yuvette Henderson
summary: Henderson allegedly shoplifted from a Home Depot and flashed a gun. Police said she then attempted to carjack three vehicles and pointed a weapon at responding officers, prompting them to shoot. At least one officer was wearing a body camera, but authorities said it wasn't turned on. Some witnesses said Henderson was trying to flag down a bus, not steal a car. Her weapon was recovered.

name: Anthony Purvis
summary: Police said Purvis pointed a gun at them after initially putting the gun to his chin and threatening to shoot. Police were called to the house by his wife, who was shot in the hand.

name: Salvador Muna
streetaddress: E Baseline Rd and S 48th St
lawenforcementagency: Tempe, Chandler and Mesa Police Departments [US Marshals Service Task Force]
summary: Muna was wanted by federal marshals for a parole violation. When officers pinned the vehicle he was in, he allegedly pulled out a gun and aimed it at police. The car was being driven by Joaquin Hernandez, who also died from police gunfire.

name: Joaquin Hernandez
streetaddress: E Baseline Rd and S 48th St
lawenforcementagency: Tempe, Chandler and Mesa Police Departments [US Marshals Service Task Force]
summary: Hernandez was driving with fugitive Salvador Muna when officers attempted to take him into custody. He was caught in the crossfire of an ensuing shootout.

name: Markell Atkins
lawenforcementagency: Shelby County Sheriff's Department [US Marshals Service Task Force]
summary: Deputies were attempting to arrest Atkins, who was wanted for the death of a one-year-old. Atkins allegedly threatened police with a knife, though family witnesses said they 'kicked the door in and started shooting'.

name: Izzy Colon
summary: Plainclothes officers heard gunfire and saw Colon and an associate, Ricardo Caban, walking towards them, according to authorities. Police said Caban obeyed commands to drop his weapon, but Colon did not. Colon's family said he did not have a weapon.

name: Jimmy Robinson Jr
lawenforcementagency: Waco Police Department, McLennan County Sheriff's Office
summary: Robinson was a suspect in five robberies in the Waco area. He led officers on a high-speed chase before spike strips caused him to lose control of his vehicle. Officers opened fire after Robinson allegedly attempted to back into a patrol car and displayed a handgun.

name: Paul Johnson
summary: Johnson was a suspect in a bank robbery when he and an accomplice carjacked a vehicle outside the bank and led police on a chase before crashing. Police then opened fire. The stolen money was recovered in the vehicle.

name: Jeremy Lett
summary: Officer David Stith was responding to a burglary when he encountered Lett, who matched the description of the suspect. When he approached, Lett allegedly attempted to tackle the officer. Stith claims he tried to use his Taser, but due to rainy conditions, it shocked the officer instead. With Lett on top of him, Stith fired his weapon.

name: Wilber Castillo-Gongora
summary: Police were making a welfare check on Castillo-Gongora, who was 'acting indifferent and aggressive', police said. During a scuffle, officers used a Taser on him. He became unresponsive soon after.

name: John Sawyer
summary: Sawyer was being arrested for suspected narcotics dealing when he allegedly pulled a replica pistol from his pocket. A real semi-automatic rifle was found in his vehicle.

name: Herbert Hill
summary: Police were attempting to arrest Hill in connection with a burglary when he allegedly flashed a firearm at the five officers and began shooting. One officer was wounded.

name: Alan James
lawenforcementagency: Kentwood Police Department and Wyoming DPS
summary: James was shot by two officers after he opened fire on police who had arrived at his home in response to a report of a domestic dispute. Relatives said he was acting out of character after taking a combination of medications.

name: James Allen
summary: Officers arriving to check on Allen's welfare kicked in his door and shot him when they found him holding a gun, said officials. Relatives had asked police to check on Allen, who had recently had heart surgery. Authorities said he failed to drop the gun when ordered but his family said he was hard of hearing.

name: Sawyer Flache
summary: Flache was reported by 911 callers to be shooting at street lights with a rifle. He continued his shooting spree, apparently firing at a police helicopter. Officers fired back and killed him.

name: Natasha McKenna
streetaddress: Fairfax County Adult Detention Center, 10520 Judicial Dr
summary: McKenna, who had schizophrenia, was tasered four times for being non-compliant with deputies. She later went into cardiac arrest due to a combination of the tasering, psychoactive medications and what the medical examiner controversially termed 'excited delirium'. Tasers were found to have played a role in her death, but no criminal charges were filed. The jail has since banned the use of Tasers.
link1text: Guardian: How US police departments have struggled to regulate Tasers, despite dozens of deaths after their use this year

name: Joseph Paffen
summary: Paffen's ex-girlfriend called police to report he had followed her to a shopping mall in violation of his restraining order. Police said Paffen began shooting at officers, injuring two of them, and they returned fire.

name: Larry Hostetter
summary: Police were called to a domestic disturbance at Hostetter's home. Hostetter was himself a sheriff's deputy and formerly an officer with the responding police department. Many details have been withheld, but some reports suggest Hostetter was suicidal and pulled a gun on police.

name: Desmond Luster
summary: According to friends, Luster was frustrated by a string of robberies at his house, and was allegedly chasing two youths he believed were trying to break in again. Luster shot at the two as they ran away. Officer Aaron Tolerton was not on duty, but responded and apprehended one of the youths Luster was chasing. He then saw Luster driving towards him and fired at the vehicle.
