name: Vincent Cordaro
summary: Members of Cordaro's family went to the police after he threatened to kill them with a shotgun. A seven-hour standoff ensued and a Swat team was deployed. Cordaro, who had previously attempted suicide, threatened to shoot officers during phone negotiations. He was killed by a marksman after firing at officers from the house.

name: Dean Bucheit
summary: Bucheit was struck by a police car on a foggy, unlit stretch of highway. The incident was described by police as an accident and a tragedy.

name: John Whittaker
summary: Whittaker led police on a chase after officers responded to reports of an erratic driver. Whittaker eventually stopped outside a residence and exchanged gunfire with police as he tried to enter the home.

name: Antonio Zambrano-Montes
summary: Police were responding to reports that Zambrano-Montes was throwing rocks at cars. He hit two officers and refused to listen to commands, according to police, who tried unsuccessfully to Taser him. Zambrano-Montes was running away from police with a rock and momentarily turned back at them when the officers fired. Zambrano-Montes's family has filed a federal lawsuit against the city.
link1text: Guardian: Video throws doubt on police account
link2text: Guardian: Victim's American dream ends in violent reality
link3text: Guardian: Police officers fired 17 times at unarmed Mexican man shot dead in Washington
link4text: Police will not face charges in Pasco shooting death of Mexican man

name: Brian Fritze
summary: Officers were responding to a domestic violence call when Fritze led them on a high-speed chase. When his vehicle was disabled with spike strips, he allegedly emerged with a gun and failed to obey police commands to drop it.

name: Anthony Bess
summary: Officers came to Bess's home to serve him with a warrant for shoplifting and aggravated assault of an off-duty police officer. Police said he refused to show his hands and was shot after brandishing a loaded weapon.

name: Kenneth Kreyssig
lawenforcementagency: Maine State Troopers and Aroostook County Sheriff's Department
summary: Kreyssig's brother called police concerned that his brother, a Vietnam war veteran, was suicidal. Kreyssig died in an 'armed confrontation' with officers at home.

name: Phillip Watkins
summary: Watkins called police to report a man had entered a home with a knife. At the same time, the mother of Watkins's fiancee called a suicide hotline, and was told police would respond as part of a suicide intervention team. Police said when officers arrived, Watkins charged at them holding a knife and they opened fire, striking him approximately nine times.

name: Fletcher Stewart
summary: Confronted by deputies responding to a call about a man with a pistol, Stewart allegedly ran into a wooded area and brandished his weapon, which relatives insist was only a BB gun. Friends and relatives said he had significant mental difficulties.

name: Andres Lara-Rodriguez
lawenforcementagency: Kansas City KS Police Department and Kansas Highway Patrol
summary: Lara-Rodriguez was shot by four officers as he jumped from a carjacked pest control truck, allegedly while armed, after crashing the truck at the end of a police chase.

name: Jonathan Harden
summary: Police said Harden stole a car that had been left running, and led officers on a high-speed chase. He attempted to ram officers with the vehicle, they said, and officers fired a total of 18 rounds.

name: Matthew Belk
summary: Belk pulled a weapon while leading officers on a chase, according to authorities. Police were responding to a reported domestic violence incident.

name: Richard Carlin
summary: Carlin was shot by a state police officer who was attempting to serve him with several warrants, including one for aggravated assault with a deadly weapon. It is unclear if Carlin was armed when he was shot.

name: Roy Day
summary: Day allegedly drew a weapon and started firing on police during a routine traffic stop.

name: Cody Evans
summary: Police were responding to a 'chaotic' 911 call 'involving domestic violence'. Evans's wife, who made the call, said Evans was intoxicated and trying to harm himself. Evans managed to escape police briefly until his vehicle was spotted. When police surrounded him, Evans allegedly retrieved an airsoft rifle that resembled an AR-15 and pointed it at officers. His wife said he wanted officers to kill him.

name: Lavall Hall
summary: Hall was schizophrenic and in the midst of a psychotic episode when police arrived. Officers claim Hall attacked them with a broomstick, but video released by his family suggests he may have been running away.

name: Bruce Steward
summary: A 911 call reporting a stabbing was made from Steward's cellphone. When officers arrived he was outside holding a hatchet and screwdriver. The officers had planned to use a beanbag gun to subdue Steward, but he charged the officers before they had the opportunity. Steward had been diagnosed with depression.

name: Howard Brent Means Jr
summary: Two officers were following Means when he 'bailed out' of his car and ran into a Walmart. When the officers pursued him into the store, he opened fire.

name: Daniel Mejia
summary: Mejia was threatening people with a knife and stabbing a wooden light post when police arrived, according to authorities. A deputy said Mejia ignored his verbal commands and advanced with his knife drawn.

name: Jacob Haglund
summary: Officer Brandon Murphy was tracking Haglund in connection to a home invasion. When he encountered the teenager, Haglund shot at Murphy, wounding him in the thigh. Murphy returned fire with 'several' shots. Haglund died 13 days later when his family took him off life support.

name: Michael Casper
summary: Police were responding to reports that Casper was breaking windows with a crowbar. Officer Jason Green claims he saw Casper aiming his gun at another officer, and discharged his weapon. A friend of Casper's who was with him that night disputes this account.

name: Daniel Caldwell
summary: Caldwell was wanted for questioning regarding a domestic violence incident.  While police were searching for him, Caldwell walked up to a police cruiser with his weapon out and raised it when the officer exited the vehicle.

name: Doug Sparks
summary: Sparks allegedly stabbed two employees of a school. Police said he would not comply with orders to drop his weapons, prompting officers to fire. Sparks had a knife and a BB gun.

name: Matthew Lundy
summary: Deputies responded to reports of a disabled vehicle in a ditch. When they arrived, officers saw that Lundy was holding a gun and fired. The detective first lieutenant investigating the case said Lundy did not appear to have fired his weapon.

name: Betty Sexton
summary: Sexton was shot when she ignored instructions to drop a gun, according to authorities. She had called the police to help her remove 'unwanted house guests'. Relatives said Sexton was attempting to lower her weapon yet two witnesses agreed with the police account.

name: Pedro 'Pete' Juan Saldivar
lawenforcementagency: Del Rio Police Department and Val Verde County Sheriff's Office
summary: Saldivar was allegedly threatening people with a machete before attempting to run over several responding officers with his 18-wheeler. Two officers resigned to avoid being fired and seven were suspended after an internal inquiry found their shots put the public in danger. No criminal charges were brought.

name: Michael Ireland
summary: Police were responding to reports of someone 'acting strangely in a parking lot'. Ireland ran when police arrived and an officer gave chase. 'At some point during the ensuing encounter,' police said in a news release, 'the officer shot the suspect one time in the chest.'

name: Janisha Fonville
summary: Officers were responding to a domestic argument between Fonville and her girlfriend, Kornesha Banks. Banks said she warned officers that Fonville was unstable before they entered the apartment. Officers said Fonville lunged at them with a knife, but Banks said Fonville was trying to attack her.

name: Chance Thompson
summary: Police were responding to reports that Thompson was acting strangely. He is believed to have been on methamphetamine. Police used a Taser on Thompson after he began attacking one of the deputies, and went into cardiac arrest soon after.
link1text: Guardian: How US police departments struggle to regulate Tasers, despite dozens of deaths after their use this year

name: Rubn Garca Villalpando
summary: Villalpando was pulled over after leading Officer Robert Clark on a chase. Dashcam video shows the officer ordering Villalpando to stay where he is, as he slowly shuffles towards Clark's police cruiser with his hands on his head. Villalpando is shot dead just after he walks past the camera's view.

name: Stanley Grant
summary: Officers were attempting to serve a warrant on Grant. He allegedly fired on an officer when police entered his home and they returned fire, killing him.

name: Alejandro Salazar
lawenforcementagency: US Marshals Service, Texas Department of Criminal Justice
summary: Officials working for the Gulf Coast Violent Offenders Task Force said they were looking for Salazar, who was suspected on robbery and assault charges. He was shot by a US Marshals deputy and a Texas state justice officer after allegedly emerging from a vehicle with a weapon and pointing it at the officers.
link2text: Guardian: Never before named: five people killed by police the world forgot

name: Jason Carter
lawenforcementagency: New Mexico State Police and US Marshals Service
summary: Marshals were attempting to serve Carter with a warrant when he barricaded himself in his RV and refused to leave, often brandishing a firearm. He was shot after making verbal threats against the officers.

name: Terry Price
lawenforcementagency: Osage Nation Police Department, Osage County Sheriff's Office
summary: Price fled from a casino from which he was barred pursued by officers. Price allegedly began to fight when they caught up to him and an officer used his Taser. Price collapsed and died from a 'sudden cardiac death' associated with being restrained, 'multiple electroshock weapon discharges', intoxication with PCP, and an enlarged heart, according to authorities.

name: Kent Norman
summary: Norman was allegedly trying to kill his mother with a knife. Police responded, and he lunged at officers when they entered the home.

name: Anthony Giaquinta
summary: Giaquinta, a former deputy in the sheriff's department who lost his job over a domestic violence charge, died in a shootout with sheriff's deputies after killing his wife. Two officers were shot and injured by Giaquinta.

name: Bradford Leonard
summary: Police were responding to a 911 hang-up. Leonard allegedly walked out of his home and started shooting at officers when they arrived.

name: A'donte Washington
summary: Officers were investigating a burglary when they encountered Washington and three other men. Washington allegedly brandished a gun at police, prompting an officer to shoot.

name: Michael Smashey
summary: Smashey was killed in his home as officers tried to arrest him on a robbery warrant. Police alleged that he made an 'offensive move' with a knife.

name: Jerome Nichols
summary: Nichols was trying to escape from police after stabbing a woman. He stabbed an officer with a 'large knife' before being shot dead by police.

name: Robert Kohl
summary: Kohl was a truck driver and had been pulled over several times for driving 'over hours' on the day he was killed. He placed several panicked calls to 911 and his mother before waving his weapon in front of a Bass Pro Shop threatening suicide. He was shot once.

name: Joseph Biegert
summary: Police went to Biegert's apartment after a call warning he was suicidal and had taken medication in an attempt to harm himself. A fight broke out and he was shot after stabbing one of the police officers, according to officials.

name: Daniel Elrod
summary: Elrod was being pursued in connection to a robbery at a Family Dollar store. Police said he told them he had a weapon and reached for his waistband several times. His wife claimed to have seen the incident and said he raised his arms.

name: Alexander Long
summary: Long, a suspect in a rape, was shot in the chest after allegedly moving his hand towards his jacket. Long had led officers on a car chase and had rammed patrol cars with his vehicle, according to police.

name: Glenn Lewis
summary: Police were chasing Lewis after he failed to pull over for a traffic stop. When Lewis entered a dead end street, the officers got out of their car and Lewis allegedly drove towards them, so they fired at him. He drove another block before hitting a parked car. When officers opened the car door to apprehend him, they noticed he had been shot.

name: Francis Spivey
summary: Spivey, a veteran, fired a rifle from the balcony of his apartment, held it to his chin and threatened officers during a 50-minute standoff. He said he wanted to die in a 'suicide by cop'. He was shot by a Swat marksman.

name: Amilcar Perez-Lopez
summary: Police said Perez-Lopez wielded a knife while trying to steal a bicycle. Plainclothes officers shot him when he allegedly ignored their demands to drop the knife. Protesters later said he wouldn't have understood the commands because he did not speak English. Witnesses contradicted the police account, saying Perez-Lopez was trying to get his phone back from the owner of the bicycle.
link3text: Guardian: Chronicle of a death untold
link4text: Guardian: The story of Amilcar Perez-Lopez

name: Crystal Miley
summary: Miley, a suspected burglar and illicit gun seller, crashed during a high-speed chase with deputies. She allegedly exited the vehicle with a revolver in one hand and an automatic pistol in the other before being shot dead.

name: David Cuevas
summary: Cuevas was wanted for sexual battery. He attempted to retrieve a 9mm handgun from his waistband when confronted by police. Officers found 725 9mm rounds, leg restraints, two pair of handcuffs, a knife and binoculars in his vehicle. It is believed he was planning to abduct his ex-girlfriend. Officers shot 18 times, and Cuevas was hit seven times.

name: Rodney Biggs
summary: Biggs crashed his truck into a light post. When officers arrived, he allegedly refused to get out and reached for a gun. He was shot in the neck.

name: Chazsten Freeman
streetaddress: South Carolina Rte 8 and Augusta Rd
summary: Freeman was a suspect in a robbery. When officers arrived at the scene, shots were fired from a 'tree line'. A deputy returned fire, killing Freeman.

name: Ernesto Javier Canepa Diaz
summary: Diaz was a suspect in a robbery. When officers approached his vehicle, he allegedly became 'uncooperative'. What provoked the shooting is unclear, though a 'replica firearm' was found inside Canepa's van.
link1text: Guardian: Mexico tells US to monitor fatal police shooting inquiries

name: Russell Sharrer
summary: Police said Sharrer became uncooperative during booking. Corrections officers struggled with Sharrer, who then 'had a medical problem' and was rushed to a hospital. He died three days later.

name: Cornelius Parker
summary: Parker was a suspect in a triple shooting that left two people dead. Parker led police on a car chase, and after losing control of his vehicle in the snow, he allegedly emerged with a handgun. Parker and deputies exchanged fire before Parker was shot dead.

name: Stephanie Hill
summary: Hill was wanted in connection with a murder along with one other suspect, Victor Silva. They led police on a car chase lasting over an hour, and after police disabled the car, Hill allegedly brandished a gun and was shot.

name: Ian Sherrod
lawenforcementagency: Tarboro Police Department and Edgecombe Sheriff's Office
summary: Sherrod was a suspect in a triple murder in Tarboro the day he was shot. Authorities said Sherrod pointed a gun at officers when they confronted him, and they shot him.

name: Deven Guilford
summary: Sgt Jonathan Frost pulled Deven over for flashing his car lights at the officer, according to investigators. Deven failed to produce his driver's license and an altercation occurred between the two after Frost attempted to handcuff the teenager, according to investigators. Frost then deployed a Taser, which was unsuccessful. He then shot Deven seven times from close range.

name: Jessica Uribe
summary: Uribe advanced with a knife towards police who were responding to reports that he was acting strangely, according to authorities and witnesses.

name: Thomas Allen Jr
summary: Allen was in a passenger in a vehicle that had been pulled over for not signaling and for making an illegal left turn. Allen was searched, found to have no weapons and was allowed back in the car. While officers questioned the driver, Allen got into the front seat and tried to drive away. One officer got into the passenger's seat as Allen tried to get away, and wrestled with him before shooting him.

name: Charly 'Africa' Keunang
summary: Officers were trying to speak with Keunang in connection with a robbery when a scuffle broke out between him and the officers. Keunang allegedly reached for an officer's weapon, prompting three officers to fire.

name: Darrell 'Hubbard' Gatewood
summary: Gatewood died from a cardiac arrest after being pepper-sprayed and shocked with a Taser several times during a scuffle with police, according to authorities. Officers were responding to a disturbance call that reported Gatewood was 'fighting the air' and breaking things. According to the medical examiner, Gatewood's death was caused by a combination of cocaine use and the effect of the Taser.

name: Donald Matkins
summary: Matkins was shooting his gun at mailboxes and into the air when deputies were called. Makins barricaded himself in a home and refused to come out. Deputies tried using pepper spray grenades to get him to exit, which he eventually did, allegedly pointing his weapon at police.

name: Jeffrey Surnow
summary: Surnow, a Michigan man on vacation in Hawaii, was on a bike ride when he was struck by a police cruiser.

name: Shaquille Barrow
summary: Officers were attempting to question Barrow about a robbery when they noticed a handgun tucked into his waistband, according to authorities. Police said an officer pulled out a Taser and told Barrow to stay where he was, but that Barrow started running and reached for the gun.

name: Fednel Rhinvil
summary: Rhinvil tried to pull a gun from his pocket during a struggle with a deputy whom he had pinned on the ground, according to authorities. Rhinvil had allegedly run from the officer, who was seeking to question him about threats to 'shoot up' a house in the neighborhood.

name: Matthew Metz
streetaddress: N College Ave and E Weber Dr
summary: Police said officers responding to a report of a domestic disturbance opened fire when they were confronted by Metz armed with a knife, and that he had already stabbed a woman and a police officer.

name: Derek Cruice
summary: A Swat team arrived at Cruice's shared residence to serve a narcotics warrant. Cruice answered the door unarmed and was shot within seconds. Police said they 'met resistance' but witnesses in the house said Cruice did not resist them and did not reach for anything.

name: Carl Lao
streetaddress: S San Joaquin St and E Church St
lawenforcementagency: Stockton Police Department, San Joaquin County Sheriff's Office
summary: Lao allegedly fired shots at police officers who were responding to reports of a man shooting a gun into the air. He was taken to hospital but died from his wounds weeks later.

name: Tyson Hubbard
summary: Hubbard, a fugitive and registered sex offender, allegedly tried to get into a car and reached for a gun when officers trying to serve him with a warrant approached him in the parking lot of a motel.

name: Sergio Navas
streetaddress: N Pass Ave and W National Ave
summary: Navas, who was driving a stolen car, led police on a brief chase after they attempted a traffic stop, according to officials. The cars collided and an officer fired into the driver's side window. Police, who did not know Navas's car was stolen, initially claimed he rammed their vehicle.

name: Tyrone Lawrence
summary: Ryerson, who was subject to a restraining order, allegedly threatened his estranged wife with a knife at her home. Police said he refused orders to drop the knife from officers responding to a 911 call about the disturbance.

name: Tony Robinson
summary: Robinson allegedly attacked an officer who responded to calls for help from friends and nearby residents over his erratic and aggressive behavior. The officer shot him seven times. Robinson's family filed a federal civil rights lawsuit against the officer and the city on August 12.
link1text: Guardian: Tony Terrell Robinson was shot dead by Madison police. This is how it happened
link2text: Guardian: Mother of Tony Robinson: I was isolated at hospital and not told of son's death
link3text: Guardian: Dashcam footage of Tony Robinson shooting released - video
link4text: Guardian: Tony Robinson's mother files civil rights lawsuit over fatal police shooting of son

name: Tony Ross
summary: Ross was tasered and detained by officers after allegedly kicking in the door of a house and resisting arrest. Police used a Taser on Ross again at the county jail and he was placed in a cell for violent offenders. Police said he was found unresponsive after suffering a cardiac arrest. His death was ruled a homicide.

name: Naeschylus Vinzant
summary: Vinzant had violated his parole and removed his ankle monitor, according to police. He was spotted by Swat officer Paul Jerothe, who attempted to arrest him. He was shot dead during the incident. Police have provided no further information other than confirming Vinzant was unarmed.

name: Andrew Williams
summary: Williams allegedly drove his vehicle at officers when they tried to arrest him after an undercover drug sting. Four deputies opened fire and shot him dead.

name: Bernard Moore
summary: Moore was crossing the Metropolitan Parkway to get to the store where he worked when he was struck by a police car. Surveillance footage from a gas station showed the police car did not have its lights or siren on. Moore's family have accused the officer of speeding.

name: Adam Reinhart
summary: Reinhart allegedly pulled a gun from his waistband and pointed it at police officers. Police said they were responding to a call reporting 'unknown trouble'. Some witnesses disputed that Reinhart produced a weapon.

name: Michael McKillop
summary: McKillop was attempting to flee in a stolen car after a burglary, according to police. He was shot in the torso by a state trooper who was allegedly dragged alongside McKillop's vehicle as he tried to escape.

name: Aurelio Duarte
summary: Duarte, who was on probation for drugs offenses, allegedly pointed a rifle at arriving officers as they responded to a complaint of shots fired.

name: Monique Deckard
summary: Deckard allegedly stabbed a woman at a laundromat and charged at police when they arrived at her apartment in search of the suspect. Her family said she had a long history of mental health problems and that they called mental health services over her erratic behavior hours before she was killed.

name: Cedrick Bishop
summary: Bishop, said by sheriffs to have an 'extensive and violent criminal history', was fatally shot when he allegedly shot into a patrol car as deputies investigated reports of a man shooting into a house.

name: James Damon
lawenforcementagency: Moffat County Sheriff's Office and Colorado Parks and Wildlife Law Enforcement
summary: Damon and his wife, who were both fugitives, captured two officers investigating a suspicious vehicle that Damon had parked. Damon took both officers' weapons, according to police. One officer fought back and recovered his gun before shooting Damon in the back of the head. His wife was arrested.

name: Lester Brown
lawenforcementagency: North Carolina Alcohol Law Enforcement, Transylvania County Sheriff's Office, Homeland Security
summary: Brown was served a warrant by officers from a variety of law enforcement agencies over a suspected illegal distillery. According to police, Brown ran upstairs and pulled out a rifle. He allegedly pointed it at officers, all of whom opened fire. The district attorney ruled the shooting justified.

name: Hue Dang
streetaddress: Jackson Ave and E Kennedy St
summary: A detective struck and killed Dang in his patrol car as he turned a corner. There were no witnesses and it was unclear whether Dang was crossing the street or standing on the pavement.

name: Christopher Mitchell
summary: Mitchell allegedly attempted attacked an officer with knife when authorities responded to reports of a stabbing a mobile home park.

name: Terrance Moxley
summary: Moxley died of a sudden cardiac arrest after officers shocked him in the chest with a Taser multiple times. Officers were trying to detain him at a halfway house for recent offenders after a staff member concerned about his behavior called police. The medical examiner blamed synthetic marijuana found in Moxley's blood, although an autopsy report concluded: 'The contribution of the taser use to this death cannot be confirmed or negated based upon the information available to this pathologist; however the barb injuries are in the area of his heart.'
link1text: Guardian: How US police departments have struggled to regulate Tasers, despite dozens of deaths after their use this year

name: Jamie Croom
summary: Croom, a suspect in a double homicide, allegedly killed US marshal Josie Wells when he opened fire on officers at a motel. Croom was shot and later died of his injuries in hospital.

name: Edixon Franco
summary: Franco refused to stop for a traffic violation, and after a brief chase he allegedly got out of his vehicle and ran at officers with a samurai sword. The officers reportedly deployed rubber bullets, and then fired live rounds when those failed to stop Franco.

name: William 'Rusty' Smith
summary: Smith, who had a history of mental illness and a previous arrest for domestic violence, was shot when officers responding to a domestic disturbance complaint encountered him armed at his home, according to officials.

name: Theodore Johnson
summary: Johnson allegedly opened fired on officers arriving at his apartment after his girlfriend reported he was threatening her and their landlady with a gun. He shot one officer in his bulletproof vest, according to body camera footage. Officers shot Johnson after he refused to drop his gun and instead pointed it at police, according to authorities.

name: Aaron Valdez
summary: Valdez allegedly drove towards officers in a stolen vehicle while they questioned a second man. Police had been responding to reports of a man attempting to steal a car.

name: Ryan Burgess
summary: Burgess allegedly pointed a BB replica of a Colt Defender at a police officer arriving at his home, and was shot when he refused to put down the weapon. His mother had called 911 to report he was acting violently and punching holes in the walls.

name: James Greenwell
summary: Greenwell was shot dead after allegedly firing at officers when they arrived at his home. He was said to have threatened his father and was sitting outside the house with a handgun, according to authorities.

name: Terry Garnett Jr
streetaddress: Augustine Herman Hwy & E Lewis Shore Rd
summary: Garnett allegedly accelerated towards the car of a deputy who was attempting to make a traffic stop. The deputy shot him in the head. Investigators said they found $3,000 worth of heroin in Garnett's vehicle.

name: Benito Osorio
streetaddress: S Main St and E Pine St
summary: Osorio got into a standoff with police after allegedly firing his gun at another man and at himself. According to officials, Osorio ignored multiple orders to drop his weapon before officers shot him dead.

name: Gilbert Fleury
summary: Fleury pointed a shotgun at officers and reportedly fired at them. Officers returned fire and Fleury was struck multiple times in the torso. He died days later. Fleury had reportedly been destroying property at his home when police were called.

name: Antonio Perez
summary: Police said they opened fire on Lopez when he reached for his waistband while fleeing on foot after his car crashed. He was a suspect in a burglary and was driving a stolen car. No weapon was discovered.

name: Bobby Gross
summary: Gross was shot when he allegedly charged at a police officer with a large tree branch inside a Metro station. A train operator had noticed him inside a tunnel and alerted transit police.

name: Jonathan Paul
summary: Police were responding to reports that Paul was shouting and throwing items from a second-story window. Police discovered Paul had outstanding warrants and took him into custody. He died after being placed in an isolation cell. An autopsy showed that Paul was physically restrained and pepper-sprayed.
link4text: Guardian: Two Texas police jailers indicted over Jonathan Paul's death in custody

name: Salome Rodriguez Jr
summary: Rodriguez was allegedly murdered by an off-duty rookie LAPD officer following a confrontation at a tequila bar. The officer was fired from his job and fled to Mexico before being captured in May.

name: Andrew Driver
summary: Driver allegedly became enraged at officers and attacked them when they arrived at his home, and was fatally shot. He was said by police to have made a series of emergency calls threatening to kill police officers with a knife.

name: James Jimenez
summary: Jimenez allegedly refused to put his hands in the air and reached for his waistband after being confronted by officers when he crashed his motorcycle. He was said to have fled when he saw police at his home serving a warrant for drugs and weapons possession charges. A gun and methamphetamine were reportedly found at the scene.

name: Clifton Reintzel
summary: Reintzel, a US military veteran, was fatally shot when he allegedly threatened officers with a knife. Police were responding to a 911 call reporting that Reintzel was cutting himself with the knife.

name: Fred Liggett Jr
summary: US Marshals were attempting to serve a warrant on Liggett for indecent activities with a child. They said they opened fired on him in 'response to the subject's actions'.

name: Aaron Siler
summary: Siler was fatally shot after he allegedly 'armed himself' when he crashed his car and fled. Police said they had followed him to act on a warrant for his arrest, and that Siler was on parole and probation. A billboard 'thanking' the officer involved in the shooting later prompted complaints from Siler's family.
link1text: Guardian: Billboard features officer who shot two in 10 days
link2text: Guardian: Officer kills suspect on first day back after shooting

name: Richard Castilleja
summary: Police said Catilleja was shot when officers encountered him aiming a gun at people inside a local bar. He had allegedly shot two people at the bar. Both were treated for non-life threatening injuries.  Castilleja's family said he was not given enough time to surrender.

name: Troy Boyd
summary: Boyd was accused of riding a quad bike erratically while in possession of a machete. Officials said one of the deputies who responded to the call opened fire when Boyd tried to run them over with the bike.

name: David Werblow
summary: Werblow was shocked with a Taser when he allegedly refused to exit a parked vehicle. Police said they were responding to reports that Werblow was trying to break into vehicles. Neighbors said Werblow was fighting the police. His death was ruled a homicide. Werblow, who was believed to be experiencing a schizophrenic episode, was asked to stop by officers 40 times, according to body camera footage.

name: Justin Tolkinen
summary: Tolkinen was seen wearing body armor and carrying an automatic weapon outside his house. A Swat team was called and they attempted to get Tolkinen to surrender, according to the police account. Tolkinen emerged carrying his weapon and a non-lethal round was fired by the Swat team, which failed to incapacitate him. He was then shot dead. It is unclear if Tolkinen fired his weapon. Tolkinen had a long history of mental illness.

name: Sheldon Haleck
summary: Haleck was tasered and pepper-sprayed after running erratically down a street in downtown Honolulu. According to officials, he tripped and fell and officers were able to bring him under control. However, he became unresponsive and died at a hospital.

name: William Poole
summary: Poole, a veteran, allegedly opened fire on officers as they approached him sitting on his lawnmower. Police said they were responding to a report from a veterans crisis hotline that Poole was suicidal and that no one should be sent to help as it would 'not end well'.

name: Eugene Smith II
summary: Smith allegedly shot at an officer responding to a 911 call that he was in a gas station with a shotgun. A firefight broke out after backup arrived and Smith was shot. All officers sustained minor injuries. Smith died of his injuries in a hospital the following day.

name: Roberto Leon
streetaddress: Elkhorn Blvd and Dry Creek Rd
summary: Officials said Leon was shot by an officer during a physical altercation when he was stopped for speeding on his motorcycle. Leon allegedly carjacked a vehicle and fled to his home, barricading himself inside and refusing to come out. He was later found to have bled to death from gunshot wounds.

name: Declan Owen
lawenforcementagency: Bladen County Sheriff's Office and Bladenboro Police Department
summary: Owen was reported to police for lying in a ditch with a gun. He hitchhiked away from the scene and fled into the woods, according to witnesses. Police said when they found Owen he refused to drop the weapon and pointed it at them. Officers fired a number of times and Owen was pronounced dead at the scene.

name: Alice Brown
summary: Brown allegedly drove at officers in a vehicle and was shot dead. She had been approached at a gas station because officers suspected that she was driving a stolen car.

name: Askari Roberts
summary: Roberts was shocked with a Taser as police attempted to handcuff him during a struggle. He became unresponsive soon after. A medical examiner ruled his death a homicide, naming the Taser deployment and methamphetamine use among the causes. Officers responded because Roberts allegedly arrived at his father's house exhibiting paranoid behavior and began choking his stepmother.

name: David Watford
summary: Watford, a trucker who had apparently abandoned his vehicle on a dark stretch of rural highway, was accidentally struck and killed by state troopers who were searching for him.

name: Jeff Alexander
summary: Alexander was accused of failing to drop a knife after demands from officers called to the hotel where he was staying. The 47-year-old, who claimed to be a navy veteran, allegedly threatened other guests with the knife.

name: Andrew Shipley
summary: Seven officers backed by a Swat vehicle fired 62 rounds at Shipley in six seconds after he allegedly fired once from a rifle following a 19-hour standoff, which began as a check on his welfare. His family said Shipley had suffered an 'acute mental health crisis' that led him to believe a government attack against civilians was imminent.

name: Brandon Rapp
summary: Police said they were responding to a domestic disturbance call when they encountered Rapp, who was holding a gun. An officer said Rapp was shot dead because he ignored commands to lower the weapon.

name: Kaylene Stone
summary: Stone allegedly pulled a gun on an officer who approached a vehicle in which she was a passenger. She was being pursued by undercover drug officials and was wanted on a drug-related warrant.

name: Garland Wingo
summary: Wingo was sitting on a bench with a handgun, according to police and witnesses. Police were called and Wingo was shot dead after allegedly drawing the weapon. A grand jury ruled the shooting justified.

name: Kendre Alston
summary: Alston's stolen vehicle crashed during a chase with police from a cemetery and he and another man fled the scene, according to authorities. Alston was shot dead after allegedly crouching and pointing a handgun at the pursuing officer.

name: Brandon Jones
summary: Police said Jones broke into a grocery store and tried to escape with cigarettes and Canadian coins. Two police officers confronted him on the sidewalk and tried to arrest him, but a struggle ensued. One fired a shot that hit Jones in the chest.
link1text: Guardian: Cleveland teen remembered at vigil

name: Jamison Childress
summary: Childress, wanted for crimes including homicide in Canada, was found crossing the US border by two agents. When they confronted him, they said, Childress was threatening and pepper-sprayed an agent. He was shot in the head.

name: Justin Fowler
summary: Fowler led officers on a car chase after they responded to a call alleging he had attacked his mother and brother. He eventually opened fire, killing one officer and wounding two others, before being shot dead.

name: Adam Jovicic
summary: Jovicic broke into the home of his ex-girlfriend, a Kent police officer, and attacked her, according to police. She called 911 and then shot Jovicic, who had a history of domestic violence, as officers arrived.

name: Robert Burdge
summary: Burdge, a former corrections officer, was shot dead at a motel where he had fled and barricaded himself after shooting a man over an alleged marital affair, according to authorities. Police had gathered around the building in a standoff.

name: Shane Watkins
summary: Watkins, who had long-term mental health problems, was confronted by police at the home he shared with his mother, after his sister called to report he had threatened to kill himself and his dog. His mother pleaded with officers not to shoot, saying he did not have a gun. Police say Watkins charged at officers with a box cutter.

name: Tyrel Vick
lawenforcementagency: Oklahoma Highway Patrol, Tupelo Police Department
summary: Vick opened fire on officers after crashing his truck at the end of a high-speed chase in rural Oklahoma, according to authorities. Police said he was wanted for the murder of his brother.

name: Jason Smith
summary: Smith was fatally shot when he allegedly attacked an officer who was writing up a police report and pulled out a firearm. He had allegedly threatened a family member.

name: Richard White
streetaddress: Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport, 900 Airline Dr
summary: White was carrying a machete and had a bag containing six molotov cocktails, according to police. He chased travellers through a concourse at Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport and was shot at three times by a deputy who also injured a bystander in the firing line.

name: Enoch Gaver
summary: Police responded to a 911 call after a member of the Gaver family allegedly assaulted a Walmart worker in the store's bathroom. The family of eight had been living in a mobile home in the store's parking lot for three days. Police responded and a brawl broke out. Enoch Gaver allegedly reached for an officer's gun. The officer was shot in the leg before Gaver was shot dead. Another member of the Gaver family was shot in the chest but survived.

name: Phillip Conley
summary: Conley was seen in a parking lot and allegedly threw a bottle at a passerby and brandished a knife. According to police, Conley refused to drop the knife when commanded and had a fake gun in his waistband. He was shot as he advanced towards an officer. An apology letter to police was reportedly found in Conley's car. Conley's family have questioned whether the use of force was proportionate.

name: James Ellis
summary: Ellis fled from police who were responding to a domestic disturbance call. After crashing his car, Ellis shot deputy James DeFillips twice in the torso, according to police. The officer, who was wearing body armor, returned fire.

name: Gary Page
summary: Page was reportedly behaving erratically and threatened to kill police officers. He was shot six times by two officers after allegedly raising his firearm and ignoring commands.

name: Denzel Brown
summary: Brown was suspected of shoplifting from a Best Buy. He attempted to steal a car with two children in the back seat, according to police. An officer attempted to deploy a Taser but then opened fire and arrested Brown, who later died during surgery.

name: Devin Gates
summary: Gates allegedly attempted to rob a 7-Eleven. Police said he fired once at a store clerk. After leaving the store, Gates did not follow orders from police and two officers opened fire, according to the police account.

name: Christopher Healy
summary: Healy allegedly came at officers with a knife as they responded to a suspected burglary. One officer fired two shots at Healy and another officer deployed his Taser, according to authorities. Healy was accused of burgling the house belonging to a neighbor of the friend he was staying with.

name: James Moore
summary: Moore was dressed in dark clothes and was not crossing the road at a pedestrian walkway, according to police. He was struck by a patrol car and later died in hospital.

name: Jeffrey Jackson
lawenforcementagency: Whitley County Sheriff's Department, Kentucky State Police
summary: Jackson was having a schizophrenic episode and running into traffic, according to his sister. Police arrived and handcuffed him after a brief altercation. Jackson stopped breathing around 90 minutes after the arrest. Police maintain Jackson did not die as a result of the officers' actions and suggest he may have been intoxicated.

name: Mychael Lynch
summary: Lynch was taken into custody for a hit-and-run. Several hours later deputies were alerted to a medical alarm 'initiated by Mr Lynch'. Deputies claim Lynch was uncooperative when they attempted to move him so he was restrained. He died two days later, with the medical examiner later ruling the death a homicide due to a lack of oxygen in the brain brought on by a heart issue incurred during the struggle.

name: Nicholas Thomas
summary: Officers claimed Thomas fled from a Goodyear store in a customer's vehicle when they attempted to serve him a warrant. Police said he was driving towards them and that they feared for their lives, prompting them to fire on the car. Witnesses disputed that Thomas was attempting to flee, and some said the vehicle was not moving at all. Thomas was dealing with legal issues related to an alleged assault of a police officer a year earlier.

name: Walter Brown III
summary: Brown allegedly fled in his car during a stop by drugs police. When he arrived home a prolonged struggle ensued, officials said, and a Taser had no effect on him. Police said Brown was shot when he pulled out a handgun. His wife denied he had a firearm.

name: Steven Snyder
summary: Snyder, once jailed for his part in a racist attack, allegedly killed a man and robbed a bank on the day he died. He was spotted and followed by a state trooper, who was on his first day alone on duty. When the trooper made contact, a shootout ensued and both men were killed.

name: Scott Dunham
summary: Dunham allegedly shot and killed an officer from his balcony as police responded to a 911 call, purportedly from a relative, stating that he was drunk and was at risk of harming himself. A shootout ensued and Dunham's body was found after his apartment was breached by police with explosives. Relatives said he had been suicidal.

name: Joseph Tassinari
summary: Tassinari, a Vietnam veteran, was wanted for allegedly brandishing a weapon during an incident earlier in the day. According to police, Tassinari refused to comply with orders from an officer who had arrived at his home. He was shocked with a Taser and then allegedly reached for his waistband before being shot dead.
link2text: Your West Valley News Sun City

name: Jeremy Kelly
lawenforcementagency: Johnsonville Police Department, Florence County Sheriff's Department (Swat)
summary: Police responded to calls alleging Johnson had fired shots. He fled into the woods and, according to authorities, fired at police. A Swat team arrived and Johnson was shot dead after allegedly pointing his weapon at officers.

name: Victor Terrazas
summary: Shortly after discovering the body of a 32-year-old woman who had been shot, deputies found Terrazas, who matched the description for the suspect. Officials said he was shot after opening fire on the deputies with his shotgun.

name: Adrian Solis
summary: Solis allegedly jumped up and charged at an officer with a knife while he was receiving aid for a self-inflicted neck wound. Police had received a call from Solis's mother saying he was suicidal.

name: Deanne Choate
summary: Choate allegedly fired a gun inside her boyfriend's house. Police were called and shot her after she allegedly refused to drop the weapon. Friends have said the episode was out of character and family have accused police of disproportionate force. Police have not said publicly if Choate pointed a weapon at them. The district attorney ruled the shooting justifiable.

name: Adrian Hernandez
summary: Hernandez, a suspect for rape, arson and kidnapping, allegedly led police on a high-speed chase and emerged brandishing a weapon after his vehicle came to a stop. Police later said that Hernandez was carrying a BB gun.

name: Meagan Hockaday
summary: Officers were responding to a domestic disturbance between Hockaday and her boyfriend. Hockaday allegedly advanced at one of the officers with a knife and was shot dead.

name: Jamalis Hall
summary: Hall, who was wanted on an attempted murder charge, was shot three times after allegedly reaching for a knife when pulled over by officers. Family members disputed the police account and said he was unarmed.

name: Neil Seifert
summary: Seifert was involved in a domestic dispute and had allegedly broken a restraining order brought by his ex-girlfriend. He was chased by officers and fired two rounds from a shotgun in their direction, before he was shot and taken to hospital where died an hour later, according to an account provided by the district attorney.

name: Angelo West
summary: West, who had several gun and drug convictions, got out of a vehicle and began firing at a police officer unprovoked during a traffic stop, video showed. He shot the officer in the face and tried to flee before officers returned fire.

name: Harvey Oates
summary: Oates, a military veteran, was pulled over by state troopers for an outstanding trespassing warrant. He fled, according to police, and allegedly charged at officers with a firearm at the end of a 90-minute standoff. He had threatened to kill himself.

name: Gary Kendrick
streetaddress: Shadytree Ln and Glen Arbor Dr
summary: Deputies were investigating a 911 hang-up when they found Kendrick sitting on his lawn pointing a shotgun at himself. He allegedly instructed officers to shoot him, and began to turn his weapon towards deputies when they fired.

name: Douglas Harris
summary: Officers were performing a welfare check on Harris, who allegedly pointed a gun at officers when they opened the door. An officer fired twice, striking Harris. He died a month later.

name: Robert Rooker
summary: Rooker led officers on a chase when they attempted to pull him over for speeding. According to the deputies, Rooker rammed police vehicles several times, prompting them to open fire.

name: Byron Herbert
summary: Police were responding to a domestic dispute in a parking lot when Herbert, a veteran, allegedly fired his weapon. It is not clear whether he was firing at the officer, who returned fire and killed Herbert.

name: Mya Hall
summary: Hall, a transgender woman, drove with another transgender woman into a restricted NSA complex at Fort Meade after stealing a car, according to authorities. Friends said they appeared to simply take a wrong turn and panicked. The pair allegedly ignored demands to turn around and instead drove towards a police vehicle. Officers opened fire, killing Hall and wounding the passenger. A firearm was found inside their vehicle.

name: Jason Moland
summary: Officer Thomas Miller was off-duty when he got into a confrontation with Moland in a park. Moland allegedly pulled out BB gun, and Miller responded with gunfire.

name: Dominick Wise
summary: Wise was believed to be intoxicated and was walking erratically in the middle of the road. Police attempted to get him on the sidewalk and the interaction eventually escalated to a scuffle. One officer had his nose broken. Police used a Taser on Wise and he became unresponsive shortly after.

name: Gregory Smith
summary: Smith died from a heart attack in custody shortly after corrections officers used a Taser and physical force to subdue him when he allegedly became violent. Police said Smith 'didn't recover from the stun'. His family alleged in a pair of wrongful death lawsuits against county authorities and the officers that the Taser caused him to go into cardiac arrest, which county officials deny. A state medical examiner ruled the incident a natural death caused by 'excited delirium'.

name: John Allen
summary: Neighbors reported gunfire and police responded. They found Allen standing in front of his apartment and asked him to show his hands. Allen then allegedly brandished a gun and officers fired at him.

name: Benjamin Quezada
streetaddress: West Texas Ave and Gaillard St
summary: Quezada was shot with a shotgun after allegedly pointing what looked like an AR-15 rifle at an officer responding to reports of an armed man standing at an intersection. It turned out to be a pellet gun.

name: Phillip White
summary: White became unconscious as police attempted to take him into custody after reports that he was screaming. Officers allege White tried to grab the arresting officer's gun. Video shows White, clearly dazed, flailing on the ground as an officer strikes him and orders a police dog to attack. The hacker group Anonymous threatened the Vineland Police Department over the incident.

name: Brian Babb
summary: Police were conducting a welfare check based on a call from Babb's therapist. Babb allegedly pointed a rifle at officers while cursing and threatening them. The rifle was later found not to be loaded. The family alleges the police report on the encounter contains 'many inaccuracies and bias'.

name: Shawn Clyde
summary: Clyde was found repeatedly stabbing his father, William, and his mother, Bonnie, at their home. He was shot when he refused to drop the knife and died two weeks later in hospital.

name: Robert Washington
summary: Washington shot and killed a woman named Denise Berry in front of an officer, who had been flagged down by Berry because Washington had been following her. The officer returned fire, killing Washington.

name: Aaron Rutledge
summary: Deputies responded to a call alleging Rutledge, a Louisiana national guard sergeant who had served overseas, was threatening to kill himself and another person at his home. After speaking to them for an hour, officers said, Rutledge emerged from a room and pointed his gun at them.

name: Darrin Langford
summary: Police said Langford was chased through alleyways by officers responding to a report of shots fired. Neighbors told reporters they heard two bursts of gunfire separated by a command to 'drop the gun'.

name: Donald 'Dontay' Ivy
summary: Ivy died of an apparent cardiac arrest after he was restrained by three officers and shocked repeatedly with a Taser. Officials alleged that he became aggressive and tried to flee when stopped and searched while walking down the street. Police reportedly said they were suspicious because Ivy had an 'unusual gait' and his sleeves were pulled down over his hands. Ivy's family, who have filed a civil rights lawsuit against the city, have said his death was ruled a homicide by a coroner.

name: Eric Harris
summary: Harris fled an arrest after he sold a gun to undercover officers working a sting operation. He was caught by officers and shot by a 73-year-old part-time reserve deputy, who said he intended to use a Taser. Harris told officers 'I'm losing my breath,' to which one replied: 'Fuck your breath.'

link3text: Guardian: Officers minimising issue of race, says Harris family

name: Donald Hicks
streetaddress: Illinois Rte 145 and Waldo Church Rd
summary: Hicks was reported to police as armed and suicidal. After finding him in a cemetery they pursued him by car. After stopping, Hicks was tasered and then shot after he failed to drop his gun, police said. Dashcam footage showed some of the encounter, including officers' attempts to revive him.

name: David Lynch
summary: Lynch became unresponsive after being restrained and shocked with a Taser by an officer who had arrived in response to a traffic incident in which Lynch was involved. His death was ruled a homicide and the medical examiner cited 'electric shock weapon discharge' as a significant factor. According to police, the officer suffered a broken eye socket.

name: Christopher Prevatt
summary: Prevatt was accused of twice advancing at a deputy while wielding two metal letter openers. Officers had been called to a domestic disturbance after Prevatt refused to leave a woman's home. He was also accused of posting a pornographic video of her online.

name: Ken Cockerel
streetaddress: W Union Hills Dr and N 39th Ave
summary: Cockerel had allegedly harassed a female 911 caller earlier in the day. Police were called when he stabbed himself in the chest in the street. Officers said he advanced on them with knives in his hands.

name: Justus Howell
summary: Howell was chased by two officers and shot twice in the back. Police said he was carrying a handgun, but this has been disputed by witnesses. Police published the testimony of a witness who said Howell had stolen a handgun from him just before the fatal incident. The shooting was ruled justified by the district attorney.
link1text: Guardian: Teen was trying to steal handgun, say police
link2text: Guardian: Officer was justified, says prosecutor

name: William Dick III
summary: Dick, who had allegedly robbed a hitchhiker at gunpoint earlier in the day, fled from officers in his van. He eventually crashed into a tree and ran away. After being caught he was tasered and handcuffed, and stopped breathing soon after.

name: Paul Anderson
summary: Anderson was travelling with his girlfriend, who police said was in violation of a probation order. Police detected the pair and Andersen fled, allegedly carrying a handgun. He was chased down and shot dead by three officers. Anderson had been arrested for cannabis possession the previous day and was released on bail.

name: Ethan Noll
summary: After an attempted traffic stop, pursuit and failed negotiations, Noll, a shooting suspect on probation for drugs offenses, exited his vehicle with a rifle and began moving it to a firing position, according to police.

name: Walter Scott
summary: Scott was pulled over by North Charleston police officer Michael Slager for a minor traffic violation. Scott fled but Slager caught up with him and attempted to deploy his Taser. The Taser was not effective and as Scott ran away, Slager opened fire. The final altercation was caught on video and led to Slager being charged with murder.
link1text: Guardian: Officer laughed about adrenaline rush
link2text: Guardian: Slager radioed in Taser claim six seconds after firing

name: Alexander Myers
summary: Myers was said by police to have shot once at officers with a rifle after they responded to a call from his home warning that he was suicidal. He was also armed with handguns.

name: Desmond Willis
summary: Willis, an aspiring rapper known as AR 15, was killed in the parking lot of New Orleans Hamburger & Seafood following a car and foot chase in which he allegedly shot at deputies and crashed his vehicle into a fence.

name: Jared Forsyth
summary: Forsyth, a police officer, was accidentally shot by a colleague at a training session in an area assigned for cleaning weapons.

name: Richard Hanna
summary: Police said Hanna was shot dead in the parking lot of a restaurant-gas station when officers responded to a call about an incident of armed domestic violence. Hanna, a retired police officer, shot himself inside his car and then ran toward officers, leaving his gun behind.

name: Erick Rose
streetaddress: Post Office Neck Rd and Lake Rd
summary: Deputies first said Rose, a burglary suspect facing other charges, stepped out of his car with a gun when they shot out his tires to end a high-speed chase. Officials later said Rose had refused to get out of the vehicle.

name: Joseph Weber
summary: Weber, an army veteran said to have had PTSD, encountered officers in an alley beside a liquor store. He allegedly advanced towards one of the officers with a knife.

name: Roberto Rodriguez
summary: Police officers patrolling the Boyle Heights neighborhood saw a man collapse and fall after being shot dead. With the help of a helicopter they chased Rodriguez, the alleged shooter, who then allegedly confronted them with a handgun.

name: Dexter Bethea
summary: Bethea allegedly tried to flee in a vehicle when two undercover narcotics officers tried to arrest him for selling drugs. Police said he used the car as a weapon and tried to run officers over.

name: Mark Smith
lawenforcementagency: Creek County Sheriff's Department and Bristow Police Department
summary: Smith is said to have hidden in a garage from deputies responding to a report of domestic violence against his estranged wife. Police said he was shot after opening the door and driving out in his truck, knocking down one officer.

name: Michael Le Mon
summary: Deputies arrested Lemon at an RV park after responding to a call about a disturbance. They claimed he fought back as they tried to get him in handcuffs and used batons, Tasers and pepper spray to subdue him.

name: Douglas Faith
summary: Faith allegedly led police on a chase after they attempted a traffic stop. After officers caught up to him, Faith allegedly opened fire on the officers' patrol cars.

name: Gordon Kimbrell Jr
summary: Police arrived at Kimbrell's home after his mother called 911 to report that he was throwing knives at family members. Kimbrell allegedly attacked a deputy with a samurai sword, cutting him, before he was shot dead.

name: Phillip Burgess
summary: Burgess, a US army reserve veteran and bodybuilder, was accused of grabbing a gun and pointing it at traffic deputies who arrived at his home as backup for colleagues issuing him with a narcotics warrant.

name: Jess Leipold
summary: Leipold arrived at a county prison with an AR-15-style rifle and began shooting into the air, according to police, who said he was shot dead after pointing the weapon at the prison lobby.

name: Angel Corona Jr
summary: Corona was found stabbing his 57-year-old father outside their unit in a mobile home park, according to police, and two deputies shot him when he refused to drop his knife.

name: Richard Reed
summary: Reed allegedly stole two cars at gunpoint before ramming a police cruiser and opening fire on officers who shot back.

name: Jason Evans
streetaddress: North Carolina Hwy 242 and Reeda Branch Rd
summary: Evans was alleged to have fired shots during an armed robbery at a convenience store. When deputies caught up to his vehicle, he allegedly got out and pointed his gun at them.

name: Mack Long
streetaddress: E 31st St and N Sherman Dr
summary: Long ran from his car after being stopped while illegally carrying his wife's handgun. Police said he was first shot as his gun turned towards an officer, then by a second officer during a struggle with the first.

name: Richard 'Buddy' Weaver
streetaddress: Sleepy Hollow Dr and Misty Glen Dr
summary: Weaver was accused of threatening people and passing drivers with a machete. An officer responding to a 911 complaint approached him and said he opened fire when Weaver refused to put down the machete and advanced towards him. Neighbors later described Weaver as schizophrenic.

name: Celin Nunez
summary: Nunez was accused of robbing a customer at a gas station and trying to steal a pickup truck, having used a rock and a wrench to attack people. An off-duty police officer wearing full uniform approached the pickup, which had tinted windows, and said he shot because he thought he saw Nunez aiming a shotgun. It was a welding gun.

name: Isaac Jimenez
summary: Jimenez was wanted for the fatal shooting of a woman who had a restraining order against him. A tip-off led police to a house in Alton, where Jimenez allegedly displayed a handgun.

name: Christopher Finley
summary: Police said Finley lashed out when he was served with a felony warrant. He ran inside his home and allegedly struck an officer trying to get in the front door several times with a machete.

name: Karl Taylor
lawenforcementagency: New York Department of Corrections and Community Supervision
summary: Taylor, a convicted rapist, attacked corrections officers with a baton, according to police. One suffered a broken arm and two others suffered concussions. Taylor apparently died in the ensuing struggle, but officials have not said how.

name: Tevin Barkley
summary: Police said three officers on bicycles responded to a report of shots fired. Officers confronted Barkley, who was carrying a Cobray M-11 assault weapon, and one fatally shot him.

name: Joseph Slater
summary: Slater was reported to be vandalizing at a gas station. Police pepper-sprayed him and then used force to restrain him when he tried to escape the patrol car. Police said he suffered a 'medical emergency' when they returned him to the vehicle.

name: Frank 'Trey' Shephard III
summary: Shephard fled a traffic stop after police saw him driving erratically. He crashed into several vehicles. While the chase was broadcast live on television, Shephard got out of his car and was shot when he appeared to reach back inside. No weapon was found.

name: Donte Noble
summary: Noble was stabbing a woman in an apartment. Officers responding to a 911 call heard her cries and shot Noble dead after kicking the door down. The woman did not survive.

name: Ernesto Flores
summary: Flores was acting bizarrely and threatening to blow up his family home, according to relatives. Deputies responding to a 911 call from his daughter shot Flores with beanbag rounds and then fatally with live rounds after he failed to drop his weapon. His daughter said she had made clear to officers the gun was not real.

name: Stanley Watson
summary: Watson, who was suffering from cancer and said to be suicidal, called police threatening to kill his wife. Officers arrived and found her body. Police said that after a long standoff, officers fired a pepper projectile into Watson's RV, at which point he burst out of the door shooting with two handguns.

name: Darrell Brown
summary: Brown was shocked with a Taser after continuing to be aggressive to officers responding to a complaint that he had kicked down the door to a house and broken in. He was put in an ambulance and then became unresponsive, according to police. A medical examiner said Brown had taken bath salts and that the cause of his death was 'excited delirium in the setting of police restraint.'

name: David Kapuscinski
summary: Kapuscinski was shocked three times with a Taser by police after being found sexually assaulting his girlfriend, whose daughter had called 911. Officers said he refused to obey orders. Prosecutors said Kapuscinski 'collapsed from the Tasing' and a medical examiner found he died after developing an irregular heartbeat. His girlfriend told reporters he had awoken from a bad nightmare and suffered some kind of breakdown. His autopsy showed he had taken amphetamines.

name: Rodolfo Velazquez
streetaddress: West Lerdo Hwy and South Wall St
summary: Velazquez was reported to be acting erratically and wielding a knife near a school. Police said when they encountered him in an alleyway he brandished the knife.

name: Jeffery Kemp
summary: Police chased a van they saw speeding away after shots were fired. Kemp allegedly jumped from the vehicle with a gun and refused to put it down after a foot chase. He then pointed the gun at officers, according to police.

name: Thaddeus McCarroll
summary: A tactical unit set up outside McCarroll's house after his mother reported he was acting unusually and talking of a 'black revolution'. Police said they saw him walking around inside carrying knives and a sword. McCarroll then left the house carrying a knife and a Bible and was hit by the 'not-so-lethal' round before police opened fire.

name: Elias Cavazos
lawenforcementagency: Riverside County Sheriff's Department and California Highway Patrol
summary: Cavazos allegedly got out of his vehicle and began firing when he was pulled over by officers working for a gang crime taskforce. Police said they recognized him as having an outstanding felony arrest warrant.

name: Erik Tellez
summary: Tellez, a mental health patient, was reported to be acting irrationally in a park and insisting there were snipers surrounding him. He allegedly began shooting at police, who returned fire.

name: Grover Sapp Jr
summary: Sapp, who had been in court on firearms charges the day before, opened fire on officers with a shotgun after they responded to reports of an armed man acting suspiciously.

name: Norman Cooper
summary: Cooper became unresponsive after he was tasered by two officers responding to a domestic disturbance. Police said he removed the prongs of the first Taser after first being shocked. Local authorities said an autopsy attributed his death to a combination of the 'prolonged struggle' with police and use of methamphetamine.

name: Michael Foster
summary: Foster called a suicide hotline, prompting Wilmore officers to visit his home in the early hours of the morning, according to authorities. He was said to have threatened suicide before. Police said Foster met two officers outside the house and pointed a gun at them.

name: Dana Hlavinka
summary: Hlavinka's wife was found running from their house as officers responded to a report of domestic violence. Hlavinka was discovered inside brandishing a knife, according to police, and was fatally shot.

name: Santos 'Cuate' Cortez Hernandez
summary: Cortez, an undocumented migrant from Mexico and the alleged leader of a people- and drug-smuggling network, was discovered by officers from a multiagency investigation titled Operation Lockdown. Police said he refused to cooperate.

name: Luis Molina Martinez
summary: Martinez's wife reported to police that he was stabbing himself. When officers ordered him to put down the knife he charged at them, police said.

name: Daniel Wolfe
summary: Wolfe was allegedly driving a Jeep that had been violently carjacked, and crashed into a group of parked cars when pursued by officers. Police said Wolfe accelerated the Jeep towards a trooper and was shot.

name: Daniel Covarrubias
summary: Police said they pursued Covarrubias, who had an extensive criminal record, after a lumber worker called 911 to report a man running through his yard 'as if being chased by police'. He climbed to the top of a 25-foot pile of wood and ignored orders, before pointing a dark object at officers that turned out to be his cellphone, police said.

name: Steven Davenport
summary: Davenport was said to have struggled with police who arrived to break up a fight between him and another man at a house in rural Mississippi. A Taser proved ineffective, according to police, and Davenport was eventually subdued with help from backup officers. He then became unresponsive and did not recover.

name: Kimber Key
summary: Key, who was from Florida, was visiting his brother and reportedly became suicidal and threatening. Sheriff's deputies discovered him in the kitchen armed with a knife and shot him in the chest.

name: William Chapman II
summary: Police were called by Walmart about an alleged shoplifter. A struggle ensued as an officer arrested Chapman in the parking lot, a witness said. After the officer's Taser was knocked from his hand he stepped back and shot Chapman.
link1text: Guardian: 18-year-old shot dead by officer who killed before
link2text: Guardian: Autopsy indicates officer shot unarmed teen William Chapman from distance
link3text: Guardian: state official will seek to prosecute officer who killed teenager
link4text: Guardian: Military-trained officer who killed two unarmed men

name: Jose Herrera
lawenforcementagency: California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation
summary: Officials said Herrera was one of two state prison inmates who attacked a third. A corrections officer was said to have fired one warning shot from a Mini 14 rifle before firing at Herrera when the assault continued.

name: Jonathan Efraim
summary: Efraim, a US marine veteran with a history of psychiatric problems and arrests, fired shots in a crowded bar, prompting 911 calls to police. As officers chased him he turned and fired at them and was shot dead.

name: Lue Vang
summary: Vang allegedly kidnapped the father and brother of his estranged wife and was holding his father-in-law at gunpoint. Deputies said Vang was shot when he repeatedly ignored attempts to talk him into surrendering.

name: Carlos Ramirez
summary: Ramirez was accused of banging on the window of a woman's car and being aggressive over a parking dispute at a Safeway. Officers arrived, found Ramirez, and one shot him dead. They said he was armed with a knife.

name: Hector Morejon
summary: A police officer responding to a call reporting people vandalizing a vacant home saw Morejon through a broken window and shot him. The officer said Morejon turned towards him and appeared to be point his arm. No gun was found.

name: Andrew Valadez
summary: Valadez was reported to be pointing a handgun at passing drivers near a middle school, before pointing the gun at his head. When officers arrived, police said, he pointed the gun at them.

name: Karen Janks
summary: Janks led deputies on a 19-mile car chase after being spotted driving the wrong way down a highway. After the chase ended in the parking lot of an antiques store, officials said, Janks reversed her car into three officers.

name: Joseph Potts
lawenforcementagency: Choctaw County Sheriff's Office and Hugo Police Department
summary: When police arrived at Potts's home to arrest him for shooting at his neighbor's house, Potts allegedly set fire to his house and started shooting at officers, seriously wounding two of them. He was shot dead.

name: Todd Dye
summary: Dye, an escapee from a corrections facility, was found by a police officer in a vacant trailer. Officials said he initially complied but was shot when he jumped up and pointed a gun at the officer.

name: Mark Hawkins
summary: Hawkins, who was wanted for failing to appear in court on drug charges, was found by police in a Walmart parking lot. He fled to an empty bus that was nearby and shot at officers during a standoff, striking a police dog, before being shot.

name: David Felix
summary: Felix, who had paranoid schizophrenia, is said to have fought with detectives who arrived at a home for people with mental illnesses to arrest him for a robbery. He was shot after striking one with his radio, police said.

name: Brandon Lawrence
summary: Police said Lawrence, an army veteran, refused to drop a machete when repeatedly ordered to do so by officers who arrived at his home. Claims that he advanced on the officers were disputed by neighbors.

name: Daniel Davis
summary: Police were called to Davis's parents' house over a disturbance. His mother said he warned them he would die that day. Officials said he was tasered but pulled out the prongs and was shot when he lunged at an officer with a knife.

name: Gary Collins
streetaddress: H St NW and 20th Ave NW
summary: Collins allegedly fled a driver's license check. After six blocks, police said, he got out of his car with a handgun. The state trooper pursuing him said he felt his life was in danger.

name: Billy Patrick
summary: Patrick, a fugitive from Arkansas, allegedly tried to drown a wildlife officer who attempted to arrest him during a fishing license check. The officer fought back and shot him.

name: Dean Genova
summary: Genova was found late at night inside a Rite Aid pharmacy that had been broken into. Police said he fought with officers, grabbed a handgun from one and refused to put it down.

name: Albert Hanson Jr
summary: Hanson was said to have been spotted sitting in his truck at a ranch with several rifles. A standoff ensued after deputies responded to a call from a ranch worker. Police said Hanson fired a round and deputies fired back at him.

name: Terrance Kellom
summary: Officers from a fugitive taskforce arrived at Kellom's house to arrest him for an armed robbery. An ICE agent felt threatened and shot him, police said. Officials said Kellom was armed with a hammer; his father denies this.

name: Jared Johnson
summary: Johnson was one of three suspected armed robbers engaged by police at a Dollar General store after an alarm was triggered. Police said they were forced to fire as the trio tried to escape. The other two men were charged.

name: Joshua Green
lawenforcementagency: Marion Police Department, Illinois State Police and Williamson County Sheriff's Department
summary: Green allegedly fired at an officer who was investigating screams he heard coming from an apartment, prompting a standoff and hostage situation. Green eventually left the apartment with his female hostage. Police said he then drew a concealed weapon, causing police to return fire. His mother later said the death was a suicide by police.

name: David Parker
summary: Police engaged in a 27-hour standoff with Parker, a survivalist, after he threatened a gas technician with a gun. Parker refused to emerge and shot at officers and police Swat vehicles. He was eventually struck by a police sniper.

name: Andrew Jackson
summary: Jackson fled police who were investigating a burglary, and was later found in a nearby home. Police allege that when they made contact, Jackson pulled out a knife and ignored multiple requests to drop the weapon.

name: Luis Chavez-Diaz
lawenforcementagency: California Department of Fish and Wildlife
summary: Chavez-Diaz was fatally shot during an early-morning raid by officers from several agencies on a marijuana patch at a wildlife reserve. Officials said he pointed a gun at officers and refused to drop it.
link3text: Guardian: Never before named: five people killed by police the world forgot

name: Joshua Deysie
summary: Deysie threatened a man with a gun, prompting the man to call police. Officers and Deysie were in a standoff for 30 minutes before Deysie allegedly pointed his weapon at police, who opened fire.

name: Erick Sanchez
summary: Sanchez was a suspect in an El Paso burglary. When police confronted him, he allegedly armed himself with a 'metal object' and threatened to kill the officers. They attempted to use a Taser but it had no effect, police said, and an officer opened fire when Sanchez charged at them with the object in his hand.

name: Alexia Christian
summary: Christian had been arrested for stealing a vehicle and was in the back of the police cruiser when she allegedly escaped her handcuffs, pulled a gun and fired three shots at the officers in the front seat. The officers got out and fired 10 shots at the car.
link1text: Guardian: Shooting of mother triggers transparency concerns

name: Fridoon Rawshannehad
summary: Rawshannehad was allegedly threatening customers with a knife in an adult bookstore. Police initially said he advanced on an officer wielding the knife, but it was later revealed that the officer mistook Rawshannehad's pen for a knife, according to legal filings. A witness who viewed CCTV footage of the incident said Rawshannehad was calm and was shot almost immediately. Rawshannehad's family is suing the city and the officer.

name: John Acree
summary: Police were attempting to serve Acree with a warrant when he pointed a pistol at an officer, who then shot him. Acree had a history of mental health issues.

name: Jeffery Adkins
lawenforcementagency: Greensville County Sheriff's Office and Virginia State Police
summary: Officers who had arrived to serve Adkins a warrant found him at his home visibly agitated and holding a sawed-off shotgun. Officers attempted to negotiate with Adkins, and he eventually fired at them.

name: Kenneth Mathena
summary: Mathena was allegedly found attempting to break into a house by Smyrna police officers responding to a reported violent domestic dispute. Police said Mathena was armed with a shotgun and pointed it in their direction, prompting them to open fire.

name: Elton Simpson
summary: Soofi and Simpson came to Garland prepared to attack the 'Muhammad Art Exhibit' hosted by the American Freedom Defense Initiative. The two got out of a vehicle with assault rifles and began firing at a police car, striking an officer. Officers, including Swat personnel, returned fire, killing both.
link1text: Guardian: Two gunmen shot dead at 'draw the prophet Muhammad' contest
link2text: Guardian: Phoenix home raided after shooting at Muhammad cartoon event

name: Nadir Soofi
summary: Soofi and Simpson came to Garland prepared to attack the 'Muhammad Art Exhibit' hosted by the American Freedom Defense Initiative. The two got out of a vehicle with assault rifles and began firing at a police car, striking an officer. Officers, including Swat personnel, returned fire, killing both.
link1text: Guardian: Isis claims responsibility for attack
link2text: Guardian: Twitter account that posted minutes before is closed

name: Kevin Norton
summary: Norton was on probation and not allowed to carry a gun. He was approached by officers responding to a call about a man with a handgun acting erratically. Police said he fled to a nearby wooded area and was shot when negotiations and beanbag rounds failed to disarm him.

name: Billy Grimm
streetaddress: Arenal Rd SW and Tapia Blvd SW
summary: Police were responding to a report of a suspicious vehicle. They allege that Grimm produced a weapon and did not comply with their commands to put it down. Grimm's girlfriend, who was present, said his hands were empty.

name: Roark Cook
lawenforcementagency: Benton County Sheriff's Office, Richland Police Department
summary: Police were responding to a call from Cook's mother, who was concerned that he had access to guns and that he might hurt himself or others. After arriving at the scene, police heard a disturbance and attempted to enter the home. A standoff ensued and Cook was shot, before retreating into the house and died. Police initially said Cook fired at them but this was later dismissed.

name: Michael Asher
summary: Troopers were responding to reports of gunshots coming from Asher's camper. When they arrived, police allege that Asher came outside with a firearm and raised it at them, prompting officers to fire.

name: Thong Kien Ma
summary: Ma attacked his neighbors, a married couple, killing the husband and severely injuring the wife. Ma reportedly believed the husband was stealing his home WiFi. Responding police said Ma refused to drop the meat cleaver he used in the attack, and charged at them with it. It is believed that Ma was on drugs and had not slept for three days.

name: Robert Frost
summary: An officer approached Frost's vehicle and saw him asleep with a firearm on his lap during a patrol of a storage center parking lot.
