When Frost awoke, the officer said, he began shooting, prompting the officer to return fire. Frost's family said he was a veteran of the first Gulf war who had PTSD.

name: Brendon Glenn
summary: Glenn was panhandling outside a bar in Venice when a customer complained that he was harassing customers. He wound up in a scuffle with a bouncer and two officers, one of whom shot and killed him. After viewing unreleased tape of the incident, LAPD police chief Charlie Beck said: 'Any time an unarmed person is shot by a Los Angeles police officer, it takes extraordinary circumstances to justify that. I have not seen those extraordinary circumstances.'

name: Nuwnah Laroche
summary: Laroche and Jason Champion were driving on the New Jersey Turnpike when their vehicle broke down. The two got out of the vehicle and began walking along the highway when they were struck by a police cruiser.

name: Jason Champion
summary: Champion and Nuwnah Laroche were driving on the New Jersey Turnpike when their vehicle broke down. The two got out of the vehicle and began walking along the highway when they were struck by a police cruiser.

name: David Johnson
summary: Johnson was suspected of stealing a handgun, and led police on a chase when they attempted to apprehend him. The chase ended when Johnson crashed his vehicle, then allegedly got out with a weapon and did not obey commands to drop it. Friends believe Johnson had depression.

name: Nephi Arriguin
summary: Officials said Arriguin, who was in his car, was shot because he tried to run down a deputy who was responding to reports of a 'suspicious couple knocking on doors'.

name: John Kaafi
summary: After Kaafi was arrested at a traffic stop, an ambulance was called when he complained of an asthma attack but it was then cancelled, police said. He was struck with a flashlight and tasered a number of times, with one probe striking the back of his head, while trying to escape the police car transporting him. He was taken to hospital from jail after again complaining of an asthma attack and died about 36 hours later, officials said. The medical examiner said Kaafi's death was accidental due to metabolic acidosis linked with cocaine use, but said the Taser use may have contributed to his death.

name: Michael Murphy
summary: Murphy was pursued by police after allegedly stealing a car at knifepoint. He got out of the vehicle and ran into woods beside the highway, according to officials. A confrontation with officers led to Murphy being shot dead.

name: Joseph Roy
summary: Neighbors called police to report that Roy was suicidal. Officers claim that when they arrived Roy brandished a knife and rushed at them with it.

name: Sam Holmes
summary: Police said Holmes was stopped for speeding and an officer tried to arrest him on suspicion of driving under the influence of alcohol. Holmes drove away and dragged the officer, who shot at the car.

name: Shaun Johnson
summary: Johnson's wife called 911 and said he had been asked to leave a bar for causing a disturbance. When deputies arrived, officials said, Johnson swung a sword at them and refused to put it down.

name: Dedrick Marshall
summary: Marshall was accused of pointing a handgun at an officer arriving at his house to discuss an aggressive confrontation he had earlier in the evening. A neighbor said he did not point the weapon.

name: David Schwalm
summary: Sheriff's deputies visited Schwalm's house after he made an emergency call saying he was suicidal, officials said. Schwalm was found armed with a long gun and allegedly pointed it towards the officers, prompting one of them to shoot him five times.

name: Lionel Young
summary: Deputies pursued Young, a suspect in a case of domestic violence involving a knife earlier in the day, who was driving his truck. Officials said when the chase came to a halt, Young rammed two police vehicles and was shot.

name: Michael Gallagher
summary: Gallagher was found by an officer responding to a break-in at a store. A struggle ensued, according to officials, and the officer shot Gallagher with his Taser. Gallagher became unresponsive.

name: Justin Way
summary: Way's girlfriend called authorities to report he was making suicidal threats, police said. When deputies arrived, they were confronted by Way wielding a large knife and one of them shot him, according to officials.

name: Kelvin Goldston
summary: Goldston, a wanted felon, allegedly struck a plainclothes police officer with his car while trying to flee a house that was under surveillance by drugs investigators.

name: Stephen Cunningham
summary: Cunningham stepped out of his house with a gun when police arrived to investigate a complaint of loud music, according to officials. He allegedly pointed the gun at an officer and refused to put it down.

name: D'Angelo Stallworth
summary: Stallworth allegedly pressed a handgun to the chest of an officer who arrived at an apartment building to serve an eviction notice. A struggle ensued, the handgun fell and Stallworth fled, officials said. When he turned back to the officers he was shot. Authorities said the officers believed Stallworth was still armed. His family disputes the police version.

name: Alec Ouzounian
summary: Ouzounian, who had several self-inflicted stab wounds, confronted deputies responding to a call that reported he was preparing to kill himself, according to officials. One shot him dead.

name: Bruce Zalonka
summary: Zalonka, who was one of Hawaii's most wanted fugitives, was shot when he reached for a handgun on the back seat of his car when intercepted by deputy marshals in a parking garage, according to officials.

name: Lorenzo Hayes
streetaddress: N Addison St and E Sanson Ave
summary: Hayes lost consciousness as officers attempted to place him in a restraint chair at the county jail, according to officials. He had been arrested for violating a no-contact court order. Police said he became combative.

name: Sean Pelletier
lawenforcementagency: Michigan State Police, Kalamazoo County Sheriff's Office and Portage Police Department
summary: Pelletier was pursued by police in his car over outstanding arrest warrants, including one for threatening a court official with a gun. He exited his car with an assault rifle and was shot by several officers, according to police.

name: Denis Reyes
summary: Reyes was restrained by police responding to a call reporting he was emotionally disturbed and breaking furniture at his mother's apartment. He went into cardiac arrest inside an ambulance, officials said.
link4text: Guardian: Reyes' mother: 'I saw death on the face of my son'

name: Mark Farrar
summary: Farrar, who had stripped naked, opened fire with an AR-15 rifle on officers arriving at his house in response to a 911 call from his wife warning that he was suicidal, according to officials. Police returned fire.

name: Matthew Coates
summary: Police said Coates brandished a genuine-looking BB gun when officers arrived at his house after a neighbor called 911 to report a domestic disturbance. His girlfriend said the disturbance had already ended and Coates told officers he was mentally ill.

name: Austin Goodner
summary: Goodner was shot after opening fire on an officer who had arrived to investigate the shooting of a man earlier in the day, according to officials. He reportedly told the officer to kill him and 'get this over with'.

name: Dennis Fiel
summary: Fiel was killed in a shootout with police following an early-morning high-speed chase after a failed traffic stop, according to officials. A police officer was shot in her upper torso by Fiel but was not seriously injured.

name: Timothy Jones
summary: Jones's mother called 911 to report that her son intended to kill her, according to authorities. Police said he 'aggressively advanced' towards officers who arrived at the home and refused to put down his weapon.

name: Ronell Wade
summary: Wade, a suspect in a series of dollar store robberies, is alleged to have opened fire on a police officer when confronted in a church parking lot.

name: Calvon Reid
summary: Police said they found Reid injured and in an 'agitated, combative state' in a gated retirement community. He was tasered at least three times and went into cardiac arrest, according to lawyers. Authorities did not disclose the death until witness accounts were published by the media. Coconut Bay's police chief promptly retired. Medical examiners ruled the death a homicide by electrocution. The officers involved have been cleared of wrongdoing, but the investigation is ongoing.
link1text: Guardian: How US police departments struggle to regulate Tasers, despite dozens of deaths after their use this year
link2text: Guardian: The death of Calvon 'Andre' Reid: 'Why use a Taser? And why was he treated so inhumanely?'

name: Jeremy Anderson
lawenforcementagency: Tampa Bay Police Department [US Marshals Service Task Force]
summary: The Marshals taskforce was serving a 'high-risk' warrant against Anderson, and he was killed during an exchange of gunfire that left one Tampa Bay officer injured.

name: Anthony Hill
summary: Police were responding to complaints about a naked man knocking on doors in an apartment complex. A deputy said Hill ran at him several times and ignored demands to stop.

name: Don Smith
lawenforcementagency: Indiana State Police, Tippecanoe County Sheriff's Department
summary: Smith was a suspect in a robbery and kidnapping, and led police on a chase before officers disabled his vehicle. Smith then allegedly pointed his weapon at officers.

name: Mark Adair
lawenforcementagency: Columbia Police Department and University of Missouri Police
summary: Adair was a suspect in an armed robbery and was shot after he 'engaged' the officers attempting to arrest him.

name: Tyrell Larsen
summary: Larsen evaded deputies who tried to pull him over for a traffic violation, eventually crashing his vehicle. When the deputy approached, Larsen allegedly drew a rifle and refused to drop it.

name: Reginald McGregor
summary: Police were responding to a fight between McGregor and a family member which ended in one man being shot. McGregor allegedly fired at police when they arrived.

name: Freddie Gray
summary: Gray died from injuries sustained during a prolonged ride in a police van while handcuffed and shackled on the floor. He was arrested after catching the eye of a police officer and running away. His death prompted protests and rioting in Baltimore and elsewhere. The six officers involved in his arrest were indicted on criminal charges including murder.
link3text: Guardian: Lieutenant ordered man arrested in personal dispute

name: Hashim Abdul-Rasheed
summary: Abdul-Rasheed tried to buy a plane ticket with a stolen ID at the Columbus airport. When he returned to his vehicle after being denied, he allegedly lunged at officers with a knife.

name: Joshua Garcia
summary: Garcia was arrested for a traffic violation and was placed in the front seat of a the police cruiser. According to deputies, he managed to slip his handcuffed hands in front of him and tried to steal the vehicle, and the officers fired in response.

name: Cary Martin
summary: Martin allegedly opened fire on deputies who arrived at his home after his partner called to warn he was suicidal and armed. He was wounded and died a week later in hospital.

name: Alfredo Rials-Torres
summary: Rials-Torres allegedly cut one officer's face and used a Taser on another after they arrived in response to complaints of a domestic disturbance involving him and his mother.

name: Anthony Gomez Jr
summary: Gomez engaged in a shootout with officers who had arrived to serve him with a warrant for terroristic threats, police said. He was accused of assaulting the mother of his child and threatening to kill her.

name: David Gaines
summary: Gaines crashed a truck into an oncoming motorcyclist, who was killed, before fleeing and carjacking a woman. Police said he was shot when officers exchanged fire with him.

name: Jonathan McIntosh
lawenforcementagency: Lonoke County Sheriff's Office and Arkansas Department of Community Correction
summary: After being handcuffed and arrested for possessing drugs, McIntosh allegedly opened fire on officers in the patrol car with a hidden compact gun.

name: Jonathan Colley
summary: Colley, who had a history of mental illness and said on Facebook that his life was coming to an end, allegedly refused to drop a knife when deputies arrived at the home he shared with his parents. One had called 911 to report he had threatened to kill them.

name: Marcus Wheeler
summary: Wheeler was killed after fatally shooting a police officer who was one day away from maternity leave when she and colleagues tried to arrest him on an assault charge.

name: James Cooper
summary: Cooper allegedly ran with a knife and cut the cheek of one of four officers who arrived at his home to serve him with a warrant for burglary.

name: Nikki Burtsfield
streetaddress: N Garner Lake Rd and Vaquero Ave
summary: Deputies chased Burtsfield in her car after she was reported trespassing at a mine, according to authorities, and she emerged from the vehicle with a knife.

name: Chrislon Talbott
lawenforcementagency: Owensboro Police Department and Kentucky State Police
summary: Following a four-hour siege at a motel, Talbott emerged from his room and opened fire on officers seeking him as part of an investigation into drug crimes, police said.

name: Jerome Caldwell
lawenforcementagency: South Carolina State Law Enforcement Division
summary: Caldwell, a suspect in the shooting of a sheriff's deputy a week earlier, opened fire as he emerged from a standoff at an apartment building, according to authorities.

name: Elvin Diaz
summary: Diaz allegedly rushed at officers with a knife after they arrived at his parents house when he did not show up for an appointment with probation officers.

name: Javoris Washington
summary: Washington, who is suspected to have been high on flakka, was shot after refusing to release a woman he was holding captive with a sharp object, according to police.

name: David Gandara
summary: Police said they were called to deal with a suicidal armed man at a children's daycare center. They found Gandara and shot him when he 'attempted to retrieve a firearm'.

name: Michael Lowrey
summary: Lowrey, a suspect in several burglaries, was found by state troopers inside a supermarket late at night. Authorities said he refused to put down what appeared to be a handgun. It turned out to be a BB gun.

name: James Horn Jr
summary: Horn was a fugitive after allegedly killing his girlfriend Sandra Sutton and her 17-year-old son. He had been charged with holding Sutton prisoner in a wooden box. He was said to have pointed his handgun at officers after being discovered hiding in a house on a wildlife reserve.

name: Caso Jackson
summary: Jackson, who was estranged from his wife, took her hostage along with three children and another adult. Police said he jumped out of the house firing at officers, injuring one in the face.

name: Eric Robinson
lawenforcementagency: Eagar Police Department and Apache County Sheriff's Office
summary: Robinson shot a pregnant woman in the parking lot of a Mormon center before fleeing in his truck when police arrived, according to authorities. He was fatally wounded in a shootout with officers at his home.

name: Cassandra Bolin
summary: Bolin was shot dead by a Swat sniper after emerging from a five-hour standoff pointing a gun at herself and officers, according to authorities. Police had responded to a call reporting that she was suicidal and earlier shot her with 'less-lethal' rounds.

name: Dalton Branch
summary: Branch was shot dead by plainclothes officers in a school parking lot a few hours after he allegedly killed his ex-girlfriend, Patricia Mohammed, outside a Queens casino. He had sent text messages to her relatives calling himself The Grim Reaper.

name: Anthony Briggs
summary: Briggs allegedly charged at officers with a knife at an apartment building after stabbing his brother and a neighbor. He was shot and died from his injuries in hospital.

name: Millard Tallant III
summary: A deputy responding to a 911 call about a suspicious man said he came across Tallant walking along the road. After making contact he and the man both fired, according to officials. Tallant's wife said he had discussed suicide.

name: Scott McAllister
summary: McAllister and police were engaged in a five-hour standoff after he allegedly assaulted his girfriend and made threats against her and their 13-month-old son. Swat officers eventually entered the premises and fired at McAllister, who was allegedly holding a knife. According to police, the child was near McAllister at the time and was not harmed.

name: Randall Torrence
summary: Torrence stopped breathing after he was shocked twice with a Taser by officers outside a Family Dollar store. He had allegedly kicked one officer in the chest and hit another in a leg as they responded to reports that he was acting bizarrely in a parking lot. Witnesses said he appeared to be under the influence of drugs. A doctor told reporters the shock from the Taser had been 'enough to push him over the edge'.

name: Garrett Sandeno
summary: Sandeno's wife called police to report he was suicidal and holding a weapon. Police said Sandeno refused multiple commands to drop the weapon, prompting them to fire. The weapon turned out to be a pellet gun.

name: Jessie Williams
summary: Williams was tracked down to a motel by FBI investigators searching for his nine-year-old niece, who had been reported missing the previous week. During an altercation inside the motel Williams was fatally shot and an FBI agent was shot in a leg.

name: Simon Hubble
summary: Hubble allegedly brandished a screwdriver at a deputy responding to a report that he planned to overdose on drugs or provoke a law enforcement officer. The deputy tried to subdue Hubble with a Taser, according to authorities, before opening fire near the home where the emergency call was made.

name: Harry Davis
streetaddress: Sparta Hwy and Oconee Springs Rd
summary: Police said Davis, a military veteran with a reported history of emotional problems, was shot when he threw a knife at an officer who responded to a complaint that Davis and his son were drunkenly fighting by the side of a road.

name: James Strong
lawenforcementagency: Northglenn Police Department and Thornton Police Department
summary: Strong allegedly opened fire when a Swat team carried out a morning raid on his home for a narcotics search warrant. A Northglenn police officer was hit twice before Strong was killed, according to authorities.

name: Feras Morad
summary: Friends said Morad, a nationally ranked debater who was preparing for university, had a bad reaction to psychedelic mushrooms and jumped through a second-story window. Police said he was shot after failing to obey commands to stop moving towards officers even when shocked with a Taser.
link1text: Guardian: Student 'was going to change the world', says sister

name: Darrell Morgan
summary: Morgan, a Baptist pastor, allegedly followed his estranged wife into a store and pulled out a handgun during an argument. He was shot dead after pointing the weapon at officers responding to a 911 call from the store manager, according to authorities.

name: Kenneth Dothard
summary: Dothard was shot outside a bank for drawing his handgun against direct instructions from a police officer, according to police. Authorities said Dothard appeared agitated when the officer called for backup after responding to a complaint about Dothard acting suspiciously.

name: Kyle Baker
summary: Baker, a high school senior, allegedly attacked and wounded police with a lawnmower blade when officers arrived at his home in response to a report that he was 'highly agitated' and intoxicated. Baker had been due to graduate the following week.

name: Kevin Allen
summary: Allen brandished a large serrated knife at two officers who followed him into a public library acting on a warrant for his arrest, according to police. Authorities said the officers opened fire after he charged at them and they failed to subdue him with pepper spray and batons.
link1text: Guardian: Police shoot man at library

name: Nehemiah Fischer
summary: Authorities said Fisher and his brother Brandon refused repeated commands from troopers to abandon their vehicle and move to higher ground to avoid rising floodwaters. Dashboard camera video shows Fischer approaching and shoving a trooper to the ground, prompting a different trooper to draw his weapon.
link2text: Guardian: Man killed in fight over truck rescue
link4text: Guardian- Dashcam footage shows pastor killed by police shoving trooper to ground

name: Robert Box
summary: Two Oregon state troopers opened fire shortly after making contact with Box while responding to a domestic disturbance, according to police.

name: Ebin Proctor
summary: Proctor allegedly fought with a deputy after fleeing on foot from a traffic stop. After using a Taser and pepper spray, the deputy opened fire during the scuffle and Proctor was fatally wounded.

name: Alexander Rivera
summary: Rivera reportedly took a hostage at gunpoint during an attempt to rob a pawn shop. According to witnesses, Rivera took the hostage outside and held a gun to her head. She wrestled with him as an officer opened fire and killed Rivera. His gun turned out to be an air pistol.

name: Richard Davis
summary: Davis collapsed after being shocked with a Taser. Police said he charged towards officers from his pickup truck with fists clenched after being told to come out with his hands up. Relatives said Davis was a veteran of the US marines and suffered breathing problems. He had crashed his truck into another vehicle and a church before locking himself inside the cab.

name: James Bushey
summary: Bushey allegedly stole beer from a Walmart and hid in the bathroom of a nearby restaurant. As officers escorted him away he pulled out what appeared to be a 9mm handgun and pointed it at officers, video shows. The weapon was later discovered to be a pellet gun.

name: Joseph Ladd
summary: Ladd was allegedly acting violently, making suicidal threats and had taken large quantities of Xanax. When an officer made contact, an altercation ensued and the officer was dragged by Ladd's vehicle, prompting him to fire, according to authorities.

name: James Morris
streetaddress: Juanipero Way and La Loma Dr
summary: Police said Morris was suicidal and threatened to hurt himself and officers. Police shot him after encountering him on a road near his home holding a firearm.

name: Usaama Rahim
summary: Rahim was killed during a confrontation with an FBI agent and a Boston police officer who were investigating him for a joint terrorism taskforce. Police said Rahim threatened them with a large military knife that he refused to put down.
link1text: Guardian: Boston police shoot man who was surveillance target

name: Billy Collins
summary: Authorities said Collins was shocked with a Taser several times and struck with a baton after becoming combative at a police station. He had been arrested on charges of driving without a license or insurance. Relatives said Collins had suffered a heart attack two weeks earlier and had stents implanted during surgery.

name: Kamal Dajani
summary: Dajani was discovered stabbing a woman by deputies responding to reports of a domestic disturbance, according to authorities. A man and a woman, also apparently bleeding from stab wounds, ran out of the home. Dajani allegedly refused repeated orders to drop the knife, and a deputy fired one shot.

name: Miguel Martinez
lawenforcementagency: Ellis County Sheriff's Department and Texas DPS
summary: Martinez and another man allegedly assaulted an officer and stole his marked police SUV after a gun was found in their vehicle during a traffic stop. The two led police on a chase before deputies stopped the vehicle with spike strips. Police said they attempted to negotiate with the two suspects, who threatened suicide, but Martinez exited the vehicle and pointed a shotgun at them. The other man, 23-year-old Daniel Dankert, appeared to have killed himself in the vehicle.

name: Edelmiro Hernandez
summary: Hernandez, a burglary suspect, led police on a chase before stopping and getting out of his vehicle, according to authorities. Police said when Hernandez threatened a K9 unit dog and handler with a knife, two other officers opened fire.

name: Ronald Neal
summary: After barricading himself inside his home, Neal came outside with a shotgun and a pistol and told police to shoot him, according to authorities. He then allegedly pointed a gun at officers, who were responding to reports of shots being fired.

name: David Dehmann
summary: Deputies arrested Dehmann for disorderly conduct and took him into custody at the county jail. At some point during booking, police said Dehmann became combative and deputies used a restraint technique, smashing his head into the ground in the process. Police report that he had pre-existing head injuries when he was taken into custody. Dehmann died at a hospital two days later.

name: Sherman Byrd Jr
summary: Byrd matched a description of a man suspected of robbing a woman of cash and her cellphone, and he rode away from officers on his bicycle, according to police. He was struck by the officers' vehicle during a pursuit and died from his injuries. Authorities said Byrd had a gun and that officers saw it during the chase.

name: Lorenzo Garza Jr
summary: Garza was shot when he allegedly opened fire on police from his vehicle as they pursued him for a suspected drive-by shooting earlier in the evening. Eleven officers fired their guns. Garza had fled at a high speed when officers arrived at his home, according to authorities.

name: Rudy Baca
summary: Baca was shot after agreeing to come out of a home to which deputies had been called to check on his welfare, according to authorities. Police said 'something happened' and the deputy opened fire.

name: Andrew Ellerbe
summary: An off-duty detective eating dinner in plain clothes killed Ellerbe after he and another masked men attempted to rob a pizza restaurant, according to authorities. One of the men allegedly opened fire with a pistol, which turned out to be firing blanks, after holding it to the officer's head.

name: Jesus Gomez
summary: Police said Gomez was shot dead by deputies responding to a report of domestic violence. He allegedly threatened to shoot any officer who came into the home. The body of a woman was found inside; Gomez was suspected of her homicide.

name: Donald Pinkerton-DeVito
summary: Pinkerton-DeVito was riding a bicycle when he was struck by a police car, according to authorities. He suffered heavy bleeding at the scene and died from his injuries.

name: Damien Ramirez
summary: Ramirez, who was wanted for parole violations, allegedly exchanged fire with officers on land beside a highway after crashing a stolen car on a high-speed chase. According to authorities, he had pointed his gun in his mouth and at his head before opening fire.

name: Demouria Hogg
streetaddress: Lakeshore Ave and Lake Park Ave
summary: Hogg was killed during a confrontation at his car after being reported passed out inside with a firearm nearby, according to authorities. Police said they used a bullhorn and fired beanbag rounds at his windows in an effort to wake him, and one officer attempted to subdue him with a Taser.

name: Alejandro Fernandez
streetaddress: Porter Dr and San Juan Rd
summary: Police said Fernandez, a criminal suspect, was shot when he began firing at officers while fleeing on foot over the Pajaro River after being approached near his home. One officer wearing a bulletproof vest was struck in the torso.

name: Joe Nevels
summary: Officers fatally shot Nevels as he charged at staff of a liquor store with a box cutter, according to authorities. He was reported to have stolen from the store and to have come in and out 'bloody and suicidal'.

name: Christie Cathers
summary: Cathers was shot by deputies following a vehicle chase, according to authorities. She was accused of displaying a knife to a group of residents. Initial reports, based on police radio transmissions, stated she had shot at officers, but police did not repeat this allegation. Police alleged Cathers tried to run down a deputy as the chase began and later struck a deputy's vehicle.

name: James Smillie
summary: Smillie allegedly reached for weapons in his pockets after putting down a rifle following a standoff with a police officer. Police said the officer had arrived at Smillie's home in response to a complaint of a domestic disturbance.

name: Donald Allen
streetaddress: W 51st St and S 129th Ave W
summary: Allen advanced and refused to drop a gun he had been firing in his backyard when approached by officers, according to police. His wife said he had been suffering from paranoia.

name: Gene Marshall
summary: Police said Marshall was fatally shot after approaching an officer while armed with a handgun. The officer had been dispatched to deal with a call reporting that Marshall was threatening to kill himself and his wife, according to authorities.

name: Matthew McDaniel
summary: Police were surveilling McDaniel in connection to a burglary spree in the area, and believed he was planning to rob a Burger King when they approached his vehicle, they said. McDaniel allegedly pointed a handgun at officers and they fired in response.

name: James Johnson
summary: Johnson repeatedly told officers arriving at his home to shoot him as they responded to a report that he was suicidal, according to police. Also said to be drunk, Johnson allegedly refused to drop his gun and pointed it at officers.

name: Rene Garcia
streetaddress: La Palma Ave and Helena St
summary: Garcia allegedly pulled up in his vehicle while police dealt with a separate traffic stop, and came at officers with an eight-inch kitchen knife. Police said he was shot by two officers.

name: Ross Anthony
summary: Police said Anthony went into 'medical distress' shortly after he was shocked with a Taser by one of four officers. He had struggled with officers while being arrested after entering a parked car that didn't belong to him. Anthony was reported to have been acting erratically.

name: Mario Ocasio
summary: Ocasio suffered a cardiac arrest after being shocked twice with a Taser and physically restrained by several officers, according to a lawsuit brought by his family. Police initially claimed that he confronted officers with scissors, but this was denied by his family. Ocasio's girlfriend said she called 911 seeking an ambulance because he appeared to be high on drugs and acting erratically, and did not intend to summon the police.
link1text: Guardian: How US police departments have struggled to regulate Tasers, despite dozens of deaths after their use this year

name: Jeremy Linhart
summary: Linhart, who was wanted for bail violation on drugs charges, was shot during a scuffle with a police officer following a routine traffic stop, according to authorities. He allegedly tried to get back into the vehicle. Police said a gun was later recovered from inside the car.

name: Richard Marolf
summary: Marolf was shot dead after a four-hour standoff at his home, according to officials. Deputies said they had been called by his wife, who reported he was suicidal and had guns.

name: Colby Robinson
summary: Robinson, a fugitive suspected of murdering two people in Oregon, was shot and killed by police after fleeing when a 7-Eleven clerk in a Dallas suburb recognised him from a wanted poster and raised the alarm.

name: Ryan Bolinger
streetaddress: Urbandale Ave and Merle Hay Rd
summary: Bolinger was shot after exiting his vehicle and moving towards a police car, according to authorities. He had stopped abruptly in a U-turn after being pursued at low speed. Police said the chase began when he drove up closely beside a separate traffic stop, got out of his car and 'danced around'.
link1text: Guardian: Officer kills unarmed man who 'walked with purpose'

name: Gregory Hartley
lawenforcementagency: Montgomery County Sheriff's Office, Tomball Police Department
summary: Police said Hartley, who was a wanted felon in a nearby county, fled his truck while holding a gun to his head and then pointed the weapon towards officers. He was shot several times by three officers. Hartley had been pursued after driving away from an attempted stop, according to authorities.

name: Quandavier Hicks
summary: Hicks allegedly confronted four police officers with a rifle as they knocked on doors to investigate a complaint of menacing about him. Witnesses claimed police kicked in the door to the building where they found Hicks.

name: Isiah Hampton
summary: Hampton allegedly pointed a gun at officers who had arrived at a Bronx apartment building in response to a 911 call reporting a man with a gun, according to authorities. Police said Hampton had shot and pistol-whipped his girlfriend during a domestic dispute.

name: Charles Ziegler
summary: Ziegler was shot by deputies when he allegedly reached for a gun in his car during a physical struggle in a strip mall parking lot. He was suspected of a bank robbery the day before and had been followed to the scene by deputies, according to authorities.

name: Fritz Severe
summary: Police said Severe, who was homeless, was shot because he would not drop a 'metal stick' or piece of piping that he was holding during a confrontation. Officers had been called to a reported violent dispute, according to authorities. Witnesses said dozens of children were nearby.

name: Raymond Phillips
summary: Phillips allegedly pointed his weapon at officers who found him after being dispatched to perform a welfare check. According to witnesses, he had left his home with guns threatening to harm himself.

name: Raymond Peralta-lantigua
summary: Police said Peralta-lantigua advanced at an officer with a large knife when they arrived at his home. Peralta-lantigua's mother had called them becase he was 'trashing' the apartment.

name: Mark Flores Jr
summary: Flores shot and wounded his father, according to authorities. When deputies arrived to respond to the disturbance he also fired at them, injuring one before deputies returned fire and killed him.

name: Shelly Lynn Haendiges
summary: Haendiges was allegedly involved in the armed robbery of a convenience store. When police arrived, she allegedly turned her weapon at officers. It was later discovered to have been a BB gun.

name: James Boulware
summary: Boulware fired shots at the Dallas police headquarters from an armored vehicle before ramming a police vehicle and leading officers on a chase. Police attempted to negotiate with Boulware, and when those talks broke off he was shot by a Swat sniper. Explosive devices were found in Boulware's vehicle and at police headquarters. Both were disarmed.
link1text: Guardian: Police confirm HQ attack suspect is dead
link2text: Guardian: Dallas gunman rams police car
link3text: Guardian: Dallas police shooting suspect's family considered him 'lost to mental health'

name: David Munday
summary: Munday allegedly assaulted a corrections counselor. After struggling with staff he was placed in restraints and then suffered a 'medical episode'. He was taken to the prison's medical unit. Officials said staff attempted to provide aid. He died within 90 minutes of the initial confrontation.

name: Deng Manyoun
summary: Manyoun advanced towards an officer with a flagpole and did not obey commands to drop it, according to police. He swung the pole in a 'sledgehammer-like motion', prompting an officer to open fire, police said. Police had originally been dispatched over an alleged assault.

name: Anthony Hodge
summary: Police said they encountered Hodge holding a gun while investigating a disturbance. He allegedly ignored several commands to drop the firearm. Authorities did not explain whether or not he pointed the gun at officers.

name: Candace Blakley
summary: Blakely was shot and killed by her husband, Matthew, an off-duty Aiken County sheriff's deputy. Matthew Blakely was seen by officers running from the residence with blood on his hands. Candace Blakley's body was found in their bathroom with a single shot to the head. The off-duty deputy was arrested shortly after and charged with involuntary manslaughter. He was later fired from his job.

name: Kenneth Garcia
summary: Police said they witnessed Garcia assaulting a woman inside a truck and that when they approached, he drove off and led them on a high-speed chase. Officers were able to stop his vehicle briefly before he started to accelerate towards them. The alleged assault victim was later identified as Garcia's girlfriend.

name: Zane Terryn
summary: Zane allegedly shot and wounded a sheriff's deputy during a routine traffic stop. The deputy fired back, injuring the female 16-year-old driver, Morgan McNeil, and killing Zane. According to investigators, Morgan and Zane had been dating and made a plan to drive to Ohio and take their own lives.

name: Kris Jackson
summary: Police were responding to reports of a woman screaming in a motel room. Officials said they heard a gunshot from the back of the room when they arrived, and that the officer who fired believed Jackson had a gun. But no weapon was found at the scene.

name: Tamara Seidle
summary: Seidle was shot by her ex-husband Philip, a sergeant with the Neptune police department. Investigators described the incident as a potential custody dispute and stated Philip Seidle struck his ex-wife's vehicle, got out and shot her through the front window with his service weapon. The pair's seven-year-old daughter witnessed the incident from the front seat of Philip Seidle's vehicle. He has been charged with murder and child endangerment.

name: Christopher DeLeon
summary: DeLeon allegedly shot another man in a dispute before running into a stairwell at a local toy store. Police said when they arrived he emerged from the stairwell with a weapon and failed to comply with officers' commands to drop it.

name: Alan Williams
summary: Williams was struck by a deputy's vehicle while riding on his moped. The deputy attempted to pass another vehicle on the left and collided with Williams from behind. Williams's family have questioned the integrity of the investigation into his death after some of his personal items were found at the crash scene two days after his death.

name: Jermaine Benjamin
summary: Deputies were dispatched after 911 calls about a man 'tripping' and acting strangely. When they arrived, deputies attempted to restrain Benjamin, who then became unconscious. Relatives told reporters that an officer pressed his knee into the back of Benjamin's neck, forcing his face into the ground. Police said officers performed CPR, but Benjamin died hours later in the hospital. A medical examiner said Benjamin had taken the drug flakka, and attributed his death to 'excited delirium'.

name: Wendy Chappell
summary: Police said a man reported that his wife had threatened to shoot him. Officers pursued Chappell's vehicle, eventually disabling it with spike strips. A brief standoff ensued before she allegedly fired at the officers and they returned fire.

name: Joseph Charboneau
summary: Charboneau was shot and killed by a Spirit Lake tribal police officer and the FBI is now investigating. No further details were made available.

name: Oleg Tcherniak
summary: A bystander alerted police that Tcherniak was assaulting a woman outside a subway station. Authorities said Tcherniak then 'slashed' the responding officer with a long knife, prompting the officer to fire.
link1text: Guardian: NYPD officer kills man who slashed him with knife

name: Kenneth Lanphier
summary: Officers were responding to a suicidal subject call when they encountered Lanphier. Officials said he brandished a weapon and fired at police. An unidentified woman on the scene was also struck and killed by gunfire, which was believed to have come from Lanphier weapon.

name: Trepierre Hummons
summary: Hummons called 911 to alert authorities to a man wielding a gun and acting erratically. When police arrived on the scene Hummons fired at and killed police officer Sonny Kim before other officers returned fire. Friends of Hummons said he sent text messages and posted to social media suggesting he was suicidal.
link1text: Guardian: Cincinnati officer and suspect killed in shootout

name: Louis Atencio
summary: Officials alleged that Atencio ignored orders to drop a firearm. Officers were responding to reports that a woman had been shot when they encountered him standing in the street with the weapon, according to police. The woman was taken to hospital, where she underwent surgery. Her condition is unknown.

name: Santos Laboy
summary: Laboy, who was wanted on unspecified warrants, allegedly ran from police before brandishing a knife at a Massachusetts state trooper and refusing commands to drop it.

name: Charles Marshall
summary: Marshall allegedly lunged with a power drill at a deputy, prompting him to fire. The officer, who was responding to a call about a suicidal man, said he encountered Marshall in his home harming himself with the tool.

name: Adrian Simental
summary: Simental was shot while officers swept through a home he was accused of breaking into, according to officials. They had been called by his family, who reported he was acting 'insane' and had injured himself. A witness said Simental shouted at officers to shoot him.

name: James Barrett
summary: Barrett allegedly shot at deputies, who were responding to a domestic disturbance, and fled into woods. He was eventually found after a multi-agency manhunt and died from gunshot wounds. Barrett is also alleged to have set a house on fire before fleeing.

name: Tyrone Harris
summary: Harris was killed when a stolen vehicle he was driving got stuck in traffic and he allegedly started firing at police. Five officers returned fire. Police said Harris was a gang member who had 'some type of breakdown', carjacked a vehicle and fired a rifle at multiple targets including his mother, a daycare, a jitney driver and a sheriff's deputy.

name: Tyler Wicks
summary: Police said Wicks repeatedly threatened to kill officers and refused multiple commands to drop an assault rifle he was holding. Officers were responding to a call about a man with a gun, according to authorities.

name: Eduardo Reyes
summary: Reyes began shooting at police from a second floor window as they responded to a report that he was harming his wife and was armed with a handgun, according to authorities. Officers returned fire and he was fatally struck.

name: Jonathan Wilson
summary: Police said officers fired at an 'irate' Wilson when he was found breaking windows and throwing items from a home, including a knife. A 911 caller had told them Wilson had admitted to a murder and was armed with a knife, according to authorities.

name: Joshua Dyer
summary: Authorities said Dyer was a passenger in a car that drove away from a traffic stop. After leading officers on a chase, the driver got out of the vehicle, then got back in and allegedly reversed the vehicle towards officers, who then opened fire.

name: Randall Waddel
summary: Waddel allegedly pulled a knife on paramedics who were responding to a 911 call about a man stumbling and 'acting strangely'. Paramedics backed away and the Waddel reportedly ran into a retail store. Police responded shortly thereafter and following a 'confrontation' inside the store, the officer fired.

name: Damien Harrell
summary: Harrell, a fugitive who was wanted on firearms charges, allegedly pulled a gun on a deputy during a confrontation after a vehicle accident. The incident was recorded on the officer's body camera, according to authorities.

name: Spencer McCain
summary: McCain was shot by three officers who had arrived to deal with a 'domestic situation' at a home from which he was barred by a protective order, according to authorities. Officers said McCain, who had threatened suicide, was in a 'defensive position' and they thought he had a gun. No firearm was found. Shell casings found on the floor indicated the officers fired 19 times.

name: Allen Hernandez
lawenforcementagency: Owyhee County Sheriff's Office, Homedale Police Department, Owyhee County Posse
summary: Hernandez stopped breathing and died while being held down by three officers during an extended struggle, according to authorities. He also suffered facial injuries. Police said officers were responding to reports of a fight between Hernandez and three other men at a house where he had arrived and asked to use the telephone after a minor car crash. He had reportedly not suffered serious injuries in the vehicle accident.

name: Gilbert Vanderburgh
summary: Vanderburgh allegedly pointed a rifle at deputies from the window of a lakeside house they were surrounding after an hour-long standoff. Police said the officers had been led there by a suspect in a trtruck theft suspect, later named as 29-year-old Kyle Snipes, who escaped following the shooting.

name: Richard Matt
summary: Matt, a convicted murderer who had escaped from a maximum-security state prison almost three weeks earlier, was shot dead by law enforcement officers searching for him and a fellow escapee in the foothills of the Adirondack mountains. Authorities said Matt was armed with a shotgun and refused an order to put his hands up before he was killed.
link1text: Guardian: Prison break convict killed by police
link2text: Guardian: Police believe escapees are armed
link3text: Guardian: DNA found in rural cabin

name: Alfontish Cockerham
summary: Cockerham was shot when he allegedly pointed a gun at a police officer. According to authorities he had fled when confronted by an officer who was responding to a report of a man with a firearm. Cockerham died in hospital five days later, having been charged with two felonies.

name: Joe Cisneros
summary: Cisneros was shot dead by an undercover detective after allegedly reaching for a handgun that fell from his pocket as he fled a traffic stop beside a high school. Authorities said police in the area carrying out surveillance work on car burglaries pulled over his car because it appeared suspicious.

name: Joshua Crittenden
summary: Crittenden was involved in a fight with another man where at least one firearm was seen by officers, according to authorities. Crittenden fled into a house and reportedly took refuge in an attic. When he emerged, he allegedly opened fire on an officer who then returned fire.

name: Alan Bellew
summary: Bellew was shot and killed standing outside a parked car in a grocery store parking lot after police made contact with him. A firearm was recovered from the scene, but police have not yet said why they contacted him or what role the weapon played.

name: Richard LaPort
lawenforcementagency: Saratoga County Sheriff's Office, New York State Police
summary: LaPort was fatally shot after allegedly firing into the air and levelling a shotgun at officers during an encounter at a home near Great Sacandaga Lake. Authorities said officers were responding to a call from LaPort, who was threatening to harm himself. His death was ruled a suicide by police.

name: Cesar Enriquez
streetaddress: E Broadway Rd and S Pioneer
summary: Enriquez, who was wanted for the fatal stabbing of a woman earlier in the day, was fatally shot when he refused officers' commands to put down a gun following a short foot chase, according to authorities.

name: Clay Lickteig
summary: During a confrontation on a residential driveway, Lickteig opened fire on officers who had arrived at a home to serve him with a felony probation warrant, according to authorities.

name: James Payne Jr
summary: Payne died from injuries sustained when a police cruiser collided with his motorcycle. A preliminary inquiry found a 'no left turn' sign was posted where the officer turned left out of a gas station to enter the highway. The officer is also under investigation for working a second job as a bouncer without permission while on paid leave during the investigation into the crash.

name: Kevin Judson
summary: Police said Judson ran on foot from a traffic stop and a deputy gave chase, at one point attempting to subdue Judson with a stun gun. Judson eventually ran to the deputy's patrol car and the two struggled for control of the vehicle. Authorities said Judson's hand was near a loaded rifle in the police car during the struggle, and that he tried to drive away with with deputy's hand in the door.

name: Douglas Buckley
summary: Buckley allegedly pointed two BB guns that resembled real firearms at officers outside a house. Police said officers had arrived after the owner reported Buckley had called her and threatened to burn the house down. Relatives said he was suicidal.

name: Alan Dunnagan
summary: Dunnagan's vehicle was struck by a marked patrol car that was being driven by a sergeant, who allegedly failed to yield to a traffic signal. Dunnigian died 10 days later from his injuries. The sergeant has been charged with misdemeanor death by motor vehicle.

name: Keaton Farris
summary: Farris was being held in the county jail for forging a check. Officials said they cut off the water supply to his cell after he tried to flood it. Investigators found Farris died from dehydration and that he was given insufficient water to survive. Two corrections officers resigned after it was found they forged reports on how frequently they had checked on Farris.

name: Kaleb Landon
summary: Officers opened fire on Landon, the prime suspect for the murder of a woman in California, after a brief standoff on a highway, according to authorities. Landon was said to have crashed into another vehicle after leading officers on a mile-long chase when he was spotted.

name: Julian Joseph
summary: Joseph was fatally shot following an hours-long standoff with police at his apartment building after he allegedly robbed a nearby bank. Authorities said officers tried unsuccessfully to smoke him out with teargas.

name: Victo Larosa III
summary: Larosa was shot after tripping and falling to the ground while fleeing officers following an undercover sting operation against drug deals, according to the sheriff's office. He had already struck one officer with his vehicle. The officer alleged that he opened fire because Larosa reached into his waistband. No recovered firearm was mentioned in the initial account given by authorities.

name: Brian Johnson
lawenforcementagency: West Virginia State Police, Summers County Sheriff's Department
summary: Johnson took a woman hostage at his home, according to police. As officers arrived they were warned Johnson had expressed a desire to 'suicide by cop'. He allegedly pointed a crossbow at attending officers, who opened fire.

name: Ton Nguyen
summary: Police said Nguyen was fatally shot after charging at officers with a knife when they arrived at his condominium complex. Officers were responding to a 911 call alleging that Nguyen was assaulting neighbors, according to authorities.

name: Kawanza Beaty
summary: Beaty allegedly turned and pointed a sawn-off shotgun at officers who were chasing him on foot. Beaty's family said that a medical examiner's report indicates he was shot in the back of the head. The officer who shot Beaty was involved in a 2012 shooting that left a man paralyzed, the Daily Press reported.

name: Oscar Camacho
summary: After calling 911 to say he was suicidal, Camacho approached responding police officers with a handgun, acccording to authorities. Police said they considered his actions to be 'suicide by cop'.

name: Arturo Lopez
summary: Lopez was shot after he allegedly pulled a pistol from his jacket on detectives who had stopped him and a friend during an anti-gang crime patrol. The friend was said to have fled on foot.

name: Cesar Juarez
summary: Juarez allegedly advanced with a large kitchen knife at an officer responding to a call reporting that he had stabbed his brother. Police said he got up and continued to advance even after the officer used a Taser on him.

name: Christian Siqueiros
summary: Siqueiros died from a heart attack following a physical altercation with police, who were responding to a report that he was causing a disturbance. Police said he became combative and had to be restrained. Siqueiros's sister and a neighbour said that a large group of officers had been on top of him during the struggle.

name: Robert Malone
summary: Authorities said Malone pointed a handgun at a police helicopter and officers on the ground. He was being pursued by officers responding to a complaint that he was trying to break into cars at an apartment complex.

name: Bryan Bauer
summary: Bauer was shot and killed by police after allegedly opening fire on officers when they arrived at his hotel. He was reported to be firing shots inside his room and out of a window, as well as releasing pepper spray outside the room.

name: Michael Gaby
summary: During a confrontation at a car wash, Gaby allegedly pulled a handgun on an officer who attempted to arrest him on outstanding warrants.

name: Michael Holt
summary: Holt was killed at a downtown hotel in an early-morning shootout with officers, according to authorities. Police were responding to a 911 call reporting that Holt had already shot someone.

name: Richard Munroe
summary: Police responded to a 911 call from Munroe, who was said to have been distraught and made suicidal comments. They encountered him holding a gun near his home. Police said Munroe, who had apparently self-inflicted wounds on his arms, was shot when he refused orders to drop the weapon.

name: Neil Van De Putte
streetaddress: Lacey Rd and Deerhead Lake Dr
summary: While crossing a street, Van De Putte was struck by a police patrol car being driven by an officer who was responding to an unrelated call. Authorities said Van De Putte was walking against the traffic signal. Van De Putte's family says the officer was speeding.

name: John Deming Jr
summary: Police were responding to a burglar alarm when authorities said they encountered Deming inside a business acting 'agitated and aggressive'. According to police, they attempted to use beanbag rounds to subdue Deming before he escaped through back window, where officer Daniel Kunkel began following him. Police say the two wound up in a physical altercation after Kunkel's Taser failed to stop Deming, who wound up on top of the officer, 'pummeling his head'. Kunkel claimed he was afraid he would lose consciousness and fired his weapon once at Deming's torso and again at his face when the initial shot failed to stop the attack.

name: Johnny Ray Anderson
summary: Police were responding to reports of a prowler in the neighborhood but have provided little details on the the circumstances before Anderson's death. Anderson's wife said her husband had been fixing a bicycle near the house the homeless couple had been squatting in, but fled when police arrived due to a fear of being caught trespassing.  Anderson jumped a fence and was then shot in the torso.

name: Tyler Rogers
summary: Rogers was allegedly trying to break into a car. When an officer arrived they found him hiding in a nearby backyard. Rogers allegedly pointed a gun at the officer, prompting him to draw his weapon and fire, according to the police account.

name: Adam Dujanovic
summary: Dujanovic allegedly advanced at officers in a threatening manner while holding a large steel pole, according to police. He reportedly refused to comply with officers' orders before police opened fire. The officers were initially responding to reports that Dujanovic had been trying to break into properties in the area.

name: Marcellus Burley
summary: Burley, two men and a woman led police on a chase after an alleged failed carjacking attempt. Authorities said when the chase ended, shots were fired, killing Burley and injuring one of the other men and the woman. The third man escaped.

name: Maximo Rabasa
summary: Rabasa allegedly ran at an officer while carrying a knife. The officer fled to a patrol car and locked themselves inside. Rabasa, who was dressed only in a pair of boxer shorts, refused to drop the knife when more police arrived and then lunged at an an officer. He was shocked with Tasers 'multiple' times and died days later in hospital after a cardiac arrest.

name: Jason Hendley
summary: Hendley was suspected of attacking his mother and killing his mother's fiance inside a family home, according to police. Two officers then encountered Hendley, described as covered in blood, and opened fire after he refused to drop a knife, according to police.

name: John Berry
summary: Berry was reported to be 'acting strangely' and off his medication when deputies arrived. According to police he drove his vehicle into a patrol car and reversed away, hitting a deputy who sustained minor injuries. Four deputies opened fire after attempting to deploy a Taser and pepper spray. Berry's family disputes the police account, saying bystander video shows that the deputies' lives were not in danger.

name: Joe Cody
summary: Police were attempting to apprehend Cody for a parole violation when he allegedly raised a firearm at the approaching officers. Some witnesses have said that Cody fired his weapon before officers shot him, but this has not yet been confirmed by police.

name: Hagen Esty-Lennon
summary: Police were responding to reports of a car accident when they say they encountered Esty-Lennon bleeding from the chest and holding a knife. Police said he refused commands to drop the knife and then lunged at officers. The incident was captured by body cameras worn by both responding officers.

name: Daniel Hernandez Jr
summary: Hernandez was shot in a park by officers responding to reports that he was firing a gun. Authorities said a firearm was recovered, but it was not clear whether Hernandez fired at or pointed it at officers. Witnesses reportedly said a passing car was fired at.

name: Josh Blough
summary: Authorities said Blough wielded a knife aggressively during a confrontation with police, who had been called by his girlfriend to check on his welfare. Blough had survived being shot in the neck in October 2012 after he turned a weapon on a Kentucky state trooper.

name: Unknown
summary: The man allegedly entered a grocery store and stabbed a clerk to death before fleeing the scene. Officers arrived as the man was running away and reportedly fired eight shots.

name: Jose Lopez
summary: Lopez had allegedly been involved in an altercation with his wife and their teenage daughter before locking himself in a room with a rifle and threatening to harm himself. Authorities said Lopez shot at police during a three-hour standoff before officers shot and killed him.

name: Michael Westrich
summary: Westrich allegedly fired at officers who were responding to a domestic violence call at a mobile home park. One officer was reported injured during the shootout. Other officers returned fire, fatally wounding Westrich.

name: Nicholas Booth
summary: Booth allegedly opened fire at an officer when he came to a dead end following a car chase. Authorities said he was an armed carjacking suspect, and had been found and pursued when police received a report that the stolen vehicle had been spotted.

name: David Sarabia
streetaddress: Green Sands Ave and Augusta Ln
summary: Sarabia was fatally shot after allegedly advancing at officers with a knife following a lengthy car chase. He was accused of kidnapping a woman in his vehicle and cutting himself with the knife. Witnesses said Sarabia was covered in blood and that when officers used a Taser on him he removed the prongs from his skin.

name: Dallas Shatley
summary: Shatley allegedly dragged a deputy with his vehicle during a confrontation at his home when officers responded to a report of a disturbance. Another deputy shot and killed him.

name: Robert Hammonds
streetaddress: N 19th Ave and W Cactus Rd
summary: Hammonds allegedly pointed a gun at officers who had pursued him into the courtyard of an apartment complex. Police said Hammonds and another man had driven away from a traffic stop and fled their vehicle after being spotted by a police helicopter. The second man was arrested.

name: William McIntire
streetaddress: N 40th St and E Flora St
summary: McIntire, a retired army veteran, died after being struck by a vehicle while walking from a bar, according to authorities. The vehicle sped away and police initially described the incident as a fatal hit-and-run collision. Weeks later, they disclosed that McIntire had been struck by one of their own officers driving an unmarked SUV, and said it was now unclear whether the impact from the vehicle was what killed him. Fellow customers said McIntire was upright and appeared fine when he left the bar. But surveillance video appeared to show him staggering beside the road before he was hit.

name: Martice Milliner
summary: Police said Milliner was shot after pulling a gun from his waistband as he was apprehended by officers responding to reports of a man carrying a firearm. Having fallen to the ground, Milliner pointed his gun at officers and was shot again, according to authorities.

name: Rocco Palmisano III
summary: Palmisano shot dead on the driveway of his home after allegedly pointing a gun at a police officer. According to authorities the officer was responding to a complaint that Palmisano was striking a child in the face. The child was said to have suffered minor injuries.

name: Jonathan Sanders
summary: An attorney for Sanders's family said an officer choked him to death with a flashlight. But police chiefs denied this, and said he sustained injuries during a physical fight involving no weapons. Sanders had been exercising his horse before the encounter with the officer, according to his family.
link1text: Guardian: Police accused of choking unarmed man to death with flashlight

name: Cyrus Hurtado
summary: Two deputies shot Hurtado when he refused to put down a rifle he pointed at them after emerging from his home, according to authorities. Police said his grandparents had called 911 to report he had beaten his grandfather with a club and killed their kitten.

name: Neil White
summary: The man was shot after allegedly grabbing an officer's Taser and shocking him with it during a struggle as police tried to apprehend him, according to authorities. Officers were responding to a report that he had been smashing windows with a skateboard. They pursued the man on his skateboard with their car until he fell or jumped off, police said.

name: James Todora
summary: Todora opened fire on a rookie police officer as the officer and his partner approached his car for a routine traffic stop, according to authorities. The partner returned fire and fatally wounded Todora. Police said Todora made suicidal threats before opening fire.

name: George Mann
summary: Authorities said Mann became unresponsive after he was 'drive-stunned' with a Taser directly on his body during an altercation with officers. Police were responding to a report that he was irate and possibly armed while locked in a garage.

name: Javon Hawkins
summary: Hawkins was reportedly swinging a sword or metal bar at cars and people in a park. Authorities said that when Hawkins refused an officer's command to drop the weapon, the officer felt threatened and discharged her weapon.

name: Frederick Farmer
summary: 911 calls reported that Farmer fired shots into an apartment building in the early hours of the morning. When police responded, he had fled. Two officers returned later and encountered Farmer, who reportedly opened fire and seriously injured one officer. Farmer was struck more than once, according to police, and died at the scene.

name: David Lepine
summary: Blood was spotted on Lepine's car and he declined to explain why it was there, according to police. He then fled and allegedly reached for his waistband before he was shot by an officer. A gun was discovered close to the scene of the chase, according to police.

name: Billy Maine
summary: Maines was fatally shot when he levelled a gun at deputies who had arrived at a house in response to complaints that he was threatening relatives, according to authorities. He was said to have ignored several orders to put down his weapon.

name: Paul Castaway
summary: Police initially said Castaway approached officers with a large knife after they pursued him on foot from a mobile home park. Surveillance footage showed him pointing the knife only at himself. Police also accused Castaway of stabbing his mother in the neck,but later said he had only threatened her.

name: Salvado Ellswood
summary: An officer said he fatally shot Ellswood after the man punched him in the face during an evening encounter behind a doctors' office building that he was patrolling. Police said the veteran officer, who had asked Ellswood to leave, first used his Taser but that it was ineffective.

name: Freddie Blue
streetaddress: Brown Bridge Rd and Charleston Pl
summary: Blue and another man were shot by deputies who had stopped a car in which they were passengers. Authorities said the vehicle was linked to a crime. One of the men allegedly pulled a gun on the officers, prompting them to fire. The other passenger was wounded and later released from hospital. The driver was arrested.

name: Matthew Watson
summary: Watson was shot dead after he allegedly ambushed and opened fire on officers who had arrived at his home following a 911 call from a woman in distress. One officer was wounded and another was struck in a bulletproof vest. Inside the home Watson's mother was found wounded and a man was found dead.

name: Nyal Brown
summary: Brown was turning on to a main street, driving a van. He was killed after being struck by an SUV being driven at high speed by a sheriff's deputy. Authorities said the deputy was pursuing a separate suspected drunk-driver who had just narrowly avoided crashing into the SUV before speeding away.

name: Christopher Benton
summary: Benton was killed when his 'hostile behavior' forced officers to open fire during a confrontation at his house, according to authorities. An attempt to serve a search warrant related to illegal drugs had led to the building being surrounded by a Swat team.

name: Matthew Graham
lawenforcementagency: Siskiyou County Sheriff's Office, Shasta County Sheriff's Office, California Highway Patrol
summary: Graham was identified as the armed carjacker shot dead by officers who had tracked down a vehicle stolen from a couple earlier in the day. He was being sought in connection with the disappearance of his six-month-old daughter, who authorities said was presumed dead. Police say he fired at officers befire being shot.

name: Shane Gormley
summary: Gormley went into cardiac arrest after being shocked with a Taser four times during a struggle with an officer, according to authorities. After eluding capture by police several times in the preceding few days following his escape from a jail work-release scheme, he beat an elderly woman and attempted to steal her car in an effort to escape from the officer. He was placed into a coma in hospital but died a week later.

name: Rafael Suazo
summary: Suazo was observed dealing heroin during an undercover sting, according to police. When a plainclothed officer identified himself, Suazo allegedly drove his vehicle at him. The officer opened fire, shooting Suazo once in the head. He died later in hospital. Two suspects who allegedly bought drugs from Suazo were later arrested.

name: Chacarion Avant
summary: Avant was involved in an armed home invasion and pointed an assault rifle at deputies, according to police. Two other suspects escaped, and one man inside the house was injured during the incident, police said.

name: Bruce Stafford
summary: Stafford was arrested for trying to sell stolen puppies. After arriving at the county jail for booking, a 'brief physical altercation' occurred and Stafford became unconscious, according to police. He died after officers attempted to render medical assistance, according to police.

name: Charles Crandall
summary: Deputies were responding to a report that Crandall had fired at the vehicle of a friend who was coming to pick him up. Crandall fired at officers from inside a home as they tried to enter, authorities said, and they returned fire.

name: Eugene Kailing
summary: State police authorities said a driver alerted them to Kailing who was acting erratically in a partially overturned vehicle. Kailing then rushed at a state troper with a metal pipe, according to police. The trooper attempted to deploy a taser and then shot Kailing after he continued to move towards police, according to authorities.

name: Anthony Smith
summary: Authorities say the incident began with a call about a mentally ill person attacking a family member. A responding officer was allegedly attacked by the person, who then fled. Several hours later officers responded to a call about a stabbing and found the same person who refused to drop an 'unknown object'.

name: Jason Davis
summary: Davis was shot after he allegedly refused to drop a knife and then advanced 'aggressively' towards officers. He was found outside a cafe where he was reported after a witness spotted him holding a knife. David died three days later in hospital.

name: Patrick Pippin
lawenforcementagency: Kansas City Police Department, US Marshals
summary: Pippin was shot after a car chase with officers. He had been pursued by US Marshals and local police after leaving a home where a warrant had been issued for a different man. According to an FBI spokesman, Pippin's vehicle lost a tire before it came to a stop, at which point he emerged holding a firearm.

name: Saige Hack
summary: Hack apparently barricaded himself with a firearm when officers responded to a call about a domestic disturbance. Authorities said Hack fired from the home at officers.

name: Edward Foster
summary: Police said officers were responding to a call about a man with a gun near a construction site when they encountered Foster. According to authorities, 'a gun was brandished' and the officer opened fire.

name: Antonio Gonzales
summary: Police were called when Gonzalez, who is believed to have an unspecified mental illness, allegedly became violent and brandished a sword. Police say he refused commands to drop the sword and officers opened fire.

name: Mohammad Abdulazeez
summary: Abdulazeez fired '50 to 60 rounds' at an armed services recruiting center, killing a navy sailor before driving to a naval reserve base and killing four US marines in an attack that is being investigated as an act of terrorism. Abdulazeez also injured two others, including a Chattanooga police sergeant, before being killed by police gunfire.
link1text: Guardian: Four US marines and gunman killed in 'act of terrorism' in Tennessee
link2text: Guardian: four marines named as FBI investigates motive
link3text: Guardian: Chattanooga shooting victims: four marines 'will never be forgotten'

name: Samuel Smith
summary: Smith had rammed a police crusier and was eventually located in a residential neighborhood, according to police. Dashboard camera footage shows Smith lunging at an officer before he was shot. A knife was recovered at the scene.

name: Albert Davis
summary: Davis was involved in a 'very, very violent' struggle with an officer, according to police. The officer had been called after reports of a fight in the area involving five men. The officer deployed his Taser and then fired his gun once, striking Davis. Davis later died in hospital.

name: David Wheat Jr
summary: Wheat was allegedly assaulting a woman and making suicidal threats. He was shot 11 times after brandishing a knife, according to police, who also said the woman had been stabbed but sustained non-life threatening injuries.

name: Kevin Snyder
streetaddress: W Morten Ave and N 42nd Ln
summary: Snyder took his ex-girlfriend hostage at gunpoint, according to police. The woman escaped after officers arrived and Snyder fled, according to police. He was discovered in the neighborhood and exchanged gunfire with officers before he was shot.

name: Darrius Stewart
summary: Stewart was traveling in a vehicle that was stopped by police for a broken headlight. Authorities said he was placed in the back of a patrol car, unhandcuffed, while officers ran his name. When the officers returned to handcuff Stewart and take him into custody for outstanding warrants, police said he became combative and struck an officer with the handcuffs. The officer then drew his gun and fired. Stewart's mother told local news that her son had never been arrested and that the warrants were for someone else with the same name.

name: Jose Rodriguez
summary: It is believed that Rodriguez was a suspect in an aggravated robbery when he was fatally shot by an officer. However, police have not yet released any details on what led to the shooting.

name: Estevan Gomez
summary: Authorities said they were attempting to book Gomez into custody when he began fighting with police and reached for an officer's weapon. Police said an officer attempted to use a Taser on Gomez but it had no effect, prompting officers to fire.

name: Samuel DuBose
summary: Police initially said that an officer pulled DuBose over for a routine traffic stop which escalated into some type of altercation, and that DuBose dragged an officer with his vehicle for a distance before the officer fired. That account was later disproven by body camera footage released by Cincinnati prosecutor Joseph Deters, who announced that murder charges were being filed against University of Cincinnati police officer Ray Tensing.
link1text: Guardian- Police officer indicted for murder in fatal shooting of Samuel DuBose
link2text: Guardian- Cincinnati promises reform after Samuel Dubose's death but a family demands justice and answers
link3text: Guardian- Cincinnati prosecutor releases footage of Samuel DuBose killing  video

name: Jackie Brand
summary: Brand was reported missing by friends who also said that he had made statements 'indicating he was intending to harm himself'. Deputies said that when they located Brand he pointed a pistol at them.

name: Juan Ibarra
summary: A deputy who was off-duty and working security at a club intervened when a fight broke out between club patrons. A spokesman for the sheriff's office said that the deputy told a man with a semi-automatic handgun to drop the weapon, and the man instead turned towards the deputy, prompting him to fire.

name: Charles Dewey
lawenforcementagency: Colby Police Department, Thomas County Sheriff's Office
summary: Police were dispatched to respond to reports that Dewey was armed and involved in a domestic disturbance. Dewey allegedly left the home on foot, hiding under a nearby camping trailer and firing at officers with a pistol when he was located.

name: Troy Goode
summary: While returning home from a concert, Goode allegedly got out of a vehicle his wife was driving and started acting 'rowdy'. In attempting to subdue Goode, officers left him 'hogtied facedown' for about an hour. At one point, Goode told officers he was having difficulty breathing. An independent autopsy found that Goode died because he was hogtied for an extended period of time, according to his family's lawyers. The official state autopsy blamed LSD toxicity for his death.
link1text: Guardian: Man 'hogtied' by Mississippi police dies as wife alleges threats over hospital visit

name: Troy Francis
summary: Francis allegedly threatened two individuals in a park before encountering police. Authorities said officers saw a knife before opening fire, and that one officer used a Taser on Francis before another fired at him. Francis died from his wounds about a month later, police said.

name: Stephen Brown
summary: An off-duty officer checking on his in-laws said he arrived to see the front door kicked open. The officer said when he entered he saw Brown carrying a firearm, and the officer shot and killed him.

name: Joshua LeBoeuf
summary: Deputies were attempting to arrest LeBoeuf for violating a protective order when he allegedly got free, ran to his truck and retrieved a firearm. Authorities say LeBoeuf fired shots at the officers before they returned fire.

name: Devon Guisherd
summary: Guisherd shot a police officer in the chest during an arrest attempt. The officer then returned fire, according to police. Guisherd was wanted over the murder of a 25-year-old woman in 2014. The officer was later taken to hospital.

name: Jerrod Tyre
summary: Tyre had reportedly fired shots into a wooded area near a residence police had initially visited on a domestic disturbance call. Tyre refused to drop the firearm as officers approached and then advanced on them, according to police.

name: William Jeffries
summary: Jeffries was reportedly intoxicated and urinating in public. When an officer arrived, he refused to take a breathalyzer test and leaned on a patrol car, according to police. The two entered into an altercation and Jeffries' head hit the car, breaking his neck. Jeffries died two weeks later in hospital.

name: Joseph Fuller
summary: Fuller allegedly refused to get out of his vehicle and reached for a firearm between his legs, according to police. He had been spotted earlier in the day and fled from a deputy. Fuller was wanted for parole violation and traffic violations, according to police.

name: Pierre Koellner
summary: Koellner reportedly fled from officers after a highway crash involving two vehicles. He pulled a firearm and fired at officers, according to police. He was then shot, and died days later in hospital.

name: Darren Wilson
summary: Wilson had reportedly threatened someone with a large stick and wielded it at deputies who arrived on the scene, according to police. Wilson, who was dressed only in boxer shorts and a baseball cap, lunged at a deputy with the stick before he was shot by the other officer, according to police.

name: Bryan Overstreet
summary: Overstreet was struck by a deputy's patrol car in the early hours of the morning. Police maintain Overstreet was lying in the road and the deputy swerved to avoid him, but Overstreet's family have questioned this narrative, saying he was on the phone to his cousin at the time he died. The coroner ruled the death accidental.

name: Samuel Primeno-Nunez
summary: Police were responding to reports that two people had been shot inside a mobile home and arrived to find one person injured and another dead. Deputies located a man matching the description of the suspect a short distance away who allegedly raised a firearm towards police.

name: Dontae Martin
summary: Martin struck a parked vehicle while driving. When deputies arrived on the scene, authorities said, he got out of his vehicle displaying a handgun.

name: Andre Williams
summary: Police were investigating a possible rape when they found Williams hiding under a bed with a knife. Authorities said that when he refused several commands to drop it, officers used a Taser on him. Police said he then got out from under the bed and lunged at the officers.

name: Robbie Edison
summary: Authorities said Edison, who was wanted in South Dakota, was fatally shot by a deputy during a confrontation after he was discovered with a stolen vehicle under a bridge on a rural road. Police said Edson got out of a tent holding what appeared to be a pistol and refused to drop it. The weapon was later discovered to be an air gun.

name: Derek Wolfsteller
