summary: Wolfsteller was allegedly causing a disturbance inside an Arby's restaurant when police arrived. Authorities said Wolfsteller and an officer scuffled, and that at some point the officer removed her weapon and shot the man, reportedly in the head.

name: Brian Stortzum
summary: Authorities said Stortzum was threatening a woman and three girls with a gun, and it's believed that one or more of the girls escaped the apartment where the incident ocurred to call 911. When police arrived he allegedly refused commands to drop the weapon, and was fatally shot.

name: Tamala Satre
summary: Satre allegedly pulled out a handgun when deputies asked her to show them her hands. Police had arrived after learning that a woman at the address had posted suicidal statements on Facebook.

name: Seth Raines
summary: Raines was fatally shot outside a bank when he allegedly raised his weapon as police ordered him to drop it. He had fired shots into the air and the ground, according to authorities, prompting people to flee nearby shops and buildings.

name: Christopher Olmstead
summary: Witnesses said Olmstead was shot dead by police when he got out of his truck and charged towards officers after smashing into vehicles and buildings. One observer said he was carrying a gun but police did not immediately confirm this.

name: Lee Gerston
summary: Deputies opened fire on Gerston when he emerged wielding weapons from a house where he had staged a standoff for more than two hours, according to authorities. He allegedly fled there after robbing a nearby salon and stabbing another man.

name: Roger Braswell
summary: Braswell emerged from his house firing at deputies who were responding to a report that he threatened to kill himself, according to authorities. The deputies were said to have spent hours trying to negotiate with Braswell.

name: Bryan Day
summary: After speaking to police who were investigating a beating of one of his neighbors, Day allegedly went into his apartment and returned with a pellet gun, which he used to shoot and injure one of the officers. Two officers returned fire and fatally wounded him, according to authorities.

name: Khari Westly
summary: Police said Westly was fatally shot after firing at officers who were responding to a report that a woman and one other person were being held hostage. Westly tried to escape on foot, according to authorities, but was captured and died from his injuries.

name: Zachary Hammond
summary: Hammond was shot while driving away from the scene of a drug deal sting operation. Authorities said Hammond drove his car at a patrol vehicle and an officer, but dashcam video showed he was shot twice from the side through his driver's window as he passed an officer who was ordering him to stop. A local solicitor said the 'deadly force was justified' and declined to bring criminal charges against Lieutenant Mark Tiller.
link1text: Guardian: South Carolina police refuse to release name of officer who killed 19-year-old
link3text: Guardian: Officer who killed teen avoids criminal charges
link4text: Guardian: Zachary Hammond lawyer says police may need federal oversight after teen's death

name: Jean Paul Falgout
streetaddress: W Woodlawn Ranch Rd and Grand Caillou Rd
lawenforcementagency: Terrebonne Parish Sheriff's Office, Houma Police Department, Louisiana State Police
summary: Falgout, who was wanted for theft, was shot by eight officers after getting out of his vehicle and pointing a BB gun at them at the end of a car chase. Authorities described his actions as suicide by cop. The incident was captured by a surveillance camera.

name: Earl Jackson
summary: Police said officers were checking on a car parked on the side of the interstate when Jackson shot at police and fled into the woods. A brief manhunt ensued and authorities say shots were exchanged before Jackson was killed.

name: Timothy Milliken
summary: Deputies were responding to a report that Milliken was attacking a family member. Authorities said the deputies feared for the family member's life and fired at the man.

name: Allan White
summary: White was allegedly hiding behind a vehicle when deputy Tiffany Oakley returned to her home on her night shift lunch break, and ran out towards her and attacked. The sheriff said Oakley attempted to subdue White with a Taser before shooting him.

name: Samuel Forgy
summary: Forgy, who was suspected of being high on LSD, was allegedly attacked several residents of an apartment building with a knife. Authorities said when officers encountered Forgy, who was naked and wielding a hammer, one officer deployed a Taser which failed to subdue him, prompting another to fire.

name: Timothy Johnson
summary: Johnson was allegedly brandishing a knife when officers arrived in response to a disturbance call. Authorities said Johnson advanced at the officer and refused commands to drop the weapon

name: Michael Malone
summary: Police said they were attempting to arrest Malone at a motel on charges including aggravated assault with a deadly weapon. He tried to escape through a back window, according to authorities, and during a confrontation with officers outside he was shot and killed.

name: Oscar Romero
summary: The man was allegedly drunk and damaging property when deputies arrived. Authorities say he grabbed a metal pipe and struck a deputy with it. In response, one deputy used a Taser on the man while another shot him.

name: Roger Barker
lawenforcementagency: Logan Police Department, Cache County Sheriff's Office
summary: Barker allegedly shot at police from his porch, prompting them to return fire. Officers were responding to reports that he was suicidal. Authorities said a Swat team and negotiators were deployed but Barker, armed with a handgun, continued threatening officers.

name: Filimoni Raiyawa
summary: Raiyawa allegedly fought with and injured two officers before becoming unresponsive. He had been pursued after fleeing a fight over a traffic collision.

name: Wilmer Delgado-Soba
summary: Delgado-Soba was shocked with a Taser after allegedly charging at police in a grocery store. Officers had been called when Delgado-Soba entered the store shirtless and began knocking items of shelves, according to police, who stressed that he was given several verbal warnings.

name: Ryan Vrenon
summary: Vrenon was fatally shot after allegedly pulling a gun on officers who had pursued him for 16 miles on the highway. The 25-year-old, who came to a stop after driving over spike strips, had sped off after being approached by police as he sat stationary in his car on the highway shoulder.

name: Mark Perkins
summary: Police said Perkins threatened to shoot his wife, a neighbor and a police officer and was armed with several weapons. According to authorities, Perkins came out of his come and confronted the Swat and crisis negotiation units which had assembled, pointing 'several' weapons at them.

name: Philip Vallejo
summary: Vallejo was involved in an altercation with several other men and had a handgun, police said. Vallejo allegedly refused commands to drop the weapon, and the officer fired. Vallejo's wife, who was with him, said that he had no gun and that officers shot him in the back.

name: Rafael Molina
streetaddress: Garfield Ave SE and Edith Blvd SE
summary: Molina reportedly shoved a woman into an SUV and drove away, prompting a car chase with police. When Molina was eventually stopped he got out of the car with a gun and failed to obey officers' commands, according to police. Police have not said if Molina fired the weapon before he was shot.

name: Jeremy Hatch
lawenforcementagency: Roswell Police Department and Chaves County Sheriff's Office
summary: Hatch, along with two other men, was suspected of involvement in a narcotics deal. Hatch shot and injured an officer during an arrest operation and was then killed after multiple officers returned fire. The officer was released from hospital the same evening and the two other suspects were arrested.

name: David Cook
summary: Cook was reportedly involved in a domestic dispute but fled the scene before an officer arrived. He was found at a nearby boat ramp where he shot at an officer, before the officer returned fire, according to police.

name: Virgil Reynolds
summary: Reynolds was reportedly driving erratically and led officers on a car chase throughout south-west Houston. After his vehicle was boxed in by a number of police patrol cars, Reynolds allegedly rammed his way out and was shot. He died later in hospital.

name: Armando Serrano Jr
streetaddress: N Stone Ave and W Prince Rd
summary: The man was spotted with another woman at the site of recent homicide. When police arrived the man fled and was shot after gunfire was exchanged.

name: James Bush
summary: Bush, who was riding a motorcycle, collided with a police car that was making a U-turn. Bush was taken to hospital but later died. St Clair Shores police chief Todd Woodcox called the incident a 'tragic accident'.

name: Joseph Hutcheson
summary: Witnesses said Hutcheson ran into the Dallas County jail pleading for help. Police restrained Hutcheson and at one point a deputy's knee was allegedly placed on his neck. Police handcuffed Hutcheson and authorities said he became unresponsive shortly after.
link3text: Guardian: Texas jail death caused in part by officers restraining man, authorities say

name: Antonio Clements
summary: Clements allegedly fired a rifle at officers who had arrived to investigate a sexual assault, wounding one. Other officers then returned fire.

name: Joshua Malave
summary: Malave allegedly stole guns from a gun shop, and shot at officers who responded to the burglar alarm. Authorities said officers pursued Malave into a nearby field where gunfire was exchanged and he was killed.

name: Shawn Ruble
summary: Ruble barricaded himself in a garage with a pellet gun when police attempted to serve him with a warrant. Police said Ruble covered himself in gasoline and set the garage on fire during the standoff, which ended when Ruble jumped from a second-story window and aimed his gun, which he told police was real, at officers.

name: Franklin Short
summary: Police were responding to a domestic disturbance when they encountered Short, who was allegedly armed with a rifle, and fired at him.

name: Daniel Avila
lawenforcementagency: Orange County Sheriff's Department and US Border Patrol
summary: Police said Avila was acting 'strangely' and threatened to kill himself and the responding deputies, who spoke with Avila for over an hour. Later, Avila allegedly pointed his fingers at officers while his hand was partially covered with a cloth. When less-lethal projectiles failed to subdue him, officers fired.

name: Vincente Montano
summary: Montano entered a movie theatre and attacked several patrons with pepper spray and a hatchet. Responding officers said that the man raised what appeared to be a firearm at them, prompting them to fire. That weapon turned out to be an 'airsoft-style'pellet weapon.
link1text: Guardian- Shooting at Tennessee movie theater leaves suspect dead

name: Keshawn Hargrove
summary: Hargrove allegedly fled when police approached him, after reports of an armed man in the area. At some point during the ensuing chase gunshots were exchanged, and one officer was struck in the arm before Hargrove was killed.

name: John Dieringer
summary: Police said Dieringer was suicidal, and that officers attempted to negotiate with him for two hours before making the decision to approach him. Dieringer then allegedly tried to stab an officer with a knife.

name: Jason Galaviz
streetaddress: S Tacoma Way and S 56th St
summary: Galavitz, who was accused of stealing a woman's cellphone, allegedly pointed a gun at civilians attempting to stop him. Authorities said he got into a truck and did not follow the instructions of an off-duty officer who ordered him to get out, and the officer fired.

name: Raymond Hodge
summary: Hodge allegedly pulled out a handgun and began firing at police who were investigating a report of a suspicious person in a park. Police said Hodge was impersonating a police officer.

name: Tyler Dattilo
streetaddress: W Jefferson St and S 1st St
summary: Dattilo allegedly made a remark to two officers as he walked past them outside a gas station, before advancing at the officers with a knife. Surveillance footage appeared to support the police account.

name: Darius Graves
summary: Graves barricaded himself in a motel room after being police tried to apprehend him for a robbery. After a six-hour standoff, police shot teargas into Graves's room to force him out. Graves allegedly ran out with a weapon, which was later determined to be a steel pole.

name: Troy Robinson
summary: Robinson ran from an officer after a traffic stop. The office deployed his Taser and Robinson fell from an eight-foot wall, sustaining fatal injuries.

name: Gustavo Ponce-Galon
summary: Ponce-Galon had allegedly stabbed a woman during a domestic dispute. When officers arrived they opened fire. Neighbors told local news they heard police shout commands to drop a weapon before the shots were fired. The woman later died of her wounds.

name: Charles Bertram
summary: An officer saw a vehicle with a broken headlight pull into a parking lot and followed it. Police said the officer shot Bertram after he noticed he had a gun, although the exact timeline is unclear.

name: Aaron Marchese
summary: Police said Marchese was uncooperative with police and pulled an object that 'had the appearance of being a real weapon'. Officers were investigating reports of a man with a shotgun.

name: Abel Correa
summary: Correa was apparently found hiding in a closet of a home police were investigating for a broken window. Police said Correa lunged at officers with a sharp object.

name: Christian Taylor
summary: Police said they were responding to a potential burglary at a car dealership where an SUV had been driven into a showroom window. Taylor allegedly got into an altercation with a responding officer inside the showroom, and the officer shot him. The officer was later fired by the police department.
link2text: Guardian - Officer who killed college athlete never shot before
link4text: Guardian- Police chief fires officer who fatally shot unarmed Texas college football player

name: Derrick Hunt
summary: Hunt allegedly stabbed six people, injuring some critically, before police arrived and shot him. It is unclear whether the man threatened officers.
link1text: Guardian- Long Beach police shoot dead man they say stabbed six people

name: Shamir Palmer
summary: Palmer allegedly shot at deputies from a moving vehicle after failing to pull over and officers fired back, killing him. Before Palmer fired, police said that two passengers jumped out of the vehicle and were later arrested. The local coroner ruled Palmer's cause of death as suicide 'due to an intentional lethal confrontation with law enforcement'.

name: Matthew Russo
summary: Russo allegedly became 'combative' during a medical disturbance at his home. Officers used a Taser on him and EMT personnel gave Russo a sedative. Shortly thereafter, he began to have trouble breathing.

name: Mark Keckhafer
summary: Keckhaser, who police described as highly intoxicated, allegedly attemted to flee in a vehicle when approached by a deputy. Police said that as he drove away, Keckhaser swerved to try and hit a second deputy, who then opened fire.

name: Roderick Burr
summary: Burr was killed after he allegedly pointed a firearm and officers and opened fire. Police had been responding to a report that Burr had been fighting with another man outside of his apartment.

name: Jeffery Wilkes
summary: Wilkes allegedly killed a man and injured a woman when police arrived and encountered him with a shotgun and a pistol. Police said Wilkes fired on officers, wounding two, before they returned fire. Wilkes was reportedly a veteran of the US marines.

name: Kevin McDaniel
streetaddress: N Standard St and E Sanson Ave
summary: Police, who were attempting to take McDaniel into custody for a parole violation, followed him and surrounded a home he had entered. Authorities said McDaniel shot at officers repeatedly during a 'gunfight'.

name: Tsombe Clark
summary: The officer, who was off duty, intervened when a fight broke out at a restaurant. Police said Clark pulled out a weapon and fired at the officer and the officer returned fire.

name: Eric Tompkins
summary: Tompkins allegedly refused to keep his hands out of his pockets while talking to officers who had been dispatched to respond to reports of a suicidal man. Police said Tomkins then pulled out what appeared to be a handgun, prompting officers to fire. Police said they subsequently discovered that Tompkins had ingested a large quantity of rat poison.

name: Andre Green
summary: Green was driving a vehicle that had been reported stolen in a carjacking earlier in the day. Police said Green rammed a police car and then tried to hit officers with the vehicle and was shot. According to police, Green then got out of the vehicle holding a handgun and collapsed.

name: Edrian Rivera
streetaddress: San Antonio Ave and Packing Pl
summary: Multiple San Jose police officers fatally shot the man after he allegedly stabbed someone. Officers fired their guns while attempting to detain the man after locating him about a mile away from the scene of the stabbing.

name: Robert Quinn
summary: Quinn was allegedly waving a gun outside an apartment complex when police arrived. Witnesses said officers asked the man several times to drop the weapon before opening fire. Police later discovered that Quinn had been waving a pellet gun.

name: Richard Young
streetaddress: E Guadalupe Rd and N Val Vista Dr
summary: A motorcycle officer stopped Young for speeding in a school zone, police said. While the officer completed his citation, Young reportedly reversed his car and struck the officer and the motorcycle, and then accelerated his car toward the officer when the officer shot him, police said.

name: Taylor Culbertson
summary: Culbertson was critcally injured in June by a deputy after he allegedly fired a shot toward the officer in a gas station parking lot. Culbertson died from his injuries on August 9.

name: Casey Alarcon
lawenforcementagency: Bonner County Sheriff's Office and Sandpoint Police Department
summary: Officials said police were tring to serve an arrest warrant when there was a struggle between the officers and Alarcon. Alarcon allegedly fired twice at the officers before being shot dead. Two officers recived minor injures, according to police

name: Randall Hughes
summary: After Hughes allegedly tried to steal $80 worth of brisket from a grocery store, police said he threatened officers with a knife when they attempted to handcuff him. Police said they shot Hughes after first attempting to subdue him with a Taser.

name: Nathaniel Wilks
streetaddress: 27th St and Martin Luther King Jr Way
summary: Police killed Wilks, an armed robbery suspect, following a car chase that ended in a crash. Wilks allegedly attempted to carjack another vehicle before approaching officers with a gun. His death sparked protests in downtown Oakland.

name: Redel Jones
streetaddress: Marlton Avenue and Santo Tomas Drive
summary: Jones allegedly robbed a pharmacy at knifepoint and was killed nearby when officers attempted to detain her. Police said a Taser was delployed during the incident. A witness has disputed the official account and said Jones was running from the police when she was shot.

name: Anthony Vallejo
streetaddress: W Acacia Ave and Cawston Ave N
summary: Deputies spotted Vallejo, a parolee at large, and pursued him in a brief car chase after he refused to comply with requests to stop, according to authorities. Police said Vallejo was shot when he left his car and pointed a gun at deputies.

name: Roger Shull Jr
summary: Law enforcement officers were tracking Shull, who police say was wanted in the area, and gunfire broke out when they found him at a gas station, according to authorities. Two troopers were wounded in the gunfight and are in fair condition.

name: William Smith
lawenforcementagency: Lea County Sheriff's Department and Hobbs Police Department
summary: Smith was a passenger in a car that fled from law enforcement officials, authorities said. Multiple officers fired at Smith when the car chase ended on a dead-end street. Police said a gun was found near Smith and that the driver of the car was taken into custody.

name: Reginald Marshall
summary: Marshall was shot after allegedly fatally shooting a police dog as officers searched a vacant house to which he and another man had fled. The pair had been pursued to the building on suspicion of driving a stolen car. It later emerged Marshall was a fugitive wanted for murder. His passenger was arrested.

name: Garland Tyree
summary: Tyree, alleged to be a leader in the Bloods gang, was shot after emerging from the basement at his home firing at officers with an AK47 at the end of a six-hour standoff. The situation unfolded after US marshals arrived to serve Tyree a warrant for a parole violation. A firefighter responding after Tyree set off a smoke bomb was shot twice by the suspect in the lower body.

name: Hector Gonzalez
summary: Gonzalez was shot at an apartment complex after refusing several commands to drop a gun that he was brandishing at an officer, according to authorities. The officer was responding to reports of a domestic disturbance and a man with a gun.

name: Asshams Manley
streetaddress: Marlboro Pike and Walker Mill Rd
summary: Manley was shot dead by an officer after fleeing the scene of a car crash to which police were responding. The officer alleged Manley fought him and struggled for his gun, and continued to fight after being shot. Another officer shocked Manley with a Taser.

name: John Unsworth
summary: Authorities said Unsworth was shot after refusing to stop advancing towards officers at a home despite being shocked with a stun gun. Police were responding to an early-morning report that Unsworth was acting 'out of control' and had attacked relatives.

name: Allen Baker III
summary: Baker was shot while fleeing a Motel 6 with another man after officers arrived to investigate 'suspicious activity', according to authorities. Police initially said Baker fired at officers but now say he refused to drop his weapon. The other man escaped and was reported to be armed and dangerous.

name: Benjamin Ashley
summary: Authorities said Ashley, a homeless man wanted for murder, was shot dead after he pointed a gun at two deputies behind a mini-mart. Ashley had been the subject of an intense manhunt and the deputies were responding to a tip-off about his location.

name: Jonathon Pope
summary: Pope was fatally shot by deputy Carl Howell at a home during an exchange of gunfire that also killed the deputy. Howell, a nine-year veteran of the department, had been called to respond to an early-morning domestic disturbance. A woman was found with injuries and three children were evacuated.

name: Oscar Ruiz
lawenforcementagency: Los Angeles County Sheriffs Department, Baldwin Park Police Department
summary: Ruiz became unresponsive after being shocked with a Taser and handcuffed, according to authorities. He had been pursued and intercepted by officers after allegedly stealing a large flagpole and swinging it at motorists and passersby.

name: Matthew Castillo
summary: Police were investigating a recent homicide when two officers fired at Castillo, a suspect, after he reached for a handgun, according to police.

name: Steven Norton
summary: Norton allegedly assaulted his wife before she fled the residence with her two children. Officers returned fire when Norton fired a shot as he exited his home, police said.

name: Christopher Anderson
lawenforcementagency: Connecticut State Police and Manchester Police Department
summary: Anderson is accused of robbing a bank and leading multiple police departments on a car chase which ended when he crashed his vehicle, police said. Anderson exited and continued to approach police with a box cutter after multiple requests to halt and an officer deployed his Taser, according to police. Anderson was previously shot by police nine years ago after a standoff with officers, authorities said.

name: Frederick Roy
summary: The officer was responding to a report of a shooting when he approached Roy, who pulled a revolver out of his waisband, police said. The two struggled over the gun prompting the officer to fire his own weapon, police said.

name: Richard Jacquez
summary: Police said Jacquez was a suspect in a recent homicide and officers began tailing his vehicle after locating him. Jacquez led police on a short car chase before crashing and running from his car. Police initially said that officers fired when Jacquez reached for his waistband, but now say they shot him in the back.

name: Samuel Harrell
lawenforcementagency: New York Department of Corrections and Community Supervision
summary: Harrell got into a confrontation with corrections officers at the Fishkill Correctional Facility, during which up to 20 officers repeatedly punched and kicked him while he was handcuffed on the ground, according to a New York Times report. The Orange County medical examiner ruled Harrell's cause of death as homicide 'following physical altercation with corrections officers'.

name: Mansur Ball-Bey
summary: According to early reports from police, officers were searching a residence when two suspects exited and one, Ball-Bey, pointed a weapon at officers. An autopsy later showed that Ball-Bey died from a gunshot wound in his back, police said. An attorney for Ball-Bey's family maintains that the teen was unarmed at the time of the shooting. Officials said the other man fled and remains at large, and that they recovered guns and cocaine from the scene. Ball-Bey's death sparked protests in St Louis.

name: Jason Hale
summary: A deputy who was in the area looking for an armed and possibly suicidal suspect shot and killed Hale when he produced a gun, authorities said. Witnesses contested the police account, saying that Hale was shot by police as he was walking away.

name: Deviere Ransom
streetaddress: Woodward Ave and E Square Lake Rd
lawenforcementagency: Bloomfield Hills Public Safety Department and Warren Police Department
summary: Ransom, who police say was wanted for parole absconding and assault, led officers on a car chase that ended in a crash, according to authorities. Ransom attempted to flee the site of the accident on foot and pointed a gun at officers, police said.

name: Jonathan Velarde
lawenforcementagency: California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation
summary: A guard at the California Correctional Center fatally shot Velarde during a violent fight at the prison, authorities said. Officials said prisoners were stabbing Velarde, who was shot while 'attacking another [prisoner] with a weapon'.

name: Wade Baker
lawenforcementagency: Maggie Valley Police Department, Haywood County Sheriff's Office, and Waynesville Police Department
summary: Authorities responded to a church after receiving a call reporting that four people had been shot. Police said Baker, an Army veteran suffering from PTSD, died after exchanging gunfire with law enforcement at the church. Authorities said no one else was shot as the caller had reported.

name: Jeffory Tevis
summary: Police said an officer responded to a reported assault and 'an altercation ensued' when the officer encountered Tevis. The officer used his Taser, which police said wasn't effective in stopping Tevis's assault, and shot Tevis when he approached the officer with a 'large metal spoon'.
link3text: Guardian: Alabama man with spoon killed by officer had a 'mental episode', police say

name: Raul Herrera III
streetaddress: S Archibald Ave and E Brookside St
summary: Herrera allegedly robbed a restaurant before skateboarding down a street while waving a gun at pedestrians and cars, police said. Officers approached Herrera and shot him when he refused to lower his weapon, according to authorities. Police said they found a suicide note at Herrera's home.

name: Timmy Walling
summary: A deputy responded to the scene after receiving a call of a man with a shotgun, police said. Walling threatened the deputy at some point during their interaction and the deputy fired, according to police. No further details have been made available.

name: Alan Rushton
summary: Rushto barricaded himself inside a room following a domestic disturbance, according to police. After two hours of negotiation, during which Rushto had refused to surrender, he charged at an officer with a large kitchen knife and was shot, police said.
link2text: Guardian: North Carolina man killed after police say he charged with a knife

name: Charles Hall
summary: Hall was wanted by the Cecil County sheriff's office on a theft warrant. He was spotted by a Maryland state trooper in a shopping center parking lot. There was a struggle between the two, and Hall managed to reach his car. He was shot in the torso as he tried to drive away.

name: Adam Schneider
summary: Schneider was reportedly involved in a domestic dispute. When deputies arrived he allegedly threatened them with a gun. Deputies then opened fire.

name: Marc Kaplan
lawenforcementagency: Scottsdale Police Department, Phoenix Police Department
summary: Kaplan was reported making threats to the occupants of a home and then fled when police arrived. He was later apprehended following a struggle with officers in which a Taser was deployed. Kaplan, who police described as intoxicated, died later in hospital.

name: Thaddeus Faison
summary: Faison was suspected of carjacking and opened fire on officers who chased him. Two officers were wounded but then returned fire, according to the police account.

name: Jason Alderman
summary: Alderman was allegedly robbing a Subway restaurant when two officers spotted him from their patrol car. One officer exited the vehicle and approached Alderman, and police said as Alderman tried to leave, he pointed an item that looked like a rifle at the officer. The item was later discovered to be a car jack.

name: Nicholas Garner
summary: The man was pulled over for a traffic stop and then allegedly fought with an officer, according to the police account. The man then dragged the officer in his vehicle before the officer opened fire. The vehicle then crashed, leaving two people with minor injuries. The officer was also injured.

name: Christopher Tompkins
summary: Officers responded to a report of a stolen vehicle which led to a car chase that spanned multiple jurisidctions, according to police. A shootout after the car chase left Tompkins dead and an officer wounded, police said.

name: Julian Hoffman
summary: Officers responded to the scene and found Hoffman walking toward them with a gun, police said. Officers said they opened fire when Hoffman refused to drop it. Witnesses contest the police's account, saying that Hoffman appeared to raise his hands before police shot him, according to Hoffman's father.

name: Bobby Norris
summary: Officers responded to a call of a domestic dispute when Norris pointed his gun toward officers and they shot him, police said.

name: Richard Compo
summary: A woman called police to report domestic abuse, acording to authorities. Officers said they responded to the scene and attempted to make contact with Compo, who shot at the officers once before they returned fire, police said. Friends said he had threatened suicide the previous day.

name: William Snider
summary: Police brought a Swat team to the scene after observing Snider screaming and coming in and out of a residence with a rifle, police said. After hours of negotiations, officers shot Snider after he raised his rifle in their direction, police said.

name: Kenneth Morgan
summary: Police responded to a disturbance call and found that Morgan had barricaded himself in his room, according to authorities. Police said they shot Morgan after they opened the door and he approached them with his knife.

name: Marvin Maestas
lawenforcementagency: New Mexico State Police, Santa Fe Police Department, Santa Fe County Sheriff's Office
summary: Officers attempted to pull over Maestas for speeding, but ended up in a car chase that ended in an exchange of gunfire, according to police. New Mexico state police said multiple agencies were involved in the incident and have not released the agency of the officer who fired the fatal shot. An autopsy stated that Maestas was shot four times in the back.

name: Curtis Smith
summary: Smith entered the county's justice center carrying a knife and slashed a deputy sheriff in the lobby before another deputy shot him, police said. Authorities said the injured deputy was in stable condition. In March, Smith was arrested after climbing a White House wall, according to court documents.

name: Todd Tomlinson
summary: Deputies responded to a domestic call and found Tomlinson armed, police said. Officers shot Tomlinson after he allegedly ignored repeated requests to drop his weapon and raised it toward the officers. His brother, Scott Tomlinson, was found dead from gunshot wounds inside the residence, according to authorities.

name: Shane Randolph
streetaddress: W McDowell Rd and N 35th Ave
summary: Police said they approached a residence where they believed Randolph, who was wanted on a felony drug warrant, was staying. Officers spoke with Randolph through a window and fired when he revealed a weapon, according to police.

name: Steven Dodd
streetaddress: Indian Lake Blvd and Vietnam Veterans Blvd
summary: Dodd, who was reportedly suicidal, was standing on the overpass of a bridge and told officers he had a gun, police said. An officer shot Dodd in the leg when he allegedly pulled a gun out of his pocket, causing him to fall from the overpass onto the boulevard below, police said. Officials later said that Dodd was carrying a pellet gun.

name: Marvin Arroliga
summary: Detectives were investigating a separate shooting when Arroliga shot at them and the officers returned fire, police said.

name: Tyler Gerken
summary: Gerken was killed after a standoff with county deputies, police said. Gerken allegedly opened fire on deputies before they returned fire and killed him.

name: Brent Pickard
summary: Pickard was leading officers on a car chase after a report of disorder with a weapon when Pickard crashed his car, police said. Pickard exited his car and allegedly brandished his weapon before police shot him.

name: Yonas Alehegne
streetaddress: MacArthur Blvd and Van Buren Ave
summary: Alehegne allegedly attacked an officer with a metal bicycle chain and she returned fire, according to authorities. Police said the officer was treated for injuries to her face and head and released from the hospital.

name: Bertrand Davis
summary: Officers responded to a call of a robbery in progress and struggled with Davis, according to police, who said Tasers were used in an attempt to subdue him before he was shot. Authorities said Davis was found with a box cutter and appeared to be holding a gun, which turned out to be a pellet gun.

name: Manuel Soriano
streetaddress: Van Nuys Blvd and Valerio St
summary: Police came to the scene after a report of a dispute between neighbors, according to authorities. Police shot Soriano after he allegedly attacked officers with an 'unknown hard object'. Two officers are being treated for moderate injuries, police said.

name: Robert Hober
summary: Hober was allegedly threatening a CVS employee with a box cutter when officers responded to the pharmacy. Police said an officer shot Hober when he approached the officer with the box cutter and refused to drop it.

name: Thomas Ramey
summary: Ramey and his wife were crossing Route 211 when their car was struck by a state trooper's, police said. The state trooper was pursuing a different vehicle that was speeding, according to authorities.

name: Barbara Ramey
summary: Ramey and her husband were crossing Route 211 when their car was struck by a state trooper's, police said. The state trooper was pursuing a different vehicle that was speeding, according to authorities.

name: William Evans
summary: Evans was shot outside a church after being tracked down by a police officer, according to authorities. Police said they had been searching for him after a friend reported he was armed, had made suicidal threats on social media, and may have taken drugs. Authorities initially said it was unclear whether Evans pointed or fired his handgun.

name: Gilbert Flores
summary: Flores was shot dead in a confrontation with two deputies outside a house. They were responding to reports of a domestic disturbance and found an injured woman. Authorities suggested Flores had a knife but cellphone video of the encounter indicated his hands were empty and raised in the moments before he was shot. Police radio traffic reportedly identified Flores as suicidal.
link3text: Guardian: Video appears to show man with hands up before Texas officers shoot him dead

name: Felix Kumi
summary: Kumi, an innocent bystander, was fatally shot by an undercover police officer during a botched sting operation against a suspected illegal gun dealer. Police apologized to his family, saying he was blameless.
link1text: Guardian: New York police officer shoots dead bystander, 61, during gun sales sting

name: James Brown III
streetaddress: Losee Rd and E Sharp Cir
summary: Authorities said Brown was shot when he turned towards an officer with a gun in his hand during a chase. Brown had fled a car that was stopped by police in connection with a robbery.

name: Roger Albrecht
summary: Albrecht was shot by two officers after he allegedly charged at them with a knife. Police said the officers were responding to a reported burglary and Albrecht was identified as the suspect by a witness.

name: Rafael Cruz Jr
streetaddress: S Wood St and W 23rd St
summary: Police said Cruz was killed after two officers opened fire on a car that was reversing towards them. The officers had seen shots fired from the car into another vehicle, according to police, and got out to confront the occupants after they crashed while trying to flee.

name: Shawn Hall
summary: Police said Hall was fatally shot after ignoring several orders to drop his handgun, which he was pointing at bystanders. The officers were responding to a report of an 'unwanted person' at a home.

name: David Leon
summary: Leon, who was on a bicycle, was shot after pulling a gun while being pursued by officers, according to authorities. Police said Leon matched the description of a man seen attempting to burglarize a home in the early hours of the morning.

name: William Rippley
summary: Police responded to the area and followed Rippley into a nearby Pizza Ranch restaurant where Rippley, armed with a knife, grabbed a customer, police said. He was fatally shot by an officer and the customer was uninjured, according to officials.

name: Devin Dial
summary: An off-duty officer called for backup when he spotted Dial in the parking lot of a Walgreens wearing a mask, police said. Dial reportedly exited his car with a gun visible when a responding officer shot him.

name: James Carney III
summary: Carney collapsed at a gas station after being shocked with a Taser for a second time. He had allegedly attempted to rob someone of money she had withdrawn from an ATM and police intervened.

name: Cedric Williams
summary: Officers exchanged gunfire with Williams outside the First Community Bank after robberies were reported at that bank and another in Bluefield, police said. Williams allegedly brought a fake bomb to the other bank earlier that day.

name: Tyree Crawford
summary: Officers responded to an alleged carjacking and pursued six juvenile suspects, striking Crawford and hitting him with their car, authorities said. Police said they took five juveniles into custody after an hourlong standoff with two of the suspects.

name: Nicholas Dyksma
summary: Dyksma died after leading police on a high-speed car chase, according to authorities. Officers shocked him with a Taser after he refused to turn his car off, police said.

name: Michael Evans
lawenforcementagency: Carlsbad Police Department, Lake Arthur Police Department
summary: Evans opened fire on officers who had arrived to arrest him, police said. Evans was pronounced dead at the scene and an officer sustained non-life threatening injuries, according to authorities. Officials said Evans was a suspected drug dealer.

name: Charles Shaw
summary: Officers fatally shot Shaw after he allegedly killed his 55-year-old son. Law enforcement arrived on the scene to find Shaw's son lying wounded on the ground and shot Shaw after he pointed his gun toward officers, police said. A woman was also injured in the incident, according to authorities.

name: Michael Tyree
summary: Tyree died of internal bleeding due to trauma after an encounter with three correctional officers at the Santa Clara County jail, according to local reports. The officers beat Tyree to death and waited to call for medical assistance, investigators said. The three officers have also been accused of assaulting another inmate, according to authorities.

name: Arthur Bates
summary: Bates was allegedly shooting toward neighbors' houses before police arrived at the scene. Officers shot Bates after he ignored commands to drop his gun and began walking in their direction, police said.

name: Curtis Meyer
summary: Police said officers responded to a disturbance call and encountered Meyer, a military veteran, who was armed with a gun. An officer shot Meyer with Meyer's gun while the two were struggling over it, police said.

name: Richard Kelley
summary: Kelley allegedly fired a gun at an officer during a pursuit, and the officer returned fire, killing him. Authorities said the incident may be related to a shooting on tribal land earlier in the evening.

name: Ramon Damiani Jr
lawenforcementagency: West Baden Police Department, Indiana State Police
summary: Police were responding to reports of a man strangling his wife. When they arrived, Damiani allegedly grabbed a metal pipe and advanced at officers with it. Police said they attempted to subdue Damani with a Taser, but it had no effect.

name: Sully Lanier
summary: Lanier called 911 several times and allegedly threatened to kill any arriving officers. Police said when they arrived, Lanier ran at officers while firing an AR-15 rifle.

name: Lavante Biggs
summary: Biggs and officers were involved in a 30-minute standoff when officers opened fire. According to police, Biggs was suicidal and refused to drop his weapon, which police later learned was a pellet gun. He was shot when he allegedly pointed the gun at police.

name: Luis Wenceslao
summary: Wenceslao allegedly came out of a home holding a metal pipe and refused commands to put it down from police who were responding to a report of a domestic disturbance.

name: Manuel Ornelas
summary: Ornelas suffered a cardiac arrest after being shocked with a Taser and placed in a chokehold by officers attempting to subdue him. He was suspected to be under the influence of drugs, and police said they were dispatched because he was breaking windows and throwing things out of a home.

name: Carlos Yero
summary: Yero was the suspect in a domestic dispute which left a woman in critical condition. Yero allegedly shot at officers, led them on a brief chase and stepped out of his truck with a gun. Authorities said Yero pointed it at officers before he was shot dead.

name: Richard Cosentino
summary: Cosentino had been trapped in an elevator when police said he began to fight with the police and firefighters who arrived to rescue him. Shortly after, Cosentino asked for medical assistance and became unresponsive.

name: Angelo Perry
summary: Perry, who was sitting in the passenger seat of a vehicle, allegedly began shooting at officers when they approached the car. Police returned fire, killing Perry and the driver, India Kager. Perry was a person of interest in a homicide case. Police said an officer's clothes, but not the officer himself, were hit by bullets from Perry's gun.

name: India Kager
summary: Kager was killed by police gunfire when the passenger in the car she was driving allegedly shot at police. The passenger, Angelo Perry, also died in the shooting. Police said an officer's clothes, but not the officer himself, were hit by bullets from Perry's gun.

name: Mohamed Ibrahim
summary: Ibrahim led police on a high-speed chase after allegedly committing a string of minor crimes in Shreveport. Authorities said Ibrahim eventually crashed his vehicle and got out with a gun and pointed it at police.

name: Lucas Markus
summary: Markus went into cardiac arrest shortly after being shocked with a Taser by a police officer. He had allegedly seen running up and down the street trying to get into passing cars. Witnesses described him as being 'delirious'. State police arrived and said Markus did not respond to orders when they tried to take him into custody.

name: Ben CdeBaca
summary: CdeBaca was a passenger in a car that witnesses said rear-ended another car in a Walmart parking lot. He allegedly got out and ran into the store and began knocking over items and fighting with staff. Police struggled with CdeBaca, eventually handcuffing him and taking him outside, where he collapsed.

name: Harrison Lambert
summary: Police were responding to reports that Lambert had threatened his father with a knife. Police said when they arrived, Lambert was waiting at the end of the driveway with the weapon. Authorities have not said what happened next, besides that either one two officers fired at Lambert shortly after.

name: Wayne Wheeler
summary: Wheeler was killed by his neighbor, an off-duty police officer, while the two were fighting after Wheeler jumped the officer's fence and went into his yard, police said. The officer struck Wheeler on the head and he died at the scene, according to officials.

name: Casimero 'Shane' Casillas
streetaddress: Clovis Ave and E Lansing Way
summary: Casillas led officers on a car chase after failing to pull over for a routine traffic stop, police said. Casillas abandoned his car and approached an officer with a pipe when the officer fatally shot him, according to police. Authorities initially said Casillas was holding a 2ft-long PVC pipe but now say the pipe was metal.

name: William Verrett
summary: Verrett's wife called police and said she was beaten and that Verrett was armed, according to authorities. Police responded to Verrett's home and said Verrett had a shotgun and was killed by officers' gunfire, but have not released any additional details.

name: Curtis Jordan
summary: Officers responded to the scene after Jordan's wife called police to report that he was threatening to set their house on fire, according to authorities. Jordan allegedly threw hot coals in an officer's face before he began fighting with police, according to officials. Jordan was unresponsive after the struggle and died several days later.

name: Dustin Kuik
summary: Kuik was a suspect in an armed robbery in a nearby city, police said. Officers stopped his car in a hotel parking lot and exchanged gunfire with Kuik when he exited his car with a gun, police said.

name: Tyrone Holman
summary: Police killed Holman after a 12-hour standoff during which he threatened officers with a hand grenade, according to authorities. Officers responded to the residence after Holman refused to comply with an eviction order and learned after the shooting that the grenade was not live, police said.

name: Vincent Perdue
streetaddress: Old Richardson Hwy and Dennis Rd
lawenforcementagency: Alaska State Troopers and Fairbanks Police Department
summary: Officers attempted to stop a vehicle for failing to use a turn signal and pursued the car when it didn't stop, police said. Perdue, the driver, and the passenger allegedly fired shots at police during the car chase. Officers killed Perdue and injured the passenger in an exchange of gunfire after the chase had ended, according to authorities.

name: Brandon Foy
summary: Police said Foy was under surveillance in connection with a drug investigation when he allegedly drew a gun and fled the scene. An officer chased Foy and in an exchange of gunfire Foy was killed and the officer was shot in the hand, police said.

name: Austin Reid
streetaddress: S Lee Ave and Chestnut St
summary: Officers were searching for Reid with an outstanding warrant for attempted murder with a firearm, according to authorities. Police exchanged gunfire with Reid after they identified him in a McDonald's parking lot, police said. An officer was injured and is being treated for minor injuries, according to authorities.

name: Santino Burce
summary: An officer was conducting a 'pedestrian check' on Burce when he allegedly produced a knife and threatened the officer, prompting the officer to shoot him.

name: Eddie Tapia
summary: Tapia, a suspected carjacker, led deputies on a high-speed chase before crashing his car and taking several people hostage in a restaurant, police said. Deputies fatally shot Tapia after an hour-long standoff, according to authorities.

name: Robert Edwards
summary: FBI agents were executing a search warrant at a home in connection with child abuse images, according to authorities. While executing the warrant, officers opened fire and Edwards was killed, police said. Additional details, including whether the man was a suspect, have not been released.

name: Jennifer Lobato
summary: Lobato was detained in the Jefferson County jail on shoplifting charges when she told deputies she was feeling ill, the sheriff's office said. She vomited multiple times in her cell but didn't receive medical help despite 'repeated requests' until after she became unresponsive, according to the county coroner. She died of cardiac arrest following repeated vomiting, the coroner said. Six deputies were disciplined in connection with Lobato's death and the sheriff's office has changed its jail policy.

name: Tian Ma
summary: Officers arrived at the scene to find the man repeatedly stabbing a woman and himself, police said. Officers fatally shot the man after he ignored commands to stop, according to authorities. Police said the woman died from her wounds.

name: Heriberto Godinez Jr
summary: Godinez was a suspect in a burglary when officers apprehended him, police said. A medical examiner said Godinez died of cocaine and alcohol poisoning and that the physical stress of police restraint was a 'significant contributing factor' to his death. Police have not released additional details about the circumstances surrounding Godinez's arrest.

name: Derek Davis
summary: A deputy shot Davis during an altercation and the man died at the scene, according to local media reports. Additional details about the shooting have not been released, but authorities said Davis had left a department of corrections transitional facility without approval in July.

name: Martin Hammen
summary: Officers responded to Hammen's home the previous day after receiving a call that he was suicidal but couldn't find him, police said. Officers returned to Hammen's home early the next morning and found his house on fire and spotted Hammen outside with a gun and a propane torch, according to authorities. Police said they fatally shot Hammen when he refused to drop his gun.

name: Jack Stevens Jr
lawenforcementagency: Knox County Sheriff's Office Swat team
summary: A Swat team was sent to Stevens's house after he confronted a retired officer with a gun and then refused to turn himself in or leave his house, police said. The team responded to shots from Stevens with a 'chemical agent', but Stevens refused to leave, according to authorities. An officer shot Stevens after he pointed his gun at the Swat team when they entred his home, police said.

name: Clifford Butler Jr
summary: Officers from multiple local agencies responded after Butler allgedly attempted to break into a home. Police said Butler was acting erratically, and when they tried to restrain him he shot a local police chief, according to authorities. A deputy returned fire, killing him, state officials said. The police chief's condition is unknown.

name: Jordn Miller
summary: Miller was allegedly trying to steal a car when officers attempted to subdue him. Police used a Taser on Miller twice; once after Miller bit an officer and again after Miller was handcuffed and continued to struggle, police said. Miller stopped breathing and died two days later, according to authorities.

name: Jeffrey Brooks
summary: Officers from multiple agencies ended a two-day manhunt for Brooks, who was wanted for aggravated assault, auto theft, and carjacking, when they fatally shot him, police said. Brooks exited a house with a gun and then attempted to run officers over with his car before crashing and getting out of the car with his gun, according to authorities.

name: Joseph Johnson-Shanks
summary: Johnson-Shanks allegedly killed a state trooper after evading a traffic stop and leading the trooper on a car chase that ended when he shot the officer, police said. He fled the scene on foot launching an hours-long manhunt before police fatally shot Johnson-Shanks when he refused to drop his gun, according to authorities.

name: David Powell Jr
summary: Police killed Powell after responding to the same house three times in one night following reports that Powell was assaulting a resident and attempting to break in, according to authorities. Details about the encounter have not been released, but police said officers fatally shot Powell after a struggle.

name: Tyrone Bass
streetaddress: E St Bernard Hwy and Andres St
summary: Bass allegedly struck a deputy with a railroad spike before the two began wrestling on the ground, at which point a second deputy fatally shot Bass, police said. The wounded deputy was treated for minor injuries, according to authorites.

name: Phillip Pfleghardt
summary: Police responded to a report of an armed bank robbery in progress and exchanged gunfire with Pfleghardt, the suspect robber, according to authorities. Pfleghardt was leaving the scene in a car when he allegedly got out and began firing at officers, police said.

name: Florencio Chaidez
summary: Officers responded to a report of a man with a gun and said Chaidez matched the report's description, police said. Details about the shooting have not been released, but police said Chaidez 'presented a handgun'.

name: Jorge Suarez-Ruiz
summary: Police responded to a report that Suarez-Ruiz was threatening to hurt himself, according to authorities. Officers said they killed Suarez-Ruiz after a 'confrontation', but have not released additional information.

name: Tristan Vent
lawenforcementagency: Fairbanks Police Department, Alaska State Troopers
summary: Vent was allegedly driving a stolen car which he exited with a gun when officers pulled him over, police said. Officers shot him after a standoff and authorities said Vent died from his wounds about a week after the shooting.

name: Bobby Anderson
summary: A taskforce made of local agencies and US marshals was trying to arrest Anderson in connection with attempted second degree murder, police said. An officer shot and killed Anderson, who was armed, after he threatened officers during the arrest, according to authorities.

name: Mark Gary
summary: When deputies responded to the scene, Gary fired shots at their car and retreated into his house and periodically fired shots out of windows, according to authorities. State police shot Gary when he pointed a gun at them and walked toward them, officials said.

name: Anthony Camacho
streetaddress: N Cactus Ave and W Rosewood St
summary: Camacho was struck by an officer in a police cruiser while standing outside of a crosswalk, police said. He died several days later from his injuries.

name: Carlos Wilhelm
summary: Officers responded to a report of shots fired and fatally wounded Wilhelm when he 'engaged' with officers, police said. Wilhelm is suspected of killing a 55-year-old woman before he was shot by police, according to authorities.

name: Lawrence Price
lawenforcementagency: Kentucky State Police, Rockcastle County Sheriff's Department
summary: Law enforcement arrived at Price's house in response to a domestic violence call, according to authorities. Price exited his home waving a gun and exchanged shots with officers, police said.

name: William Chau
summary: Chau allegedly set his wife on fire and then stabbed his mother-in-law and brother-in-law when they tried to help her, according to authorities. Officers shot Chau while he was holding his wife at knifepoint, police said. Chau, his wife and his mother-in-law died from their injuries.

name: Gregory Herrell
summary: Deputies said they shot Herrell at his mother's house while they responded to a call from relatives reporting that he was distressed and had a gun. Family members said they disputed an allegation from authorities that Herrell reached for his shotgun.

name: Nicholas Johnson
summary: Johnson, a home burglary suspect, was shot by deputies from a helicopter during a high-speed chase. He collapsed after fleeing his SUV when he crashed into another vehicle.

name: Scott Beech
summary: Beech was fatally shot after pointing a gun at a deputy while sitting in his car, according to authorities. Beech was said to have been carrying seven firearms as part of an escalation in what police called a 'long-running domestic dispute'.

name: Lucien Rolland
lawenforcementagency: St Tammany Parish Sheriff's Office, Slidell Police Department, Louisiana State Police
summary: Police said Rolland was shot when he got out of his truck and opened fire on officers after a high-speed chase. The pursuit was prompted when Rolland refused to be pulled over for a traffic violation, according to authorities. He was shot 18 times, according to the local coroner.

name: Cecil Lacy Jr
lawenforcementagency: Tulalip Tribal Police Department, Snohomish County Sheriff's Office
summary: Lacy died after fighting with officers who had detained him and were trying to place him in a patrol car, according to authorities. The officers were responding to a report that he was walking in the road within a Native American reservation.

name: Jerrald Wright
lawenforcementagency: Shelbyville Police Department, Shelby County Sheriffs Department
summary: Police said the man was shot after walking out of a home and opening fire on officers following a nine-hour standoff. The officers were responding to reports of a dispute from a woman inside the house.

name: Michael Pierce
summary: Pierce allegedly refused to drop his gun after encountering officers who were responding to a report of a disturbance at a home.

name: Gerardo Ramirez
summary: Witnesses said Ramirez was firing a gun near an apartment complex, according to authorities. Officers said they shot Ramirez during a confrontation and that he was suicidal.

name: Kimberly Bedford
summary: Bedford was crossing the street when she was hit by officer Eugene Anderson's squad car, police said. The officer was responding to a domestic disturbance call, according to authorities. Anderson was charged with a moving violation causing death.

name: Dante Osborne
summary: Osborne was killed in a shootout with police after allegedly being involved in an attempted carjacking and a drive-by shooting earlier that morning. He shot at officers before attempting to flee, police said.

name: Francisco Benitez-Santiago
summary: Deputies killed Benitez-Santiago after he refused to drop his gun, police said. An investigation later revealed that Benitez-Santiago's gun was not loaded. Benitez-Santiago allegedly killed one man and seriously wounded another 30 minutes before he was shot by deputies.

name: William Spaits
summary: Officers were approached Spaits and a woman, Tina Money, in the parking lot of a Target to serve outstanding warrants when the two ran to their car and began shooting at the officers, police said. The officers returned fire, killing both Spaits and Money, according to authorities. The officers sustained non-life threatening wounds.

name: Tina Money
summary: Officers were approached Money and a man, William Spaits, in the parking lot of a Target to serve outstanding warrants when the two ran to their car and began shooting at the officers, police said. The officers returned fire, killing both Spaits and Money, according to authorities. The officers sustained non-life threatening wounds.

name: Steven McKenney
summary: A trooper was approaching McKenney to check on his wellbeing when McKenney became angry and the two started to struggle, police said. The trooper used his Taser to no effect before fatally shooting McKenney, according to local media.

name: Timothy Wagner
summary: Deputies stopped the car that Wagner was riding in for a faulty tail light and were speaking with the driver, a pregnant woman, when Wagner began shooting at the deputies, police said. The officers returned fire, killing Wagner. The woman was shot in the shoulder during the exchange and is being treated for her injuries, police said.

name: Dominic Fuller
summary: Fuller fled the area after officers responded to reports of suspicious activity, police said. When police caught up with Fuller, a deputy shot him after he raised his right hand holding what the deputy thought was a gun, according to authorities. Police later learned Fuller was holding a stapler.

name: Donavan Anderson
summary: Anderson was threatening people inside his house with a shotgun and later barricaded himself inside in a 'hostage situation', police said. When a Swat team arrived, Anderson left his home and exchanged gunfire with officers, according to authorities. Two officers were treated for minor gunshot wounds.

name: Tim Torngren
summary: Deputies came to Torngren's home after his daughter told police she was worried about his welfare, according to authorities. Deputies shot Torngren several minutes later, but police have not released details about the incident.

name: Joel Smith
summary: Smith, who had been served a restraining order, was turning in his guns to a deputy when he shot the deputy from behind, police said. Smith fled the scene and barricaded himself in a hotel room, which he exited firing after police arrived, according to authorities.

name: Robert Berger
summary: Berger allegedly broke into two homes and was stabbing a woman in the second when officers shot him. The woman was treated for multiple stab wounds, police said.

name: Jeremy McDole
streetaddress: S Scott St and Tulip St
summary: Police responded to the area following reports that McDole had shot himself, according to authorities. Officers said they fatally shot the armed man, who was in a wheelchair, some time after arriving at his home. A bystander video depicts the man adjusting himself in his chair before officers open fire.
link3text: Guardian: Delaware officials investigating fatal police shooting of man in wheelchair

name: Keith McLeod
summary: An employee at a pharmacy called police to report that McLeod had tried to use a fake prescription, police said. The responding officer spotted McLeod in a parking lot near the pharmacy and fatally shot him after he reached 'around to the small of his back and abruptly [whipped] his hand around and [pointed] it toward the officer, as if with a weapon', according to authorities.
link1text: Guardian: Maryland man fatally shot by police 'after imitating gun with fingers'

name: Joseph Khammash
summary: Khammash was allegedly holding his ex-wife and their child in a van against their will. Police were taking Khammash into custody when he pulled out a gun and shot at officers, prompting them to return fire, according to authorities.

name: Ernesto Lopez
summary: Officers responding to a domestic disturbance arrived to find that a woman and a child, Lopez's wife and son, had been stabbed. Police said there was an altercation between Lopez and officers which led to him being shot.

name: Kenneth Pinter Jr
summary: A deputy arrived at Pinter's home to investigate two previous hit-and-runs, police said. While the deputy was interviewing Pinter, he pulled out a gun and fired a shot toward the deputy, who returned fire, according to authorities.

name: Patrick O'Grady
summary: Police have released few details about the shooting, but said that officers responded to a disturbance call and that they shot O'Grady, who was armed, after entering the house.

name: Philip Quinn
summary: Officers responded to a report of a suicidal man and shot Quinn when he allegedly advanced at them with a screwdriver and refused commands to stop.

name: William Lemmon
summary: Surveillance footage appears to show Lemmon and another man robbing a store and then running outside. Police confronted Lemmon behind a building and he was shot.

name: James Anderson
summary: Police said they were responding to a disturbance when they encountered Anderson, who allegedly refused to drop a box cutter. Police said they attempted to deploy a Taser two times before resorting to deadly force. Anderson's mother disputes the police account and says officers never attempted to use a Taser.

name: Jeffrey Blood
summary: Deputies were responding to reports of a suspect firing shots at party. Authorities said when they arrived, Blood went to a car, grabbed a gun and began firing 'in a threatening manner'.

name: Norma Guzman
summary: Guzman was reportedly holding a knife. Police have provided no further details and have not confirmed how many officers opened fire or if Guzman wielded the weapon at police.

name: Anthony McKinney
summary: Deputies responded to the home after a woman called 911 and found McKinney stabbing the woman, police said. McKinney died at the scene after being shot and the woman is in critical condition, according to authorities.

name: Alejandro Lerma
summary: Officers were investigating reports of shots fired at a home when Lerma reportedly told officers he had a gun. Police said Lerma 'presented a threat' and shot him after he refused to drop his gun, according to authorities.

name: Christopher Shell
summary: Shell exited his home with a shotgun after deputies responded to a domestic violence call, police said. Deputies shot Shell after he ignored their commands to drop his weapon, according to authorities.

name: Junior Prosper
summary: Prosper crashed the car he was driving, a cab, on the highway and was running from the scene when police arrived, according to authorities. An officer caught up with Prosper and the two began struggling near the side of the highway, police said. The officer said he deployed his Taser and then shot Prosper after he bit the officer's finger.

name: Alberto Hernandez
summary: Hernandez answered the door with what appeared to be a gun when police arrived at his home in response to a 911 call, according to authorities. Hernandez followed the officers out of the apartment building, continuing to point his gun and ignoring commands to drop it before he was shot, police said. Police later said that the gun was a replica and not an actual firearm.

name: Victor Coronado-Martinez
summary: Police responded to a shots fired call and found Coronado-Martinez armed with a gun, according to authorities. Coronado-Martinez shot at the officer and the officer returned fire, killing him, police said.

name: Ronny Bowling
streetaddress: S Emerson Ave and E Southport Rd
summary: An off-duty officer hit Bowling, who was walking on the road, with his patrol car, according to authorities. Bowling died from 'multiple blunt force trauma', according to a local coroner.

name: Brandon Johnson
summary: Johnson allegedly killed a former co-worker in Georgia and then drove 500 miles before police shot him in West Virginia, according to authorities. Police said Johnson exited his car with a gun pointed at officers when they opened fire.

name: Patrick Lundstrom
summary: Police arrived at Lundstrom's home in response to a report of domestic violence, according to authorities. Officers forced their way inside after Lundstrom refused to open the door and shot him when he approached with a 'blunt object', police said.

name: Freddy Centeno
streetaddress: S Orange Ave and E El Monte Way
summary: Officers said they shot Centeno after he ignored their orders to put his hands up and pulled out a 'pistol-looking object'. Police later said Centeno was carrying a water pistol. Centeno died from his injuries about three weeks after the shooting.

name: Robert Christen
summary: An officer shot Christen after he began repeatedly punching her in the head, police said. Christen had previously called 911 to say he 'intended to kill someone' at an address on Watkins Street and crashed his car near the address shortly after the officer arrived at the scene, according to authorities.

name: Unknown
summary: The man was reported by his girlfriend over domestic violence allegations. When officers arrived a struggle occurred and police deployed a taser, which was ineffective. The man allegedly pulled a knife before officers opened fire.

name: Phyllis Jepsen
summary: Jepsen was reported as suidical and carrying a knife. When deputies arrived a confrontation occurred and three officers fired both lethal and non-lethal rounds, according to police.

name: James Byrd
summary: Officers shot Byrd after he threw a beer bottle at their patrol car, shattering the window, according to authorities. The officers thought they were being fired upon, police said.

name: Jeffery McCallum
summary: Police shot McCallum after he charged at them with a gun when they entered his home following reports of a shooting, according to authorities. Officers found a woman with stab and gunshot wounds inside the home and she was taken to the hospital in serious condition, police said.

name: David Diaz
summary: Diaz shot at officers who were pursuing him after responding to a domestic violence call, police said. An officer returned fire after Diaz pulled his car over and struck an officer's vehicle, according to authorities.

name: Kylie Lindsey
summary: Lindsey and another girl, Isabella Chinchilla, were passengers in a car that was struck by a trooper as it turned in front of the trooper's path, police said. The trooper, who has been fired, was driving about 30 mph over the posted speed limit seconds before hitting the car, according to authorities.

name: Isabella Chinchilla
summary: Chinchilla and another girl, Kylie Lindsey, were passengers in a car that was struck by a trooper as it turned in front of the trooper's path, police said. The trooper, who has been fired, was driving about 30 mph over the posted speed limit seconds before hitting the car, according to authorities.

name: Eric Edgell
lawenforcementagency: Muscle Shoals Police Department, Sheffield Police Department
summary: Police said Edgell was killed while exchanging gunfire with officers who were responding to a report that he was suicidal and armed with a gun.

name: Matthew Dobbins
summary: Officers responded to a burglary in progress and shot Dobbins while he was inside the home being burglarized, police said.

name: James Dunaway
streetaddress: W Redbud Dr and Arcadia St
summary: Dunaway was reportedly involved in a domestic disturbance. An officer shot Dunaway when he saw that he was armed, although it unknown if Dunaway aimed his weapon, according to authorities.

name: Rodney Jencsik
summary: Police shot Jencsik at the end of a three-hour standoff when he exited his home pointing a gun at officers, according to authorities. Jencsik is accused of fatally stabbing a woman and crtically injuring a man before the standoff.

name: Donald Miller II
summary: Miller was brandishing a weapon that appeared to be a gun in a public space when an officer shot him, according to authorities. Officials later said that Miller was carrying a 'non-functional antique revolver'.

name: Omar Ali
summary: Ali was under investigation for selling drugs and had reportedly choked a woman when officers approached the hookah bar that Ali owned, police said. A Swat team raided the bar and shot Ali when he reached into his waistband, according to authorities. Ali died several weeks after the shooting.

name: Amado Lago
summary: Deputies responded after Lago attacked two people with a machete, killing one, police said. An officer fatally shot Lago when Lago began charging toward another officer with the machete, according to authorities.

name: Gary Boitano
summary: Officers said they responded to a 911 caller who said a man with a knife was threatening to kill him. Police shot Boitano after he refused to drop his knife, according to authorities.

name: Richard Love
summary: Officers responded to a motel upon learning that Love, who police said was a suspect in several investigations, was staying there. After hearing gunshots from the room, a Swat team entered and killed Love after he refused to drop a gun, police said.

name: Travis Quay
summary: Police said Quay shot a sheriff's deputy with a crossbow when officers arrived at his home to arrest him for alleged assault. A state trooper returned fire and killed Quay. The deputy was said to be in stable condition.

name: Kevin Lau
summary: Lau was reportedly involved in a domestic disturbance and was armed with a gun when officers responded to his home, police said. Police shot him after he pointed a gun in their direction and ignored commands to lower it, according to authorities.

name: Bernard Powers
summary: Officers were executing a search warrant when Powers began shooting, police said. Deputies returned fire, killing Powers and injuring another person, according to authorities. A deputy was also injured in the exchange of gunfire.

name: Christopher Whitmarsh
summary: Whitmarsh, who was reportedly suicidal, struck another car and two police cruisers with his own car, according to authorities. Officers shot him when he ignored commands to stop his vehicle and prepared to strike the cruisers a third time, police said.

name: Joe Ortiz
summary: Ortiz was fatally shot while fleeing a park on a bicycle, according to police. Officers were responding to a 911 call from a seven-year-old girl who said two men were threatening to shoot her father. The other suspect was detained.

name: Anthony Aguilar
summary: Aguilar was fatally shot while trying to break into a woman's home, according to authorities. Police said he was armed but did not give details of the weapon. Officers said they used a Taser on Aguilar before shooting him.

name: William Combs
summary: Combs was acting irrationally and claimed he had a bomb, police said. Officers said they heard a large noise that they thought could have been an explosive. Combs got into a car and began driving toward deputies when police shot him, according to authorities.

name: Robert Medellin
summary: Police responded to a disturbance and pursued Medellin after he drove away in his car, according to authorities. Deputies shot Medellin when he exited his car and charged at deputies with a knife, police said.

name: Jason Day
streetaddress: SW Sheridan Rd and SW I Ave
summary: Officers responded to a report of a man waving a gun, police said. Police shot Day after a 'brief encounter' with him, according to authorities. No additional details have been released.

name: Rudolph Smith
summary: Smith was being evicted from his home when he fired his gun at officers, police said. Smith was shot and killed by a Swat team after a nearly six-hour standoff, according to authorities. Two officers sustained minor injuries during the exchange of gunfire.

name: Brent Brannon
summary: An officer stopped Brannon for a tag violation and learned of a warrant for his arrest after running his license, police said. The two got into a confrontation, during which the officer deployed his Taser before shooting Brannon when he pointed a gun at the officer, according to authorities.

name: Jorge Tapia
summary: Police said Tapia robbed a pharmacy of money at gunpoint, and was fatally shot minutes later after he pointed a gun at officers from his car during a brief pursuit.

name: Linda Lush
streetaddress: S Jones Blvd and W Spring Mountain Rd
summary: Officers from a Swat team shot and killed Lush after she refused to exit a stolen car and fired a gun at officers, police said.

name: Leslie Portis Jr
lawenforcementagency: Conecuh County Sheriff's Office, Alabama Department of Public Safety
summary: Portis barricaded himself in a house after assaulting someone in a nearby city, police said. He eventually exited the home firing at officers who returned fire and killed him, according to authorities.

name: Kaleb Alexander
summary: Police killed Alexander after he robbed a convenience store at gunpoint, according to authorities. The store was being watched because he had robbed it on the two previous nights. Alexander allegedly refused to drop his gun when police confronted him outside the store.

name: Samuel Villarreal
summary: Officers were investigating an auto theft and attempted to stop Villarreal when he drove the stolen car into a parking lot, according to authorities. Police opened fire after Villarreal allegedly backed his car into a police cruiser.

name: Michael Clark
summary: Witnesses in a shopping mall called police and said Clark was acting erratically. Clark shot at the officers who approached him and was killed when they returned fire, according to authorities.

name: Herbert Benitez
summary: Police were taking Benitez into custody after he threw glass bottles into the street, according to authorities. He began struggling with an officer and reportedly took his gun, prompting another officer shot him, police said.

name: Michael Brennan
lawenforcementagency: Parma Police Deparment, Parma Heighs Police Department, Brooklyn Police Department
summary: Brennan allegedly robbed a Papa John's at gunpoint before police gave chase. The chase ended when Brennan crashed into a truck and exited his car with his gun pointed at officers, police said.

name: Unknown
summary: Police were following three people believed to be involved in recent robberies, according to authorities. Officers confronted the group after they robbed a cash advance business at gunpoint, police said. They exchanged gunfire with two of the men, killing one and injuring the other, officials said.

name: Robert Burgess Jr
summary: Burgess was allegedly attempting to break into cars and tried to carjack a vehicle, police said. Officers pursued him and shot him after getting into a confrontation, according to authorities.

name: Johnny Rangel
summary: Rangel, who had reportedly broken into a house, was shot by a deputy when he reached for a second deputy's gun, according to authorities.

name: Unknown
summary: The man pointed a gun at Swat officers from a window in a home at the end of a standoff lasting more than four hours, according to authorities. He had barricaded himself inside and refused to come out after officers arrived to check his welfare. Police said officers had used teargas to try to force the man outside.

name: Margaret Wagner
summary: Wagner allegedly pointed a gun at a sheriff's deputy when officers arrived at a home for a reported domestic disturbance. Authorities said Wagner was also accused of threatening people at another home nearby earlier in the day.

name: Ricky Ball
