summary: Ball was reportedly shot several times by police after getting out of a car and fleeing an attempted traffic stop. One of the officers involved in the shooting, Canyon Boykin, resigned. City officials voted to fire Boykin after he resigned and to reprimand the other two officers involved in the incident. The Columbus police chief also resigned in the wake of the shooting, although he did not cite a specific reason for his resignation.

name: Gino Paredes
summary: Paredes was allegedly robbing a gas station and was noticed by an officer who was filling up his patrol car, according to police. During the confrontation that followed, the officer fired several times and Paredes was killed.

name: Dequan Williams
summary: Police said Williams was shot after officers arrived at a home in response to a report of a man with a knife behaving threateningly. Officers tried to subdue him with a Taser before shots were fired, according to authorities.

name: Paterson Brown Jr
summary: An off-duty police officer shot Brown dead after he got into the officer's car at a gas station and began driving it while the officer was waiting for it to be washed. A witness told reporters that the officer identified himself as a police officer and ordered Brown to get out of the car. The officer then opened fire when Brown made a sudden movement, according to the witness.

name: Corey Jones
summary: Jones was shot and killed by an on-duty, plainclothes officer in an unmarked car, according to authorities. Jones had stopped on the side of the road because of car troubles, according to his family. Police said the officer approached what he thought was an abandoned car and that Jones was carrying a gun. Palm Beach Gardens announced on 11 November that it had fired the officer who shot him, Nouman Raja, but did not explain why.
link3text: Guardian: Officer involved in Corey Jones shooting had previous suspension threat

name: Rayshaun Cole
summary: Cole was shot dead at home by his girlfriend, a border and customs officer. She told authorities she fired in self-defense because he was hitting her. She was arrested on suspicion of murder but later released without being formally charged.

name: Krikor Ekizian
summary: Ekizian allegedly stabbed his uncle and then attacked a police officer who was attempting to administer aid. Police said the officer believed Ekizian was still armed and shot four times.

name: Jonathan Pea
streetaddress: Santa Monica Blvd and San Vicente Blvd
summary: Two deputies were responding to an assault call, police said. The patrol car clipped the rear of another car, ran over the curb and hit two pedestrians walking on the sidwalk, killing Pea and injuring the other pedestrian, according to authorities. The deputies were hospitalized in serious condition, police said.

name: Michelle Esch
summary: Esch tried and failed to carjack two people before successfully carjacking a third person and driving away, police said. Deputies caught up to her and shot her following a confrontation, according to authorities.

name: Dion Ramirez
summary: Deputies suspected Ramirez of driving under the influence and were pursuing him, according to authorities. A deputy shot him after he allegedly drove his car into the side of a deputy's patrol car.

name: Roger Hall
summary: Hall allegedly tried to rob a customer at gunpoint in a Jimmy John's before fleeing the restaurant. He was pursued by police, who shot him when he pulled a gun from his waistband, according to authorities. Police later said that Hall was carrying a fake gun.

name: Lamontez Jones
summary: Jones was causing a disturbance downtown and took off running when police approached him, according to authorities. Police shot him when he aimed a gun at them and fired a second time when he continued to point his weapon at officers, officials said. Police later said that Jones's gun was a replica.

name: Darien Greenwood
summary: Police were pursuing Greenwood and another man suspected of burglary, officials said. Deputies shot Greenwood after he lunged at a deputy with a knife and stabbed a police dog, according to authorities.

name: Jonathan Gossman
summary: Officers stopped a car Gossman was riding in to investigate 'drug-related activity' when Gossman fled on foot, police said. When officers pursued Gossman, he fired at them, according to authorities. Police said they fired back, killing him.

name: Miguel Galena
summary: A US Customs and Border Protection officer shot and killed Galena near the US-Mexico border, authorities said. He allegedly approached the officer with a knife.

name: Joel Lopes
summary: Deputies responded to the east side of Elephant Butte Dam where they found Lopes armed with a gun, police said. Lopes ignored deputies' commands to drop the gun and was shot after he pointed his gun at them, according to authorities.

name: Ryan Rodriguez
summary: Deputies were serving a warrant for domestic violence charges when Rodriguez fled and the deputies pursued him, police said. Rodriguez struggled with the deputies and allegedly tried to take one of their guns before they shot him, according to authorities.

name: Timothy Arnold
summary: Officers arrived at Arnold's apartment after receiving a report that he was suicidal, police said. Arnold exited his apartment with a gun and was shot after pointing it at deputies, according to authorities.

name: Lawrence Green
summary: Police shot Green after he approached an officer with a knife and ignored commands to drop it, police said. Officers came to the area in response to reports about an armed person, according to authorities.

name: Adrienne Ludd
summary: Deputies attempted to stop Ludd while he was driving because his car's registration was expired, according to authorities. Ludd stopped to allow a passenger to exit the car and then sped away, police said. He eventually stopped and exited his car before pointing his gun at officers, officials said.

name: Stephen Brock
summary: Police said Brock had threatened to shoot anyone who came on to his property, and that after officers arrived Brock made an aggressive motion with one of his hands behind his back. It was not confirmed whether Brock was armed.

name: Rolly Thomas
summary: Thomas allegedly shot at officers who were responding to a report of a domestic disturbance, and officers returned fire. Two other people were found in the home and were taken to hospital for treatment, according to police.

name: Juan Ulloa
streetaddress: E La Cadena Dr and Iowa Ave
summary: Police said Ulloa got out of his vehicle during a traffic stop and fired at officers. Police fired back, wounding Ulloa, who then re-entered his vehicle and drove a short distance before coming to a stop. He was pronounced dead at the scene.

name: Darren Fude
summary: Fude allegedly pointed a shotgun at officers during an incident at his home and refused police commands to drop the weapon.

name: Jon Ployhar
summary: Ployhar allegedly fled a traffic stop before eventually stopping. The officer drew his weapon and fired while he and Ployhar were struggling over the officer's Taser, according to police.

name: Dominic Hutchinson
summary: Hutchinson was shot by officers responding to a domestic disturbance.

name: John Turner
summary: Turner allegedly shot two deputies who were responding to a domestic disturbance before the deputies returned fire, killing him. Neither deputy was seriously injured.

name: Arthur West Jr
summary: Police responded to reports from a woman that West was threatening her and her child. When deputies arrived, West was alone inside his house and pointing his gun at himself, authorities said. After a standoff, deputies shot West when he pointed his gun at them, police said.

name: Kobvey Igbuhay
streetaddress: N Dale Mabry Hwy and W Waters Ave
summary: Officers chased Igbuhay and three others who were driving in a stolen car and eventually caught up with them near a swamp, police said. Igbuhay was shot after he allegedly tried to drown a police dog and an officer in the water, police said. Igbuhay's girlfriend, who says she witnessed the shooting, contests the police account, claiming that the encounter between Igbuhay and police happened on dry land.

name: Kevin Brunson
summary: A state trooper identified a stolen car in a gas station parking lot, according to authorities. When the trooper and other law enforcement officers approached Brunson, who had been driving the car, he allegedly got back in the car and drove it into a police cruiser. Brunson was shot after he got out of his car and a 'confrontation occurred,' police said.

name: Marquesha McMillan
summary: Officers responded to a robbery in progress at a liquor store, police said. McMillan shot at reponding officers in the parking lot near the liquor store and was killed when officers returned fire, according to authorities.

name: Omar Lopez
lawenforcementagency: Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority Police Department
summary: Lopez was shocked with a Taser and physically restrained on the ground outside a rail station by an officer who had escorted him outside and was awaiting backup. Police said Lopez had started a fight with the officer after the officer intervened in a 'heated verbal argument' Lopez began to have with another person.

name: Tyrie Cuyler
summary: Cuyler allegedly shot at officers after they stopped him while he was driving. Officers returned fire, killing Cuyler, police said. Two officers were hit by Cuyler's shots and have been released from the hospital after receiving treatment for their injuries, according to authorities.

name: Anthony Ashford
summary: Ashford attacked an officer who approached him because he was looking through car windows in a parking lot, police said. While the two fought, the officer's Taser deployed and struck both the officer and Ashford, according to authorities. The officer shot Ashford after he reached for the officer's gun, police said.

name: Ricky Keeton
summary: Deputies arrived at Keeton's house as part of a drug investigation, authorities said. Keeton fired at deputies when they approached and was killed when they returned fire, police said.

name: Charles Pettit Jr
summary: Pettit allegedly burglarized a home and was running from police, officials said. The officer shot Pettit after he pointed a gun at the officer and ignored commands to drop the weapon, police said. Pettit died from his injuries about three weeks after the shooting, according to authorities.

name: Kevin Bajoie
summary: Bajoie was shocked with Tasers after he allegedly got up and started attacking officers who found him on the floor of a home while responding to a report of a fight. He died shortly after. The local coroner ruled Bajoie's death accidental and said he died from multiple drugs in his system, but a coroner's office official said it was 'possible the Taser contributed'.

name: Mario Perdigone
summary: Perdigone called police to ask for help, authorities said. Officers responded and found him in the middle of a street, police said. Officers used a Taser while trying to move Perdigone out of the road and he became unresponsive, according to authorities.

name: Kenneth Schick
summary: Deputies responded to a home following a report of a domestic disturbance, according to authorities. Police used Tasers and pepper spray while trying to subdue Shick, who died shortly after, officials said.

name: Andrew Dehart
summary: US Marshals Service members approached Dehart, who was wanted for attempted murder and other charges, when he fled in car, police said. Officers from the Marshals Service and the Oregon State Police pursued Dehart for 17 miles, during which Dehart shot at officers from his car, according to authorities. Officers who were alerted shot and killed Dehart as he approached, police said. Authorities have not identified the agency that shot him.

name: Jerry Graham Jr
summary: A Swat team was serving a warrant at Graham's house, police said. An officer shot Graham when he opened the door and turned toward police with a gun in his hand, according to authorities.

name: Mario Martinez
streetaddress: N Town E Blvd and I-635
lawenforcementagency: Mesquite Police Department, Texas Department of Public Safety
summary: Police attempted to stop Martinez after he ran a stop sign and pursued him when he kept driving, according to authorities. Martinez eventually stopped his car on a highway and waved a gun and threatened officers, police said. Officers shot Martinez at the end of a 90-minute standoff when Martinez reportedly pointed a gun at them.

name: Floyd Cook
lawenforcementagency: Kentucky State Police, United States Marshals Service
summary: Cook was shot after exchanging gunfire with officers, police said. Authorities said they had been searching for Cook for nearly a week after he shot and injured a police officer in Tennessee.

name: Deaunte Bell
summary: Police stopped a 'suspicious' car with three people in it, including Bell, according to authorities. Officers shot Bell when he reached for a gun, police said.

name: Unknown
summary: Plainclothes officers spotted multiple people robbing a pawn shop at gunpoint, police said. The officers approached the group at the store's back exit and shot at them when two individuals pulled their weapons, according to authorities. Police said one suspect was killed and two were injured.

name: Jasper Adams
summary: Police pursued Adams after he failed to make a traffic stop, according to authorities. Officers shot Adams when he pointed at gun at them while they were trying to arrest him, police said.

name: Daniel Nole
summary: Nole, a patient at a drug rehab center, stabbed four other patients and set a barn on fire, police said. Deputies shot Nole when he approached them with a knife, according to authorities. Three of the four wounded were transported to a hospital with serious injuries, police said.

name: Larry Busby
summary: Deputies responded to a home after a 911 caller said someone inside was receiving death threats, according to authorities. While deputies were at the home, Busby pulled up in a car and authorities said they heard gunshots from inside the vehicle, prompting the officers to fire, police said. Busby's car then caught on fire and deputies pulled him from his vehicle. Busby was pronounced dead at the scene from apparent gunshot wounds, police said.

name: Noah Harpham
summary: Harpham allegedly shot and killed three people before police responded to the scene. When officers arrived Harpham started shooting at them and police returned fire, according to authorities.

name: Bennie Lee Tignor
summary: An officer pursued Tignor after he refused to stop his car, according to authorities. The officer shot Tignor while trying to take him into custody, police said. No additional details have been released.

name: Luverne Christensen
lawenforcementagency: Hutchinson Police Department, McLeod County Sheriff's Office, Minnesota State Patrol
summary: Police said they responded to a home after receiving a report of a verbal disturbance. Officers encountered Christensen and shot him after a 'scuffle' broke out, according to authorities. A police officer was injured during the incident and treated for noncritical injuries. No additional details have been released.

name: Killian OQuinn
summary: OQuinn began firing at an officer during a traffic stop, police said. In the exchange of gunfire, OQuinn was killed and the officer was wounded, according to authorities.

name: Jack Yantis
summary: Deputies responded to the scene of an accident involving a car and a bull, state police said. Officers were preparing to shoot the bull after the animal charged emergency responders and passing cars when Yantis, the bull's owner, confronted the deputies, according to authorities. Yantis shot at the deputies and the deputies returned fire, police said.

name: James Covington Jr
lawenforcementagency: Prince George's County Police Department, Forest Heights Police Department
summary: Covington, an alleged carjacker, died after exchanging gunfire with police, according to authorities. Officers followed Covington after he assaulted a driver and stole his vehicle, police said.

name: Joseph Tyndall
summary: Officers discovered a car crash and began pursuing Tyndall, who was involved in the crash and had left the scene, police said. Officers shot Tyndall when he pointed a gun at them, according to authorities.

name: John Allen
summary: Police stopped Allen after he allegedly committed a traffic violation. When an officer approached Allen's window, he saw the man pull out a gun and the officer opened fire, police said.

name: Faisal Mohammad
summary: Mohammad allegedly stabbed and wounded four people at the University of California Merced's campus. Campus police shot and killed Mohammad, who was a student at the school, according to authorities. The four people who were stabbed, two of whom were students, suffered non-life-threatening injuries, police said.

name: Timothy Smith
summary: Officers shot Smith when he turned toward them and reached for his pocket, police said. Authorities said they believed Smith was armed and were pursuing him because was wanted on several felony warrants. No weapon was recovered.

name: Jacob Hohman
lawenforcementagency: Lakeshire Police Department, St Louis County Police Department
summary: Hohman allegedly attacked his sister and 12-year-old nephew with a claw hammer. Police responded to a 911 call and shot Hohman when he ignored commands to drop the hammer and charged toward officers, police said.

name: Laura Lemieux
summary: Lemieux was 'randomly discharging' her gun when police responded to a report of an active shooter, according to authorities. Police used 'less-lethal force' on Lemieux and then shot her after she pointed her gun at deputies, officials said.

name: David Romanoski
summary: Deputies were serving search and arrest warrants at a home when Romanoski confronted them with a shotgun, police said.

name: James Bigley
summary: Bigley, who was reportedly suicidal, fatally shot a woman who tried to intervene, according to authorities. Police pursued Bigley after he left the scene and shot him when he exited his car with a gun, officials said.

name: Jeremy Mardis
summary: Mardis was a passenger in a car driven by his father, Chris Few. Initial reports suggested that Few had backed his car into officers' vehicles while officers were trying to serve a warrant, but officials now say there is no evidence of a warrant for Few, who was unarmed and was also struck but is reportedly in stable condition. Two officers involved in the shooting, Norris Greenhouse Jr and Derrick Stafford, have been charged with second-degree murder.
link1text: Guardian: Father of six-year-old boy killed during police chase was not armed, chief says
link2text: Guardian: Louisiana police concede officers fired shots that killed six-year-old boy
link3text: Guardian: Two officers arrested over shooting death of six-year-old Louisiana boy

name: Michael Johnson
summary: Johnson was holding a gun to his head while standing in a parking lot near a hospital, according to authorities. During negotiations with police, Johnson reportedly fired his gun at the ground twice. Tactical officers fatally shot Johnson, although it is unclear what exactly prompted the shooting. The state medical examiner's office ruled that Johnson died by suicide, although he had no self-inflicted wounds.

name: James Smyth
streetaddress: S Maryland Pkwy and E Wigwam Ave
lawenforcementagency: Clark County School District Police Department
summary: Smyth was shot inside his car as he drove at a 'high rate of speed' towards officers, according to police. Smyth had previously crashed his vehicle into a police patrol car, authorities said.

name: Raymond Davis
summary: Davis was reportedly strangling a woman, Hazel Hinds, during a heated domestic argument. Officer Harelson, Davis's nephew and Hinds' son was off duty and opened fire with his service weapon, authorities said.

name: Alonzo Smith
summary: Smith died shortly after he was found unconscious and handcuffed while in the custody of special police officers, according to authorities. Special police officers are armed security guards licensed by the city. DC police are investigating the incident.

name: Matthew Colligan
summary: Deputies were pursuing Colligan, who was wanted on several charges and was driving a stolen vehicle, when one deputy crashed his car into the driver's side of Colligan's truck, according to authorities. The crash was not intentional, police said.

name: Bendetta 'Lynn' Miller
summary: State police hit Miller's car in the middle of a high-speed pursuit of a man who drove away during traffic stop, according to authorities.

name: Cesar Cuellar Jr
summary: Police shot Cuellar, an off-duty sheriff's deputy, while responding to a report that he was suicidal. Authorities said Cuellar pointed a gun at officers but Cuellar's mother said she witnessed the shooting and the gun remained at his side.

name: Delvin Simmons
lawenforcementagency: Spartanburg Methodist College Campus Safety Department
summary: Campus police at Spartanburg Methodist College shot Simmons after he struck an officer with his vehicle, according to authorities. Police were investigating a report of a car break-in and were pursuing Simmons when he got in his car, police said. Officers said they took another man into custody.

name: Kim Long
summary: A deputy shot Long while responding to a domestic violence complaint, according to authorities. Investigators did not say what prompted the shooting.

name: Miguel Cano
summary: Police said Cano ran at officers who were responding to a complaint that he was standing in the middle of a road while cars swerved to avoid him. A struggle ensued and Cano was shot with a bean-bag round, but was then able to knock one officer to the ground, take control of the bean-bag gun and fire a round. Cano was shocked with a Taser but could still not be restrained, according to authorities, leading an officer to shoot him.

name: Dale Hudson
lawenforcementagency: West Virginia State Police, US Marshals
summary: Hudson and another woman, both fugitives, opened fire on officers when the officers tried to arrest them, according to authorities. Officers killed Hudson and injured the woman, police said. Officials said Hudson was wanted on parole charges.

name: Joseph Jaramillo
streetaddress: San Ygnacio Rd SW and Tapia Blvd SW
summary: Jaramillo was shot by several deputies after allegedly ramming their vehicle with a stolen truck. Authorities said he had driven away when another deputy tried to pull him over. Two women in the truck with Jaramillo were injured and taken to hospital. Jaramillo was being prosecuted for a series of violent offences and a warrant was out for his arrest.

name: Jason Mesaros
summary: Mesaros, a suspect in a home-invasion robbery, led police from several agencies on two high-speed car chases after being spotted. He was shot by officers after 'displaying a firearm', according to authorities. Another suspect was taken into custody.

name: Eddie Sanchez
summary: Officers were confronted by Sanchez, an armed robbery suspect, when he left his house with a gun, according to authorities. Police said Sanchez was shot dead when he pointed the weapon at an officer.

name: Leonel Acevedo
summary: Police shot Acevedo when he exited a house and fired shots at officers, according to authorities. Officials later said Acevedo had taken a woman hostage and then killed her before exiting and shooting at police.

name: Javier Garcia
summary: Garcia, who was armed with a handgun and a stolen shotgun, was fatally shot by police after climbing to the sixth floor of a construction site and aiming one of his weapons toward a hospital and then at officers, according to authorities. He was said to have told police and a clerk at the store where he stole the shotgun that he wished to die.

name: Ryan Martin
summary: Two officers working on an unrelated investigation confronted Martin when they saw he was carrying a gun, according to authorities. Martin shot one of the officers in the leg and was fatally struck when both returned fire.

name: Brian Gavin
summary: Deputies responded to Gavin's home twice in one evening, first after a report of a domestic dispute and later after a report of shots fired, officials said. Police shot Gavin when they found him pointing a gun at a woman, according to authorities. The woman was not hurt.

name: Christina Prestianni
summary: Prestianni was killed by her boyfriend, a corrections officer, who killed himself after shooting her, according to authorities.

name: Frank Smart
summary: Smart, who was an inmate at the Allegheny County jail, died from a seizure with 'physical restraint' listed as a 'significant condition' in his death by the medical examiner. Smart was handcuffed and shackled while jail employees responded to a medical emergency, according to jail records.
link2text: Opinion: US prisons outsource inmate healthcare to private companies. My son died in their care

name: Johnathan Nelson
lawenforcementagency: Albertville Police Department, Marshall County Sheriff's Office
summary: Nelson was shot after jumping on a deputy's car, according to authorities.

name: Allen Swader
lawenforcementagency: Hohenwald Police Department, Lewis County Sheriff's Department
summary: Officers stopped Swader while responding to an armed robbery and stabbing when Swader began shooting at them, according to authorities. Officers returned fire and killed Swader, police said. Two officers were wounded and treated for their injuries.

name: Moises Nerio
summary: Officers shot Nerio when he allegedly charged at them with a knife. Police had arrived at his apartment complex after a woman called to report a sexual assault, according to authorities.

name: Matthew Coleman
summary: Coleman, an armed robbery suspect, was killed in an exchange of gunfire with deputies who had pursued him into some woods. Authorities said the officers were responding to a tip that Coleman was in the area. One deputy was shot in a shoulder during the encounter.

name: Michael Bartkiewicz
summary: Bartkiewicz was shot when he pointed a weapon at deputies who had arrived at his home, according to authorities. He was said to have made several threatening 911 calls.

name: Ernesto Gamino
summary: Gamino was fatally shot after fighting with a deputy who was responding to a report that someone was drinking alcohol in a park, according to authorities.

name: Ramon Salazar
summary: Police said Salazar was shot when he charged at deputies with a hammer inside a Subway restaurant. A 911 caller had reported that he was destroying things with the hammer outside the restaurant.

name: John Livingston
summary: Deputies fatally shot Livingston during a confrontation at his home, according to authorities. The officers were investigating an alleged assault. Livingston's roommate said the dispute started when Livingston refused to let deputies enter without a search warrant.

name: Unknown
summary: An off-duty housing authority police officer shot the man when he attempted to rob the officer at gunpoint in a residential street, according to authorities. A second man involved in the attempted robbery fled the scene.

name: Richard Perkins
summary: Perkins approached officers and pointed a gun at them as they towed cars involved in recent 'sideshows' of vehicle stunts, police said. Investigators later determined that the gun was a replica.
link3text: Guardian: Total killed by police at 1,000 after Oakland shooting

name: Brett Noblitt
streetaddress: Maddox Mill Rd SE and Chatsworth Hwy
summary: Deputies were chasing Noblitt, whom they suspected of driving a stolen car, and shot him when he drove his car toward them, police said.

name: Andrew Blake
summary: A deputy shot Blake after he allegedly brandished a rifle during a traffic stop. The deputy had pulled Blake over on suspicion of drunk driving, police said.

name: Jamar Clark
summary: Two police officers shot Clark when he allegedly interfered with emergency responders helping an assault victim. Activists and some witnesses claim that Clark was unarmed and handcuffed when he was shot, although police deny that he was handcuffed.
link2text: Guardian: 51 arrests at protests over shooting by police

name: Michael Tindall
summary: Officers attempted to pull Tindall over after he ran a stop sign and pursued him when he kept driving, police said. During the chase, Tindall allegedly reversed his car to hit a patrol vehicle before driving away and running off the road, according to authorities. Police shot Tindall when he exited his car and tried to get into a patrol vehicle, officials said.

name: Yohans Leon
summary: Police were pursuing Leon after he robbed a fast-food restaurant at gunpoint, according to authorities. Leon was shot after he pulled out a gun, police said.

name: Demetrius Bryant
summary: Officers were attempting to arrest Byrant on drug-related charges when he fired a shot, hitting an officer, police said. Officers returned fire and killed Bryant, according to authorities. The officer was treated for his gunshot wound and is expected to recover, police said.

name: Max Gracia
summary: Gracia died after multiple police dog bites on his thigh and leg became infected, according to a medical examiner. The dog bit him while Gracia was resisting arrest, police said, and Gracia died several days later in the Orange County jail. Gracia was arrested after allegedy robbing a convenience store at gunpoint.

name: Francis Hartnett
summary: Officers were responding to a call from Hartnett's family members concerned that he was suicidal, according to authorities. Police shot Hartnett when he approached them with a knife, investigators said.

name: Cornelius Brown
summary: Police said they shot and killed Brown after he hit the windshield of a patrol car and ignored commands from police.

name: Derry Touchstone
summary: Touchstone ignored verbal commands from the deputy and was shocked with a Taser, police said. When Touchstone continued to approached the deputy and began hitting him, the deputy opened fired, according to authorities. Police had responded to the area because Touchstone was allegedly causing a disturbance at a store.

name: Jeray Chatham
summary: A deputy shot Chatham after he lunged at him with a knife, police said. Chatham had allegedly been following a woman who had a protective order filed against him and drove away when the deputy approached him, according to authorities. The deputy followed Chatham to an apartment complex where he was shot, police said.

name: Marcus Meridy
summary: Meridy allegedly kidnapped his wife at gunpoint from her workplace. Police tracked Meridy to a to a hotel and negotiated with him before Meridy shot his wife and a state trooper, police said. The trooper returned fire, killing Meridy, according to authorities. Meridy's wife is expected to recover and the trooper was shot in his vest.

name: Randy Smith
summary: As deputies approached a 'suspicious vehicle' in a supermarket parking lot, Smith exited the car, police said. Smith and the deputies began struggling, during which both deputies used their Tasers, according to authorities. A deputy shot Smith when he allegedly pulled out a handgun.

name: Steve Dormil
summary: Dormil attacked a five-year-old girl and was holding a knife to her neck when officers arrived at the scene, police said. Officers shot Dormil when he ignored commands to drop the knife, according to authorities. The girl, the daughter of Dormil's girlfriend, died from her injuries.

name: Darick Napper
lawenforcementagency: Metropolitan Police Department of the District of Columbia
summary: An officer shot Napper when he charged at her with a knife, police said.

name: Nathaniel Pickett
summary: Pickett jumped a fence and 'became uncooperative' when a deputy stopped to question him, police said. When the deputy tried to handcuff Pickett, the two began fighting and the deputy eventually fired his weapon, according to authorities.

name: Michael Marshall
summary: Marshall, who was being held at a Denver jail, was involved in an altercation with deputies before he experienced an undisclosed 'medical emergency' and was taken to the hospital. He was taken off life support nine days later.

name: William Tarrant
summary: Deputies responded to a domestic disturbance and decided to call child welfare officials to the scene. According to police, Tarrant then pulled out a gun and pointed it at deputies.

name: Unknown
summary: Police said they encountered the man after a neighbor called to complain that the man was banging on his door. According to police the man refused officer commands, though it is not clear if police knew he had a gun when he was shot.

name: Christopher Nichols
summary: Nichols allegedly ran from an officer before the two ended up in an altercation. According to police, Nichols was on top of the officer and struck him in the face before the officer drew his weapon.

name: James Hall
summary: Hall, who was suspected of robbing convenience store, was shot as he allegedly advanced at officers with a knife and a rock.

name: Chase Sherman
summary: Sherman's mother called 911 after he had a bad reaction to a substance she believed to be 'spice'. According to authorities, Sherman and the responding deputies wound up in an altercation during which a Taser was deployed. Sherman became unresponsive shortly after.

name: Miguel Martinez
summary: A Swat team entered Martinez's home after a standoff lasting more than five hours, police said. The man, who was wanted on a robbery charge, was killed in the exchange of gunfire.

name: Henry Reyna
summary: Reyna was shot when he approached an officer while carrying a knife, police said. Officers said they were responding to a drug overdose call at the time, and that they attempted to shock Reyna with a Taser before shooting him.

name: Mathew Grows
summary: Grows allegedly shot two people before police responded, according to authorities. Officers shot him when he confronted them at the scene, police said. The men Grows shot were hospitalized for treatment, investigators said.

name: Thomas Mceniry
streetaddress: Cambridge St and E Katie Ave
summary: Police shot Mceniry when he reached for a gun, according to authorities. The confrontation started with a traffic stop and Mceniry had previously been shocked with a Taser before officers opened fire.

name: Michael Kirvelay
lawenforcementagency: Columbia Heights Police Department, Fridley Police Department
summary: Officers were responding to a domestic violence call when they shot Kirvelay, according to authorities. Police said Kirvelay was armed, but family members believe he was carrying a BB gun.

name: Barry Kirk
summary: Police killed Kirk after he shot a family of four, fatally wounding three, according to authorities. A 12-year-old survived the shooting but is criticially injured, officials said. Police shot Kirk outside of the family's house after the attack, investigators said.

name: Freddy Baez
summary: Baez exchanged gunfire with police officers at an apartment building when they responded to a domestic violence call, according to authorities.

name: Robert Edwards
summary: Edwards was struggling to walk and screaming outside of a store when police arrived, officials said. Two officers handcuffed Edwards and held him to the ground, after which he became sick and later died, according to court records. An autopsy indicated that Edwards died from the 'combined effects of methamphetamine, PCP and the stress associated with restraint procedures.'

name: Magnum Phillips
summary: Police said Phillips tried to grab an officer's gun after refusing commands to drop a knife during a confrontation at a mobile home park. The officer was responding to a report of a domestic disturbance. Neighbors said Phillips had been arguing with his partner.

name: Somer Speer
lawenforcementagency: Ozark Police Department, Christian County Sheriff's Department, Nixa Police Department, Greene County Sheriff's Department
summary: Speer was fatally shot during an exchange of gunfire with officers at a bail bonds agency where she worked, according to investigators. Police said the officers were called after she opened fire on an employee of another bail bonds agency, who had come to take her into custody in relation to criminal charges.

name: Douglas Slade
summary: Slade was shot during a confrontation with an officer who had arrived at his home following a report of domestic violence, according to authorities.

name: Rick Gullickson
summary: Gullickson was shot after coming out of his house after a three-hour standoff and pointing a handgun at deputies, according to the Stone County sheriff. Officers went to the house after Gullickson's wife called 911 and reported that he was shooting at her.

name: Unknown
summary: The man was shot dead after allegedly charging at police from his home with a baseball bat and a poker. Officers had arrived in response to a 911 call in which the man reportedly said he was murdering someone. Police said they found the man's girlfriend bludgeoned to death inside the house.

name: Hugo Celio
summary: Police said Celio was fatally shot after shooting at an officer during a downtown foot chase. Celio had run away after officers arrived at a hotel to deal with a report of a fight involving several people.

name: Justin McHenry
summary: Authorities said McHenry parked his car and walked up to a trooper's patrol car late at night, and ordered the trooper to get out. He allegedly pulled out a handun and pointed it at the trooper, who shot McHenry after failing to disarm him.

name: Lionel Kerns
lawenforcementagency: Dekalb County Sheriff's Department, Missouri State Highway Patrol
summary: Law enforcement resonded to a report of a domestic disturbance and shot Kerns when he allegedly pointed a gun at officers and ignored orders to stop, police said.

name: Ralph Aguilar
streetaddress: NW Grand Ave and N 111th Ave
summary: Aguilar was killed after he pulled out a gun while talking to deputies, according to authorities. Aguilar was allegedly suicidal and police came to his home in response to reports that he was trying to hurt himself, officials said.

name: Zachary Grigsby
summary: Police stopped Grigsby, who was driving a car with stolen license plates, and learned of multiple felony warrants for his arrest, police said. Grigsby assaulted one officer and shot another before the officers returned fire, according to authorities. Both officers are expected to recover from their injuries.

name: Unknown
streetaddress: E Alameda Pkwy and E Kentucky Ave
summary: Police said the man used a sharp object to attack an officer who had stopped to check on the man during a snowstorm. The man then allegedly stole the officer's car and drove away. Police shot the man after a car chase when he exited the car carrying an unknown object and refused to drop it, according to authorities.

name: Darius Smith
summary: Smith was a passenger in a car that was driving in the opposite direction of traffic and that crashed after fleeing a police stop, according to authorities. Smith and the driver attempted to leave the scene before Smith exchanged gunfire with officers, police said.

name: Joshua Jozefowicz
summary: Initial reports indicate that Jozefowicz was shot after he fled a traffic stop, according to police.

name: Unknown
summary: Deputies stopped two men, both of whom pulled out guns, police said. The officers opened fire, killing one of the men, according to authorities.

name: Syed Farook
summary: Farook and his partner, Tashfeen Malik, were killed by police several hours after the pair opened fire at a community center, authorities said. The mass shooting left at least 14 people dead and more than 20 wounded, according to officials. Police said Farook and Malik amassed an arsenal of four guns, thousands of rounds of ammunition and improvised explosives. Two officers were injured in the exchange of gunfire and are expected to recover, law enforcement officials said.

name: Tashfeen Malik
summary: Malik and her partner, Syed Farook, were killed by police several hours after the pair opened fire at a community center, authorities said. The mass shooting left at least 14 people dead and more than 20 wounded, according to officials. Police said Farook and Malik amassed an arsenal of four guns, thousands of rounds of ammunition and improvised explosives. Two officers were injured in the exchange of gunfire and are expected to recover, law enforcement officials said.
link1text: Guardian: Couple die in gun battle with police after mass shooting
link2text: Guardian: San Bernardino shooting: police detail gun battle as injured toll rises

name: Mario Woods
summary: Police said Woods, who allegedly stabbed someone earlier in the day, ignored commands to drop his knife and approached officers with the weapon. Video footage from a bystander appeared to show Woods circled by officers who were pointing guns at him. He appeared to be shot when he staggered to one side.
link3text: Guardian: More video footage emerges of man's fatal shooting by San Francisco police

name: Ivan Krstic
streetaddress: E McDowell Rd and N Power Rd
summary: Police found Krstic beating a steel pole against the ground and talking erratically, according to authorities. Officers shocked Krstic with a Taser when he refused to drop the pole, and shot him when picked it up and turned towards police, officials said.

name: Neil Stretesky
summary: Stretesky was killed when police attempted to serve warrants for his arrest, according to authorities. A deputy was critically injured in the shooting, police said.

name: Phillip Munoz
summary: Police were attempting to arrest Munoz for a previous an assault charge, according to authorities. Munoz was killed in an exchange of gunfire and an officer was shot in the leg, police said.

name: Allen Pacheco
summary: A trooper stopped Pacheco for a broken tail light, police said. The trooper deployed his Taser before shooting Pacheco when he tried to get into his car, according to authorities. Officials said that Pacheco told the trooper he was a convicted felon and had a weapon in his car.

name: David Winesett
summary: Winesett, a suspect in an armed bank robbery, was shot after he allegedly confronted officers with a razor blade, police said. Bystander video from the shooting appears to show an officer opening fire after Winesett takes a step toward him.
link2text: Guardian: Police fatally shoot Miami Beach robbery suspect amid Art Basel

name: Florencio Lucero
summary: Police responded to a call about a domestic dispute to find a woman, believed to be Lucero's girlfriend, with a gunshot wound, according to authorities. Officers then shot Lucero when he approached and threatened to harm them with his gun, police said. The woman died from her injuries, officials said.

name: Sheilah Huck
summary: Huck shot a woman before barricading herself inside her home, authorities said. Police entered Huck's house after a standoff and shot her when she began shooting, according to officials. Police said the woman who was shot is expected to survive.

name: Unknown
summary: The man allegedly stole two cars at gunpoint before leading police on a car chase during which he shot at pursuing officers, police said. Officers killed the man when they returned fire, according to authorities.

name: Colten Marcellus
summary: Marcellus and two other men were suspected in a home invasion, according to authorities. Police pursued the men and killed Marcellus after he opened fire, officials said. The two other men were taken into custody.
